story:
Alright guys, here is my problem.... Did you know that Polk County is the #1 county in the state of Florida for animal euthanizations? And sadly, up to 70% of pets euthanized are because of space limitations. When the pandemic hit, pet adoptions increased, thousands of pets were finally getting the home they deserved. Now with people returning to work, shelters are again at maximum capacity and are struggling to make space for these loving animals. 

I have always been, and will always be, a cat lover. Anyone that knows me, will vouch for this. If there were homeless kittens found in a dumpster, call Kristina. A mother cat abandoned her kitten, send Kristina a message. Which is how I ended up with my furbaby, Doja. 

Last year, I really began thinking, "How can I do more?" Then over the summer, I finally had the chance to visit a cat café, and let me tell you, the light bulb came on! I finally realized what I am going to do to save cats from being euthanized, and bring families together!

Purrology welcomes families to come create memorable experiences. When guests enter the cat lounge—paid by the hour—they will have hands on interactions, socializing with free roaming cats that need adoption. The loving atmosphere removes the harsh cages, which provides each feline with playtime and human interaction. This opportunity is ideal to finding the next member of your family! 

Your donations will 100% go towards creating a comfortable space for you and the cats to enjoy while at Purrology. The space has to be developed and equipped to enhance the interaction between humans and felines. The more funds we can raise, the more fun we can add to the area!

More Fun = More Memories! 

 

 

Some of you have busy lives, I get it, we have all been there, and there is no time for a pet at home. But guests are still encouraged to come cuddle and play. These activities increase socialization and create a relaxing experience for everyone.  All guests will feel at home and have the option to purchase snacks and a variety of beverages such as coffees, teas, and Italian sodas from the café section! 

✨ Rewards ✨

Your donations will make a difference! Free pick up at the café, or if you need them shipped add $5. Each donation will receive a hand written thank you to show my true appreciation.

 

One of the challenges that Purrology will encounter is the Department of Health. Having food and animals under the same roof, we must ensure that we abide by all food and safety regulations.  Another challenge will be zoning and code enforcements.  Purrology will face other eccentric challenges as the idea itself is unique.  The team at Purrology is dedicated to working through all these challenges and providing the community with a fun and interactive experience.

  • Become a volunteer
  • Share our Facebook and Instagram @purrologycafe

story:
WHO WE ARE

We Are LOCAL MAKERS-- we dare to dream and have the desire to create.

We are COMMUNITY-- neighbors, friends, and family.

When you BUY LOCAL-- you help weave the cultural threads of our neighborhoods together, support livelihoods, and fuel passions.

Pop-Local is a retail home for products created from local makers, a one-stop-shop existing to support and share the stories of independent businesses, artists and artisans local to Vancouver/Portland Metro & its surrounding area!

WE SUPPORT THOSE WHO DARE TO DREAM AND HAVE THE PASSION TO CREATE. Our mission as a company is to fuel independent businesses, connect the community, and inspire a greater local economy.

 

OUR STORY

We began our journey as a Pop-Up Store! Pictured is 'NMV Pop-Local '

In light of the unprecedented events of 2020, the concept for Pop-Local was born from a mission to help support local independent businesses, makers, and artists throughout the COVID-19 pandemic. Our current pop-up shop represents over 65 local brands and is now on the path to becoming it’s own brick-and-mortar location. As a result, the current pop-up shop location will be closing at the end of May in preparation for the move.

In order to turn this dream into a reality—and the current pop-up into a long-term Vancouver establishment—we need your help!  Although we set a launch goal at $5,000, our hope is to raise funds towards our entire buildout cost estimated to be $50,0000. All of your contributions and donations will go towards our store design, build-out costs, wall finishes, built-in shelving for merchandise, refrigeration units, and retail fixtures. We have some amazing Indiegogo Backer Perks lined up for your donations, featuring handmade products that are designed by some of our very own local vendors.  There are also options for unique memorabilia and personalized name plates that will commemorate your contribution in playing a founding role in Pop-Local’s roots.

Thank you for taking the time to join our cause!

 

HOW IT ALL STARTED 

Night Market Vancouver—another company belonging to founder Jessica Chan—was a family-friendly, monthly marketplace that occurred year-round at Terminal 1 of the Vancouver Waterfront.  Each monthly event showcased over 80 local vendors and featured live music, rotating entertainment, and food and drink for purchase.  Night Market Vancouver brought thousands of members from the community together in a fun environment to celebrate the local culture and to support small, independent businesses.

In March 2020, however, Night Market Vancouver (like so many other companies) was forced to shut down and halt all activity until further notice due to health and safety concerns in light of the novel COVID-19 virus.  As an event business that relied entirely on large public gatherings to generate revenue, Night Market Vancouver was entirely without income.  Chan was forced to pivot her business model in order to survive.  Although she has plans to bring back the Night Market Vancouver event when it is safe to do so, her primary focus shifted to building a store to continue to support local makers, crafters, and artisans throughout the on-going pandemic.  The concept for Pop-Local was created to serve as a new home for local vendors — to showcase their brands and to bring their products to market without the monthly event setup, in a safer space, and without the need for vendors to put up booths.

The Pop-Local store officially started its journey in September 2020, as a pop-up shop in the heart of historic downtown Vancouver, Washington at 111 W 9th St. as “NMV Pop Local”.  Chan was offered a temporary space by a good friend (a big thank you Most Everything Vintage) and jumped at the opportunity, driven by a desire to help some of the local businesses and people affected by the shutdown.  Thanks to the local community’s incredible reception to the pop-up store, Pop-Local has decided to go brick-and-mortar in a more permanent fashion!

 

NMV Pop-Local

From Chan's backyard to reality! A 'Before & After' look at the pop-up shop that started in 2020!

Watch our 1 minute video above that shares the story of how Pop-Local first started!

* Note: As the current pop-up shop (NMV Pop Local) is a temporary pop-up location at 111 W 9th St., we will be closing this location at the end of May to transition to the new storefront, “Pop-Local Vancouver” at 111-131 Grant St.  At that time, Pop-Local Vancouver will become its own brick-and-mortar store, and a sister company to Night Market Vancouver.

 

HOW WE OPERATE AND WHO WE SERVE 

A glimpse at the type of locally made products to expect at Pop-Local Vancouver!

THE POP-LOCAL COLLECTIVE

Pop-Local Vancouver is rooted in the intentional curation of local products to make customers feel at home.  We curate quality products on a weekly basis from brands that are local to the Pacific Northwest (primarily, the Portland/Vancouver metro area). With an established reputation for building a successful community marketplace (Night Market Vancouver), and a strong team composed of independent business owners and local makers to help curate and diversify the in-store offerings, we strive to delight customers with a unique and local shopping experience.

You can expect to find a large array of local goods, from things like handmade crafts, jewelry, art, clothing, and housewares, to fantastic snacks such as vegan baked goods, gourmet sauces, and even refreshing local brews!  With contemporary music to set the mood, a homey atmosphere, and a diverse selection of local products to shop from: Whatever your style, we know you’ll love our store!

GETTING INVOLVED AS A LOCAL VENDOR

To ensure the brands and products are in fact local, we carefully consider and evaluate everything that we put up on our shelves.  Pop-Local is making a concerted effort to ensure all of the applicants we partner with have made a genuine attempt to be as local as possible — looking at everything from where the company is based, how and where they manufacture their products, and where they procure their supplies.

The application to participate can be found through our website, and is open to businesses that are local primarily to the Portland/Vancouver metro area. If you apply, please share your in-depth “local story” with us!  If accepted, we handle the inventory in store, the merchandising, marketing, and sales!  

Find our pre-application here! Further details will be disclosed upon acceptance.

 

POP-LOCAL'S NEW HOME

Our New Home at RiverWest 111-131 Grant St. Vancouver, WA

We have found our perfect new home located in the RiverWest building at the new waterfront, right near Vancouver’s iconic Grant Street Pier! The new store will be approximately 2,000 square-feet of usable retail floor space. The goal with Pop-Local is to be a one-stop-shop for both locals and tourists.  The space will have a more elevated, industrial-modern feel than that of the current pop-up shop, but still retain a very welcoming and homey vibe.  We will be extending our product selection to include more food and beverages (like local craft beers), home goods, house plants, apparel, accessories and gift items. Of course, everything will be LOCALLY made!

Founder Jessica Chan shares her vision with local vendors for the new store at RiverWest

New Store Blueprint Concepts & Renders

'Mood board' above created by founder Jess to show her aesthetic direction for the new store. Fair use of copyrighted images may be used in the above 'Mood Board' for purposes of research and education.

 

INDIEGOGO BACKER PERKS 

Thank you for taking the time to consider joining our cause in support of LOCAL! Together we can make Pop-Local a dream come true, and build a store that represents some of the best of Vancouver’s local culture.

Your pledges mean the world to us!  Below you will find a more detailed look at our Indiegogo pledge perks, all of which have been handmade locally! These pledge perks include Indiegogo “special editions” of goods that are made exclusively for backers, featuring designs created by me and other local creators! 

There are also options for unique memorabilia and personalized name plates that will commemorate your contribution in playing a founding role in Pop-Local’s roots.

Thank you for your love and support! 

Makers gonna make! Special edition products made just for you!

PERK DETAILS 

 

VANCOUVER DESERVES A PLACE THAT CELEBRATES OUR LOCAL CULTURE

A note from the founder, Jessica Chan

Huge thank you to all of you that have supported us since the inception of Night Market Vancouver and, more recently, for my pop-up shop NMV Pop-Local! With everyone’s community support and the love shown from our local vendors, I have built up the courage and confidence to go all-in on this next venture. With a lease signed, a sizable personal investment, and loan options to help cover additional costs, I am ready to make the leap! To be clear, I am not relying exclusively on Indiegogo to back the funds of Pop-Local, instead, I hope to cover key costs with the contributions from this campaign — and additional funding coming from other sources and further loan options, as necessary.

I am fully committed to building Pop-Local into a local staple that Vancouver deserves. With your help, we can make this happen together.

WHAT'S NEXT 

 

FOLLOW POP-LOCAL

Facebook & Instagram: @poplocalvancouver
story_txt:
WHO WE ARE
We Are LOCAL MAKERS-- we dare to dream and have the desire to create.

We are COMMUNITY-- neighbors, friends, and family.

When you BUY LOCAL-- you help weave the cultural threads of our neighborhoods together, support livelihoods, and fuel passions.
Pop-Local is a retail home for products created from local makers, a one-stop-shop existing to support and share the stories of independent businesses, artists and artisans local to Vancouver/Portland Metro & its surrounding area!WE SUPPORT THOSE WHO DARE TO DREAM AND HAVE THE PASSION TO CREATE. Our mission as a company is to fuel independent businesses, connect the community, and inspire a greater local economy. OUR STORYWe began our journey as a Pop-Up Store! Pictured is 'NMV Pop-Local 'In light of the unprecedented events of 2020, the concept for Pop-Local was born from a mission to help support local independent businesses, makers, and artists throughout the COVID-19 pandemic. Our current pop-up shop represents over 65 local brands and is now on the path to becoming it’s own brick-and-mortar location. As a result, the current pop-up shop location will be closing at the end of May in preparation for the move.In order to turn this dream into a reality—and the current pop-up into a long-term Vancouver establishment—we need your help!  Although we set a launch goal at $5,000, our hope is to raise funds towards our entire buildout cost estimated to be $50,0000. All of your contributions and donations will go towards our store design, build-out costs, wall finishes, built-in shelving for merchandise, refrigeration units, and retail fixtures. We have some amazing Indiegogo Backer Perks lined up for your donations, featuring handmade products that are designed by some of our very own local vendors.  There are also options for unique memorabilia and personalized name plates that will commemorate your contribution in playing a founding role in Pop-Local’s roots.Thank you for taking the time to join our cause! HOW IT ALL STARTED Night Market Vancouver—another company belonging to founder Jessica Chan—was a family-friendly, monthly marketplace that occurred year-round at Terminal 1 of the Vancouver Waterfront.  Each monthly event showcased over 80 local vendors and featured live music, rotating entertainment, and food and drink for purchase.  Night Market Vancouver brought thousands of members from the community together in a fun environment to celebrate the local culture and to support small, independent businesses.In March 2020, however, Night Market Vancouver (like so many other companies) was forced to shut down and halt all activity until further notice due to health and safety concerns in light of the novel COVID-19 virus.  As an event business that relied entirely on large public gatherings to generate revenue, Night Market Vancouver was entirely without income.  Chan was forced to pivot her business model in order to survive.  Although she has plans to bring back the Night Market Vancouver event when it is safe to do so, her primary focus shifted to building a store to continue to support local makers, crafters, and artisans throughout the on-going pandemic.  The concept for Pop-Local was created to serve as a new home for local vendors — to showcase their brands and to bring their products to market without the monthly event setup, in a safer space, and without the need for vendors to put up booths.The Pop-Local store officially started its journey in September 2020, as a pop-up shop in the heart of historic downtown Vancouver, Washington at 111 W 9th St. as “NMV Pop Local”.  Chan was offered a temporary space by a good friend (a big thank you Most Everything Vintage) and jumped at the opportunity, driven by a desire to help some of the local businesses and people affected by the shutdown.  Thanks to the local community’s incredible reception to the pop-up store, Pop-Local has decided to go brick-and-mortar in a more permanent fashion! NMV Pop-LocalFrom Chan's backyard to reality! A 'Before & After' look at the pop-up shop that started in 2020!

Watch our 1 minute video above that shares the story of how Pop-Local first started!
* Note: As the current pop-up shop (NMV Pop Local) is a temporary pop-up location at 111 W 9th St., we will be closing this location at the end of May to transition to the new storefront, “Pop-Local Vancouver” at 111-131 Grant St.  At that time, Pop-Local Vancouver will become its own brick-and-mortar store, and a sister company to Night Market Vancouver. HOW WE OPERATE AND WHO WE SERVE A glimpse at the type of locally made products to expect at Pop-Local Vancouver!THE POP-LOCAL COLLECTIVEPop-Local Vancouver is rooted in the intentional curation of local products to make customers feel at home.  We curate quality products on a weekly basis from brands that are local to the Pacific Northwest (primarily, the Portland/Vancouver metro area). With an established reputation for building a successful community marketplace (Night Market Vancouver), and a strong team composed of independent business owners and local makers to help curate and diversify the in-store offerings, we strive to delight customers with a unique and local shopping experience.You can expect to find a large array of local goods, from things like handmade crafts, jewelry, art, clothing, and housewares, to fantastic snacks such as vegan baked goods, gourmet sauces, and even refreshing local brews!  With contemporary music to set the mood, a homey atmosphere, and a diverse selection of local products to shop from: Whatever your style, we know you’ll love our store!GETTING INVOLVED AS A LOCAL VENDORTo ensure the brands and products are in fact local, we carefully consider and evaluate everything that we put up on our shelves.  Pop-Local is making a concerted effort to ensure all of the applicants we partner with have made a genuine attempt to be as local as possible — looking at everything from where the company is based, how and where they manufacture their products, and where they procure their supplies.The application to participate can be found through our website, and is open to businesses that are local primarily to the Portland/Vancouver metro area. If you apply, please share your in-depth “local story” with us!  If accepted, we handle the inventory in store, the merchandising, marketing, and sales!  Find our pre-application here! Further details will be disclosed upon acceptance. POP-LOCAL'S NEW HOMEOur New Home at RiverWest 111-131 Grant St. Vancouver, WAWe have found our perfect new home located in the RiverWest building at the new waterfront, right near Vancouver’s iconic Grant Street Pier! The new store will be approximately 2,000 square-feet of usable retail floor space. The goal with Pop-Local is to be a one-stop-shop for both locals and tourists.  The space will have a more elevated, industrial-modern feel than that of the current pop-up shop, but still retain a very welcoming and homey vibe.  We will be extending our product selection to include more food and beverages (like local craft beers), home goods, house plants, apparel, accessories and gift items. Of course, everything will be LOCALLY made!Founder Jessica Chan shares her vision with local vendors for the new store at RiverWestNew Store Blueprint Concepts & Renders'Mood board' above created by founder Jess to show her aesthetic direction for the new store. Fair use of copyrighted images may be used in the above 'Mood Board' for purposes of research and education. INDIEGOGO BACKER PERKS Thank you for taking the time to consider joining our cause in support of LOCAL! Together we can make Pop-Local a dream come true, and build a store that represents some of the best of Vancouver’s local culture.Your pledges mean the world to us!  Below you will find a more detailed look at our Indiegogo pledge perks, all of which have been handmade locally! These pledge perks include Indiegogo “special editions” of goods that are made exclusively for backers, featuring designs created by me and other local creators! There are also options for unique memorabilia and personalized name plates that will commemorate your contribution in playing a founding role in Pop-Local’s roots.Thank you for your love and support! Makers gonna make! Special edition products made just for you!PERK DETAILS  VANCOUVER DESERVES A PLACE THAT CELEBRATES OUR LOCAL CULTUREA note from the founder, Jessica ChanHuge thank you to all of you that have supported us since the inception of Night Market Vancouver and, more recently, for my pop-up shop NMV Pop-Local! With everyone’s community support and the love shown from our local vendors, I have built up the courage and confidence to go all-in on this next venture. With a lease signed, a sizable personal investment, and loan options to help cover additional costs, I am ready to make the leap! To be clear, I am not relying exclusively on Indiegogo to back the funds of Pop-Local, instead, I hope to cover key costs with the contributions from this campaign — and additional funding coming from other sources and further loan options, as necessary.I am fully committed to building Pop-Local into a local staple that Vancouver deserves. story:
Solar Liberator dramatically reduces the complexity and cost of solar power. With an inverter, smart battery and control electronics packaged into an easy to use appliance, it requires no further setup. Solar Liberator comes in 500W, 100W and 25W variants. 

  • An out-of-the-box solution that makes switching to solar power unbelievably easy with the lowest possible up-front cost.
  • The grid-tie capable 500W unit can be easily chained in to arrays of any capacity. It is ideal for powering homes, offices or workshops etc. 
  • The 25W and 100W units are designed for extra portability and versatility of use. 
  • Use them in your car, strap it on to your backpack or bike, mount it on your camping tent or as an emergency source of power… the possibilities are endless.  
  • Use it to power up your gadgets such as phones, tablets, cameras, etc.  
  • Lightweight, can easily be folded away for storage/transport and looks cool!


Unlike most other energy sources, Solar does not cause any deforestation, water pollution, wildlife habitat destruction, ocean & rain acidification etc.

Solar Liberator is more than just a cool gadget - it is an investment. If you factor in the federal tax credit and other renewable energy benefits, you would recover your investment in two to three years and enjoy a return exceeding 30% per year.




Solar Liberator makes switching to solar power so simple that anyone can do it in minutes.


Solar energy is the future. Solar Liberator makes it affordable and accessible today. The table below compares Solar Liberator and the alternatives:

Solar Liberator has an embedded processor that runs advanced software to intelligently detect and optimize system parameters for best operational efficiency and reliable, dependable power generation.

Using the Solar Liberator apps for Android, iOS and Windows, you can constantly monitor status and be on top of your energy use and needs.


By combining all the discrete hardware components into a single device we have achieved cost savings while maintaining the highest quality. All parameters in the system are monitored and controlled by advanced software running on the built-in micro-controller to ensure the best operational efficiency and durability.

This architecture allows for unique capabilities which few other solutions in the market possess:

  • ability to push firmware updates online through the smart phone app
  • self-health monitoring and failure prediction (planned)
  • remote diagnostics (planned)

Throughout the development process, meticulous attention has been paid to maintaining quality. All components have been chosen with great care to create a product that is highly reliable and dependable in the long run.

The aesthetically designed enclosure is made out of a stylish and elegant silvery white anodized Aluminium which is extremely durable, is resilient to harsh weather conditions & scratch resistant.

All connection points in the 500W unit are sealed and have waterproof rubber jacketed connectors to withstand most adverse weather conditions. The 25W and 100W units, while having the same build quality, are not water resistant due to the built-in power sockets.


Solar Liberator comes in three variants  at 25W, 100W and 500W power output. The table below details the features and specification of each variant:

The 500W Unit

The 500W Solar Liberator unit can easily be chained for multi-panel configurations for powering homes. chaining can be done using the included chaining cables. The unit comes with a basic but robust mounting kit with which the panels can be mounted on a roof, etc. Once the mounting brackets are affixed on to the surface, the panel can be snapped on to the mounts. Up to 4 of the 500W units can be chained together and plugged into a single 15A household socket.

When plugged in, the 500W unit gets earthed via your household electrical network. Therefore please ensure that your household is suitably electrically grounded and is compliant with the national electrical safety regulations.

External battery banks can be connected to the panel array, using the high current D/C electrical terminals found underneath the unit.

Accessories included in the unit

  • Li-ion battery (capacity 1kWh)
  • Basic mounting Kit*
  • Chaining cable
  • A/C plugin connector cable (30')


The Portable Units

The highly portable 25W and the versatile 100W Solar Liberator units contain built-in A/C sockets and a variety of USB ports and DC jack connectors so that any portable device can be plugged in to the unit.  

Please note that the portable units are NOT water proof, due to the power outlet panel contained in the back of the unit. All the portable units contain Ground Fault Circuit Interrupters (GCIF) to protect against electrical shock.


The product shipped to you will contain the appropriate A/C sockets, depending on your delivery address. For example, units shipped to North America will contain NEMA 5-15 A/C sockets.

Accessories included in the unit

  • Li-ion battery (capacity 200 Wh)
  • Fastening straps





In addition to our management team, we have assembled a highly talented and skilled group of engineers, designers, and specialists who are working with us to create the best product possible. 


The above timeline shows the tasks ahead to get Solar Liberator across to you. We hope to start delivering by late April/early May. 

We have been working on Solar Liberator for the past year utilizing our personal funds to get to this point. We have individual components bread-boarded, computer simulations, CAD/CAM designs and simulations that prove our design. These have gone through iterative testing/refining for over a year. We are now working hard on building our first fully complete pre-production units. Your support will be used to take Solar Liberator into production and delivery. 

The funds raised will be used for...

  •  Production tooling and mold creation costs
  •  Designing the supply chain process
  •  Manufacturing and meeting minimum order quantity requirements of our manufacturers
  •  Packaging design and sourcing
  •  Certification costs (UL 1741, UL 498, UL 943 & FCC certification)
  •  Setting up delivery and support channels

With your help, we can make Solar Liberator available to you and millions of others who would otherwise not have been able to enjoy the many benefits of solar power.


1. What kind of setup does it require?

Solar Liberator does not require any setup at all. It is fully integrated and functional straight away out of the packaging. You can simply place it where sunlight falls and it will start generating power. Connecting the 500W Solar Liberator to your home is as simple as plugging it into a wall socket.

2. Does it work in gloomy weather?

On overcast days where there is reasonable cloud cover, the power capacity can drop but with the battery backup it could sustain a consistent supply. 

3. What happens on rainy days?

On rainy days the solar irradiance is much lower than on a sunny day, and hence the amount of energy generated by your Solar Liberator will be much less than normal. Nevertheless, depending on the capacity and charge level of the batteries of your Solar Liberator, you can continue drawing power from it as normal.

4. Can I use it at night?

The battery pack that comes with the unit will be sufficient to keep it functional for up to 2 hours at full capacity. If the power being drawn from the unit is less, it will last longer. 

It is also possible to add more battery units to enhance the use of the unit at night, in gloomy weather, etc.

5. Why is Solar Liberator different from other solar power solutions?

Most of the solar power generation units out there are commercial solutions for which you need to hire a contractor who will assemble the system at your premises and wire it into your house! These systems will cost you anywhere from $15,000 to $50,000 upfront. These solutions are sometimes a good choice if you think you will need over 10KW of power.Solar Liberator is designed to be the right choice if your needs are below 10KW (which is the vast majority of households) or if you want to slowly transition to solar energy one step at a time without committing to a large system upfront. 

Further, Solar Liberator’s portable, flexible and extensible design and fully integrated packaging makes it the most sensible choice if you want to add solar power to non traditional living spaces and vehicles such as boats, caravans, mobile homes, sheds, etc..

On the other end you have small DC only low power solar panels that sometimes succeed in charging your phone etc.. but generally these are nothing more than toys or junk that gets thrown away or forgotten after sometime.

6. What about warranty of the components?

The high grade poly-crystalline PV cells come with 25 year warranty from the original manufacturers. Each Solar Liberator unit will carry a 5-year materials and workmanship warranty which includes the electronics. The minimum design lifespan for the electronics is 10 years, but should last much longer. The included Li-ion batteries are designed to last 5 years by the use of advanced software optimized charging cycles and thermal dissipation control. They are warranted for a minimum of one year.

7. How can I claim Federal and state benefits for renewable energy when I get a Solar Liberator?

With the 500W Solar Liberator, you should be entitled to claim the 30% federal tax credit and also may be eligible to claim various other state and federal benefits for renewable energy. Prior to delivery, we will convert your Indiegogo contribution into a purchase and provide you with the necessary invoices and documents that will enable you to claim these benefits.


1. Do Solar Liberator units work with European and other international electrical systems as well as the US?

Absolutely. The portable units (25W and 100W) have a voltage selector switch to select the output voltage/frequency. The socket panel in these units will come with appropriate A/C sockets according to your delivery address. For example the units shipped to the US will contain Type B (NEMA 5-15) A/C sockets, whereas units shipped to the UK will contain Type G (BS 1363) sockets.

Similarly, the 500W unit will be supplied with a plug that is compatible with your local standards. The grid-tie capability in the 500W unit detects the voltage/frequency of the grid supply it is connected to, and outputs power to your home’s electrical network with the exact same voltage/frequency/phase (from 100V -250V and 50/60 Hz).

2. What precautions are taken to prevent the 500W unit from reverse feeding power output when the grid supply is down?

In grid-tie mode, Solar Liberator will shut down power output if the grid supply goes down, to prevent reverse feeding. This is a requirement for the UL 1741/IEEE 1547 certification which is the standard required by most utility companies for equipment that feeds power into their grids.

3. Can the 500 watt units be used off-grid?

There are two separate outlets for grid-tie and ‘Always On’ off-grid output. This is for safety and to prevent accidentally connecting the wrong output to the grid. The grid-tie output can simply be plugged into a wall socket using the provided cable, whereas you need to draw cabling and connect up the off-grid output terminals via a transfer switch that disconnects the grid when operational.

4. How does the unit know to output power when connected to a transfer switch that has triggered due to utility grid failure? Wouldn’t the unit still believe it was in island protect mode?

The grid tie output will shut down when the utility supply goes down. If you have wired the ‘Always On’ off-grid out put through a transfer switch, when the transfer switch triggers, then your house will be supplied power from the ‘Always On’ output, and is isolated from the grid.

5. I saw that 4 is the maximum number of 500W panels that can be chained. Does this mean you can also have more than 1 set of 4 chained 500W units plugged into separate sockets or is there a limitation of 4 units per house?

The 4-unit limit is such that the maximum rated current (usually 15A) is not exceeded for the wall socket you are plugging the Solar Liberator array into.  You can have multiple sets of 4 units plugged in – as long as each set plug into a different breaker circuit and you do not exceed the max current of the circuit.

6. I don’t completely understand how the unit will power my house by being plugged into an outlet, is there anywhere that explains this properly?  Is this power available throughout the house?

When you plug the 500W Solar Liberator unit in to a wall socket, the unit will feed the generated solar power into your home’s electrical network, just like the power line that comes to your house from your utility Company. This is achieved by the grid-tie circuitry built-in to the Solar Liberator unit. Therefore the power that is fed into the household network in this way can be drawn from any other socket in the house or even flow back onto the grid (if you have net metering setup with your utility company, you could get credited for the excess power that flows back to the grid).

7. How durable are 500W units to be in a purely outside environment?  Will they be able to stand up to hail, heavy rain, snow, ice, freezing temperatures, and high winds? How will freezing temperatures effect the internal battery and the unit as a whole? 

The Solar Liberator unit is made out of anodized Aluminum with acrylic sheets covering the PV cells. It is designed to endure difficult weather conditions such as heavy rain and snow, etc.  The battery and the electronics are housed in a weather-proof casing.  The software uses advanced thermal and charge management to ensure the longevity of the battery and electronics.  The battery by design can operate at temperatures down to -20 C (though performance may deteriorate).

For extreme low temperatures though, we recommend removing the batteries to minimize damage to the batteries.

8. How will it stand up to high temperatures?  How does it protect the batteries and electronics from heat?

The panels and the electronics themselves will operate at 50+ C. The internal structure and circuitry have sophisticated heat dissipation mechanisms. But if the ambient temperature itself is above 40 C, the battery will deliver minimal power as the software will keep things quiet to minimize stress on the batteries.

9. Has the mounting been tested for high winds? What kind of wind speed can it handle?

The units and mounting has been tested for wind speeds of 50kmph/30 mph.

In areas where high winds and gusts over 80kmph/50mph are common, we recommend mounting the units on the ground or using windbreaks and the use of specialized reinforced mounting systems.

10. What kind/brand of solar panels do you use in the 500W unit?

We do not use generic/branded solar panels. Solar Liberator uses a 8 × 16 grid of standard 6inch crystalline Photo-voltaic cells that are integrated into the unit and makes up the panel. Each of the 128 cells, has a peak power output of 4.2W for a theoretical peak output close to 538W.

11. For a roof installation of the 500w units, can the installation be done by a homeowner, or do you recommend an installer. Any specific installers you recommend?

Mounting the unit is straightforward and electrical setup is as simple as plugging the cabling that runs from the unit into a wall socket. It is reasonably assumed that this can be carried out by an adult familiar with basic DIY work. If you are not comfortable with setting it up yourself, we would recommend that you seek the assistance of a professional in your locality.

12. Do I have to have net metering setup with my utility provider in order to use Solar Liberator?

You do not have to have a net metering agreement with your utility provider.  But if you do have a net metering agreement, the excess power that flows from your home to the grid will get metered as well and be credited by your utility company.  If you do not have net metering setup, and the units generate more power than you are consuming, no power will be drawn from the grid and your meter would come to a halt.

13. How much does the 500W unit weigh?

The 500W panel weighs 20kg with battery of which the battery weighs 8kg.

14. Is there a need to replace the internal battery pack when they die? Can we unplug it on the unit?

All Solar Liberator units can function without the battery pack. The battery pack will enhance performance of the unit though, with evened-out, smooth power delivery as the sunshine fluctuates and by providing backup power when the sun does not shine at all.

Batteries can be easily removed or replaced. Replacement batteries will be available once the deliveries start.

15. Will the unit function fine with the “computer” resetting each time the sunlight is lost or would “grid” tied models have some way of trickling power to the main board to keep things going?

The microcontroller we use is a very low powered component that can draw power from any of the power sources available (solar panels, battery and grid). If all power sources are lost, it will reset and recover on power being regained.

16. What is level of configuration that the software allows for the user? Can we activate/deactivate the batteries?  

The software does not allow battery configuration in order to keep things simple for the user. The software does everything intelligently to achieve the best balance in performance, longevity and overall health of the unit.

17. I would love to get more information about your Li-Ion batteries?

The Li-ion battery is a sealed battery cartridge that consists of 128 standard Li-ion 18650 2,350 mAh battery cell with voltage level of 3.7V. The battery charging and thermal cycles are controlled by the internal software, which is part of the innovation in Solar Liberator, and is optimized for best performance and battery life.

18. It would also be great to get info on the extra batteries. What would be the max battery storage for the 500W unit?

Additional batteries will be available once deliveries start. The unit comes with a single 1kWh battery cartridge. But the unit can house up to 4 batteries giving you 4 kWh of storage, which is enough to draw peak power for 8 continuous hours.

500W unit also supports connecting up external Lead-acid battery banks to expand storage capacity even more.

19. How easy is it to integrate an external battery bank into the system with all the other components continuing to function properly?

The 500W unit supports connecting external Lead-acid battery banks using the high current DC terminals provided in the unit. Solar Liberator will automatically integrate the external battery bank into its energy management scheme.

20. What is the hardware that is inside the unit? Do you use open hardware such as Nanode, Raspberry Pi, etc?

While we are fully supportive of open architecture, the hardware inside the Solar Liberator is proprietary and we do not use open hardware. The reason for this is primarily the safety critical nature of the devices, hence minimizing unneeded complication. In addition, if the hardware/firmware was user modifiable this may invalidate certification.

21. Have you considered adding a NIC, using DHCP, for easier configuration? How do we enter the SSID and password for local wireless network?

There is a built-in WiFi NIC which connects to your local wireless network and configures using DHCP. Administrative configuration interface for Solar Liberator is accessed via Bluetooth, where you can configure the units to use a specific wireless network with SSID/password.

22. Will we have control of the “data” or is it all going to a central cloud?

Yes – you absolutely have control over whether the data gathered by the internal software ever leaves the boundaries of your privacy. You have the option to enable/ disable ‘Anywhere Monitoring’, which works via our servers and accessed via the smart phone app.

The table below details the features and specification of each variant:The 500W UnitThe 500W Solar Liberator unit can easily be chained for multi-panel configurations for powering homes. chaining can be done using the included chaining cables. The unit comes with a basic but robust mounting kit with which the panels can be mounted on a roof, etc. Once the mounting brackets are affixed on to the surface, the panel can be snapped on to the mounts. Up to 4 of the 500W units can be chained together and plugged into a single 15A household socket.When plugged in, the 500W unit gets earthed via your household electrical network. Therefore please ensure that your household is suitably electrically grounded and is compliant with the national electrical safety regulations.External battery banks can be connected to the panel array, using the high current D/C electrical terminals found underneath the unit.Accessories included in the unit

Li-ion battery (capacity 1kWh)


Basic mounting Kit*


Chaining cable


A/C plugin connector cable (30')

The Portable UnitsThe highly portable 25W and the versatile 100W Solar Liberator units contain built-in A/C sockets and a variety of USB ports and DC jack connectors so that any portable device can be plugged in to the unit.  Please note that the portable units are NOT water proof, due to the power outlet panel contained in the back of the unit. All the portable units contain Ground Fault Circuit Interrupters (GCIF) to protect against electrical shock.The product shipped to you will contain the appropriate A/C sockets, depending on your delivery address. For example, units shipped to North America will contain NEMA 5-15 A/C sockets.Accessories included in the unit

Li-ion battery (capacity 200 Wh)


Fastening straps

In addition to our management team, we have assembled a highly talented and skilled group of engineers, designers, and specialists who are working with us to create the best product possible. The above timeline shows the tasks ahead to get Solar Liberator across to you. We hope to start delivering by late April/early May. We have been working on Solar Liberator for the past year utilizing our personal funds to get to this point. We have individual components bread-boarded, computer simulations, CAD/CAM designs and simulations that prove our design. These have gone through iterative testing/refining for over a year. We are now working hard on building our first fully complete pre-production units. Your support will be used to take Solar Liberator into production and delivery. The funds raised will be used for...

 Production tooling and mold creation costs


 Designing the supply chain process


 Manufacturing and meeting minimum order quantity requirements of our manufacturers


 Packaging design and sourcing


 Certification costs (UL 1741, UL 498, UL 943 & FCC certification)

 Setting up delivery and support channels
With your help, we can make Solar Liberator available to you and millions of others who would otherwise not have been able to enjoy the many benefits of solar power.1. What kind of setup does it require?Solar Liberator does not require any setup at all. It is fully integrated and functional straight away out of the packaging. You can simply place it where sunlight falls and it will start generating power. Connecting the 500W Solar Liberator to your home is as simple as plugging it into a wall socket.2. Does it work in gloomy weather?On overcast days where there is reasonable cloud cover, the power capacity can drop but with the battery backup it could sustain a consistent supply. 3. What happens on rainy days?On rainy days the solar irradiance is much lower than on a sunny day, and hence the amount of energy generated by your Solar Liberator will be much less than normal. Nevertheless, depending on the capacity and charge level of the batteries of your Solar Liberator, you can continue drawing power from it as normal.4. Can I use it at night?The battery pack that comes with the unit will be sufficient to keep it functional for up to 2 hours at full capacity. If the power being drawn from the unit is less, it will last longer. It is also possible to add more battery units to enhance the use of the unit at night, in gloomy weather, etc.5. Why is Solar Liberator different from other solar power solutions?Most of the solar power generation units out there are commercial solutions for which you need to hire a contractor who will assemble the system at your premises and wire it into your house! These systems will cost you anywhere from $15,000 to $50,000 upfront. These solutions are sometimes a good choice if you think you will need over 10KW of power.Solar Liberator is designed to be the right choice if your needs are below 10KW (which is the vast majority of households) or if you want to slowly transition to solar energy one step at a time without committing to a large system upfront. Further, Solar Liberator’s portable, flexible and extensible design and fully integrated packaging makes it the most sensible choice if you want to add solar power to non traditional living spaces and vehicles such as boats, caravans, mobile homes, sheds, etc..On the other end you have small DC only low power solar panels that sometimes succeed in charging your phone etc.. but generally these are nothing more than toys or junk that gets thrown away or forgotten after sometime.6. What about warranty of the components?The high grade poly-crystalline PV cells come with 25 year warranty from the original manufacturers. Each Solar Liberator unit will carry a 5-year materials and workmanship warranty which includes the electronics. The minimum design lifespan for the electronics is 10 years, but should last much longer. The included Li-ion batteries are designed to last 5 years by the use of advanced software optimized charging cycles and thermal dissipation control. They are warranted for a minimum of one year.7. How can I claim Federal and state benefits for renewable energy when I get a Solar Liberator?With the 500W Solar Liberator, you should be entitled to claim the 30% federal tax credit and also may be eligible to claim various other state and federal benefits for renewable energy. Prior to delivery, we will convert your Indiegogo contribution into a purchase and provide you with the necessary invoices and documents that will enable you to claim these benefits.
1. Do Solar Liberator
units work with European and other international electrical systems as well as
the US?
Absolutely. The portable units (25W and 100W) have a voltage
selector switch to select the output voltage/frequency. The socket panel in
these units will come with appropriate A/C sockets according to your delivery address.
For example the units shipped to the US will contain Type B (NEMA 5-15) A/C
sockets, whereas units shipped to the UK will contain Type G (BS 1363) sockets.

Similarly, the 500W unit will be supplied with a plug that
is compatible with your local standards. The grid-tie capability in the 500W
unit detects the voltage/frequency of the grid supply it is connected to, and outputs
power to your home’s electrical network with the exact same voltage/frequency/phase
(from 100V -250V and 50/60 Hz).
2. What precautions
are taken to prevent the 500W unit from reverse feeding power output when the
grid supply is down?
In grid-tie mode, Solar Liberator will shut down power output
if the grid supply goes down, to prevent reverse feeding. This is a requirement
for the UL 1741/IEEE 1547 certification which is the standard required by most
utility companies for equipment that feeds power into their grids.
3. Can the 500 watt
units be used off-grid? 
There are two separate outlets for grid-tie and ‘Always On’ off-grid
output. This is for safety and to prevent accidentally connecting the wrong
output to the grid. The grid-tie output can simply be plugged into a wall
socket using the provided cable, whereas you need to draw cabling and connect
up the off-grid output terminals via a transfer switch that disconnects the
grid when operational. 
4. How does the unit know
to output power when connected to a transfer switch that has triggered due to
utility grid failure? Wouldn’t the unit still believe it was in island protect
mode?
The grid tie output will shut down when the utility supply goes
down. If you have wired the ‘Always On’ off-grid out put through a transfer
switch, when the transfer switch triggers, then your house will be supplied
power from the ‘Always On’ output, and is isolated from the grid. 
5. I saw that 4 is
the maximum number of 500W panels that can be chained. Does this mean you can
also have more than 1 set of 4 chained 500W units plugged into separate sockets
or is there a limitation of 4 units per house?
The 4-unit limit is such that the maximum rated current (usually
15A) is not exceeded for the wall socket you are plugging the Solar Liberator
array into.  You can have multiple sets
of 4 units plugged in – as long as each set plug into a different breaker circuit
and you do not exceed the max current of the circuit.
6. I don’t completely
understand how the unit will power my house by being plugged into an outlet, is
there anywhere that explains this properly?  Is this power available throughout the house?
When you plug the 500W Solar Liberator unit in to a wall
socket, the unit will feed the generated solar power into your home’s
electrical network, just like the power line that comes to your house from your
utility Company. This is achieved by the grid-tie circuitry built-in to the
Solar Liberator unit. Therefore the power that is fed into the household
network in this way can be drawn from any other socket in the house or even
flow back onto the grid (if you have net metering setup with your utility company,
you could get credited for the excess power that flows back to the grid).
7. How durable are 500W
units to be in a purely outside environment?  Will
they be able to stand up to hail, heavy rain, snow, ice, freezing temperatures,
and high winds? How will freezing temperatures effect the internal battery and
the unit as a whole? 
The Solar Liberator unit is made out of anodized Aluminum
with acrylic sheets covering the PV cells. It is designed to endure difficult
weather conditions such as heavy rain and snow, etc.  The battery and the electronics are housed in
a weather-proof casing.  The software
uses advanced thermal and charge management to ensure the longevity of the
battery and electronics.  The battery by
design can operate at temperatures down to -20 C (though performance may
deteriorate).
For extreme low temperatures though, we recommend removing
the batteries to minimize damage to the batteries.8. How will it stand
up to high temperatures?  How does it
protect the batteries and electronics from heat?
The panels and the electronics themselves will operate at
50+ C. The internal structure and circuitry have sophisticated heat dissipation
mechanisms. But if the ambient temperature itself is above 40 C, the battery
will deliver minimal power as the software will keep things quiet to minimize
stress on the batteries.9. Has the mounting been
tested for high winds? What kind of wind speed can it handle?
The units and mounting has been tested for wind speeds of
50kmph/30 mph.
In areas where high winds and gusts over 80kmph/50mph are
common, we recommend mounting the units on the ground or using windbreaks and
the use of specialized reinforced mounting systems. 
10. What kind/brand of
solar panels do you use in the 500W unit?
We do not use generic/branded solar panels. Solar Liberator
uses a 8 × 16 grid of standard 6inch crystalline Photo-voltaic cells that are
integrated into the unit and makes up the panel. Each of the 128 cells, has a
peak power output of 4.2W for a theoretical peak output close to 538W. 
11. For a roof installation
of the 500w units, can the installation be done by a homeowner, or do you
recommend an installer. Any specific installers you recommend?
Mounting the unit is straightforward and electrical setup is
as simple as plugging the cabling that runs from the unit into a wall socket. It
is reasonably assumed that this can be carried out by an adult familiar with
basic DIY work. If you are not comfortable with setting it up yourself, we
would recommend that you seek the assistance of a professional in your locality.12. Do I have to have
net metering setup with my utility provider in order to use Solar Liberator?

You do not have to have a net metering agreement
with your utility provider.  But if you
do have a net metering agreement, the excess power that flows from your home to
the grid will get metered as well and be credited by your utility company.  If you do not have net metering setup, and the
units generate more power than you are consuming, no power will be drawn from
the grid and your meter would come to a halt.
13. How much does the
500W unit weigh?
The 500W panel weighs 20kg with battery of which the battery
weighs 8kg.
14. Is there a need
to replace the internal battery pack when they die? Can we unplug it on the
unit?
All Solar Liberator units can function without the battery
pack. The battery pack will enhance performance of the unit though, with evened-out,
smooth power delivery as the sunshine fluctuates and by providing backup power
when the sun does not shine at all.
Batteries can be easily removed or replaced. Replacement batteries
will be available once the deliveries start.
15. Will the unit
function fine with the “computer” resetting each time the sunlight is lost or
would “grid” tied models have some way of trickling power to the main board to
keep things going?
The microcontroller we use is a very low powered component
that can draw power from any of the power sources available (solar panels,
battery and grid). If all power sources are lost, it will reset and recover on
power being regained.
16. What is level of
configuration that the software allows for the user? Can we activate/deactivate
the batteries?  
The software does not allow battery configuration in order
to keep things simple for the user. The software does everything intelligently
to achieve the best balance in performance, longevity and overall health of the
unit.
17. I would love to
get more information about your Li-Ion batteries?
The Li-ion battery is a sealed battery cartridge that
consists of 128 standard Li-ion 18650 2,350 mAh battery cell with voltage level
of 3.7V. The battery charging and thermal cycles are controlled by the internal
software, which is part of the innovation in Solar Liberator, and is optimized
for best performance and battery life.18. It would also be
great to get info on the extra batteries. What would be the max battery
storage for the 500W unit?
Additional batteries will be available once deliveries
start. The unit comes with a single 1kWh battery cartridge. But the unit can
house up to 4 batteries giving you 4 kWh of storage, which is enough to draw
peak power for 8 continuous hours.

500W unit also supports connecting up external
Lead-acid battery banks to expand storage capacity even more.19. How easy is it to
integrate an external battery bank into the system with all the other
components continuing to function properly?
The 500W unit supports connecting external Lead-acid battery
banks using the high current DC terminals provided in the unit. Solar Liberator
will automatically integrate the external battery bank into its energy
management scheme.
20. What is the hardware
that is inside the unit? Do you use open hardware such as Nanode, Raspberry Pi,
etc? 
While we are fully supportive of open architecture, the
hardware inside the Solar Liberator is proprietary and we do not use open hardware.
The reason for this is primarily the safety critical nature of the devices, hence
minimizing unneeded complication. In addition, if the hardware/firmware was
user modifiable this may invalidate certification.
21. Have you
considered adding a NIC, using DHCP, for easier configuration? How do we enter
the SSID and password for local wireless network?
There is a built-in WiFi NIC which connects to your local wireless
network and configures using DHCP. Administrative configuration interface for
Solar Liberator is accessed via Bluetooth, where you can configure the units to
use a specific wireless network with SSID/password.
22. Will we have
control of the “data” or is it all going to a central cloud?
Yes – you absolutely have control over whether the data
gathered by the internal software ever leaves the boundaries of your privacy. You
have the option to enable/ disable ‘Anywhere Monitoring’, which works via our
servers and accessed via the smart phone app.

story:
Have you ever been at the beach enjoying the Sun on your skin, the sand in your toes, and the quality time with your best friends only to find you have to cut the trip short because you’re out of water and snacks? With Beachside Squeeze, you can say buh-bye to abbreviated beach trips.

Hi there! Let me introduce myself: My name is Tasha. Beachside Squeeze is my dream, a way to be a part of and contribute to the beach community here in Brevard County, Florida—the Space Coast! Beachside Squeeze will be a food truck run by myself, selling my signature natural fruit-infused waters (because let’s face it, water is better when it’s flavored), hand crafted snacks, and freshly brewed iced teas.

Emerging from a year of pandemic isolation, who hasn’t gained the “quarantine 15” from ordering one too many pizzas? Let’s switch it up with some healthier alternatives during your day in the sun.

Check out the menu below!

 

 

Before moving to Florida’s east coast, I lived in Cincinnati, Ohio where my family and I volunteered at one of the longest running festivals for nearly 20 years, managing a pretzels and nachos booth. The joy I experienced serving my community in Cincinnati still lives within me today. Once I moved to Melbourne, Florida and began exploring the internationally renowned beaches, I noticed a need for greater variety in food options along the A1A highway. I came to find that the only choices in most areas were trucks selling deep fried anything: the last thing I want on a hot, humid day at the beach.

I aim to give customers what I crave myself when I go to the beach: convenient, rejuvenating, and affordable options that quickly get me back to enjoying the ocean. After doing my own research along the coast of Brevard County, there is nothing like Beachside Squeeze out there.

I truly believe that when presented with this option in my stylish truck appropriately located on the east side of the A1A, customers will come to admire Beachside Squeeze for its revitalizing choices of fruity waters, teas, and light snacks.

 

Growing up in Girl Scouts, I learned to respect the environment while enjoying the beauty of hiking trails. After every camping trip, we made sure the campground was spotless, instilling the idea of "leave the place better than you found it” deep in my values. Florida beaches are some of the most sacred places in the country, so it’s incredibly important to me to preserve them in all their beauty.

I will be incorporating these environmentally conscious efforts into Beachside Squeeze by utilizing eco-friendly compostable paper products and no straws. We will use the adult “sippy cup” style cup to minimize the waste and plastic of straws. Additionally, my truck will use one of the quietest generators on the market so as not to disturb the rich wildlife of the Florida coast.

My truck will also be located on the right side of the A1A highway to ensure the safety of beachgoers, eliminating the need to cross the dangerous highway with minimal pedestrian crossings.

 

I’m asking for your help in raising $5,000 so I can purchase a retired Airport Shuttle, which I will then design and remodel myself for the needs of Beachside Squeeze. Most food truck renovations cost tens of thousands of dollars, but seeing as electricity is all I need for my refrigerators, I’ve opted for the more economical route: installing the equipment myself.

Any amount you can give would help immensely and be greatly appreciated. Buying the truck is the biggest hurdle of this entire process so with your help, we can all sit back, relax, and sip a refreshing Key Lime Water.. Or Strawberry Lemon Water… or Passion Fruit tea!

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

There are always risks when it comes to the food industry, but what it ultimately comes down to is a delicious menu at the right price point. Moreover, Beachside Squeeze is a very different concept for an area saturated with deep fried and high calorie options. However, I know that with my trendy branding and healthy choices, beach goers will come to appreciate the unique concept.

My ideal location is Canova Beach where dogs are allowed to roam and where there’s plenty of foot traffic. There is much to navigate when it comes to local permitting at Canova Beach, which is the main reason for the lack of food trucks in the area, however it is possible. If for some reason the permitting at Canova doesn’t work out for me, there are plenty of other beaches nearby that are easier to gain permit approval. Those areas will require a bit more creativity on my part in building a customer base, but it’s nothing I can’t handle.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

I understand that not everyone is able to contribute financially to this project. However, I would be very thankful for your support and encouragement. Please share this on your social media pages and email EVERYONE you know. Look for the share tools at the top of this campaign. You can also follow the development of Beachside Squeeze on Facebook and Instagram. With your help, we can make this happen!

 

THANK YOU!   THANK YOU!   THANK YOU!

story:
TL;DR/DW - We are people who nerd out over good coffee and want to bring that passion to the wonderful city of Yakima while creating a culture of love and beautiful community!

 

So... What is Happening Here?

My wife, Alaena and I have always been coffee snobs of sorts. We frequent new shops wherever we go to enjoy the experience. We have worked in the coffee industry for roughly 16 years collectively ranging from Starbucks to independent shops. We have always dreamed about starting our own shop! Back in the fall of 2018 I began work at a shop in Portland called Haven Coffee Co. We had been long time customers that love the family (Jerry, Jane, Nate and Ariel Bennett) that own and operate the shop. I reached out to Nate and told him my heart about learning more about coffee so that one day I could use that experience to do my own. They brought me on board with them and since then I have been learning so much about the industry from an owner's point of view and continue to gain knowledge that will impact Alaena and my own coffee business someday. In March 2020, Haven shut it's doors due to COVID-19. The owners decided to make the most of their down time and broke ground on a full remodel of the shop. Luckily, I was brought back on during this time to help with the remodel. While I was working on the remodel, Alaena and I really started to envision starting our own shop in the near future. After a lot of prayer and brainstorming we began to seriously consider venturing out and starting our own shop we both felt that God is leading us to take a step of faith to make our dream reality.

After making the decision to move forward we started to ask the big questions like, where do we build our community and where do we open a business and what do we call ourselves? Portland is the coffee mecca making it is extremely difficult to open something new in a place that is so over saturated. So we thought through locations such as Beaverton, Tigard, Hillsboro, Sherwood and Bethany (all locations fairly close to where we live now). As we went down the list we began to mark them off due to either the location being too close to an already established shop or just not the best location for a shop. That is when I started to think about outside of Portland. A place we already know and a place that is growing year after year and doesn’t really have the “designer” coffee experience already...Yakima Washington! We lived there for a time when we took over the youth group at the Yakima Vineyard Church. Yakima has always been a place of family and community for us where we have so much support. We discussed where a good place would be and what it could look like. One day we started thinking about the Yakima Vineyard as a possible shop location. The church building is a beautiful 100+ year old building  with a lot of space and it has a café already built into the side of it.  When we brought the proposal to the team at the church we got a green light. Now with a door open we began the discussion about what would we call our little shop? As we pondered what we want to stand for and what we want our impact to be we came to Catalyst Coffee Co. The word catalyst fits our mission as a shop driven towards community and ministry. We strongly desire to have a deep impact on the community in Yakima. 

Now this is where you come in! We are launching this Indiegogo as a way to help us start funding our way to our grand opening such as the remodel and business related issues. We want you to partner with us on this adventure and support us as we fight for our dream.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

Remodel costs and initial living costs will be the primary until we open the doors in the (hopefully) early fall. We need to have some funds on hand to start moving forward. We will need to obtain the proper equipment, and supplies. We will be able to do the majority of the work ourselves with the help of a couple friends that work in the construction industry. We are aiming to keep the startup  costs fairly low.

With your donations you will be able choose from different perks. i.e. cups, shirts, hoodies, discounts and more! We have lined up some pretty sweet merch that we think you will enjoy.

The Impact

We believe that Yakima is a place where we can truly make an impact in the coffee community. Yakima is known for their hops, fruit, and breweries but we would love to add coffee to that list.

Why us? Not only being coffee "snobs" we also have work collectively in the industry for 16ish years. Be it from managing in the corporate coffee world or just being a barista at a little hole in the wall. We have been around and know a thing or two about this thing. Outside of the coffee world we have worked for other well know businesses that have taught us a thing or two about the business world as well. 

Risks & Challenges

We understand that this is an interesting time to open a new business. Relocating our family and starting a small business in a rather crazy time is a risk in and of itself. However, we have a large support group already advocating for us to succeed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course we would love and appreciate everyone to give to this but we also are realists and understand that this is a difficult time. Another way you can support us is by sharing this with your friends and family or on Facebook, instagram, tiktok(ha), Linkedin, Twitter, vine, AIM, and email. 

 

Again thank you for just even taking time to read through this.

Much Love and Grace,

The Stahls

(James, Alaena & The Three Stahl Kids )

After making the decision to move forward we started to ask the big questions like, where do we build our community and where do we open a business and what do we call ourselves? Portland is the coffee mecca making it is extremely difficult to open something new in a place that is so over saturated. So we thought through locations such as Beaverton, Tigard, Hillsboro, Sherwood and Bethany (all locations fairly close to where we live now). As we went down the list we began to mark them off due to either the location being too close to an already established shop or just not the best location for a shop. That is when I started to think about outside of Portland. A place we already know and a place that is growing year after year and doesn’t really have the “designer” coffee experience already...Yakima Washington! We lived there for a time when we took over the youth group at the Yakima Vineyard Church. Yakima has always been a place of family and community for us where we have so much support. We discussed where a good place would be and what it could look like. One day we started thinking about the Yakima Vineyard as a possible shop location. The church building is a beautiful 100+ year old building  with a lot of space and it has a café already built into the side of it.  When we brought the proposal to the team at the church we got a green light. Now with a door open we began the discussion about what would we call our little shop? As we pondered what we want to stand for and what we want our impact to be we came to Catalyst Coffee Co. The word catalyst fits our mission as a shop driven towards community and ministry. We strongly desire to have a deep impact on the community in Yakima. 
Now this is where you come in! We are launching this Indiegogo as a way to help us start funding our way to our grand opening such as the remodel and business related issues. We want you to partner with us on this adventure and support us as we fight for our dream.
 

What We Need & What You Get
 
Remodel costs and initial living costs will be the primary until we open the doors in the (hopefully) early fall. We need to have some funds on hand to start moving forward. We will need to obtain the proper equipment, and supplies. We will be able to do the majority of the work ourselves with the help of a couple friends that work in the construction industry. We are aiming to keep the startup  costs fairly low.
With your donations you will be able choose from different perks. i.e. cups, shirts, hoodies, discounts and more! We have lined up some pretty sweet merch that we think you will enjoy.

The Impact
We believe that Yakima is a place where we can truly make an impact in the coffee community. Yakima is known for their hops, fruit, and breweries but we would love to add coffee to that list.
Why us? Not only being coffee "snobs" we also have work collectively in the industry for 16ish years. Be it from managing in the corporate coffee world or just being a barista at a little hole in the wall. We have been around and know a thing or two about this thing. Outside of the coffee world we have worked for other well know businesses that have taught us a thing or two about the business world as well. 

Risks & Challenges
We understand that this is an interesting time to open a new business. Relocating our family and starting a small business in a rather crazy time is a risk in and of itself. However, we have a large support group already advocating for us to succeed.

Other Ways You Can Help
Of course we would love and appreciate everyone to give to this but we also are realists and understand that this is a difficult time. Another way you can support us is by sharing this with your friends and family or on Facebook, instagram, tiktok(ha), Linkedin, Twitter, vine, AIM, and email. 
 
Again thank you for just even taking time to read through this.
Much Love and Grace,
The Stahls
(James, Alaena & The Three Stahl Kids )

story:
Today, kids can graduate from university with a PhD without knowing how to boil an egg or shop for groceries. Our new restaurant, SAV Eatery + Smokehouse is more than just a place to get fantastic Low Country comfort food in Stratford, Ontario. We will also be offering cooking classes for kids 16 and under free of charge to help them develop self-sufficiency and a love of growing, cooking, and eating fresh local foods. 

This Indiegogo campaign helps us to build the infrastructure and programming for our kids' programs. Including space for these classes increases both the cost of the lease, the amount of kitchen equipment required, and the city building code requirements. 

Please take a moment to watch our video and look at some of the great rewards we provide to contributors. Thanks for your support!
