story:
We’re Back with More!

After a successful debut on Kickstarter of our original design project--TubShroom®-- we’re back with our second creation called SinkShroom™, which is made specifically to protect your sink drain. 

 

 Thanks to more than 2,000 original Kickstarter and almost 2,000 IndieGoGo In-demand backers, our original invention came to life. TubShroom® is now the #1 best-seller in the category on Amazon and on its way to the retail channels across the nation. TubShroom® is now protecting drains in over 75,000 homes! And the number of the loyal "Shroom" fans is growing each day. 

The product reviews have been phenomenal and many of you had asked for the same simple solution for your bathroom sink drains. Well, we listened, and now we present to you the one and only... SinkShroom™.

 

We have tested the SinkShroom™ vigorously. And yes, it does a great job catching hair, jewelry and anything in-between, while the water continues to flow freely. 

And the best part is that for the price of just a couple of bottles of Dran-o or Liquid Plumr, you are getting a solution that will prevent clogs and last for many years.  

SinkShroom™ is based on the same revolutionary concept as TubShroom®. It goes inside the drain, stopping hair, jewelry and other undesired objects from going down the drain preventing nasty and hard to deal with clogs. It’s designed to fit any standard bathroom sink that is 1.25” in diameter. It comes in the same colors to match your TubShroom® plus we're adding a new color – Silver/Gray to match the chrome/stainless steel appliances. You will be able to pick the color of your choice in the survey that will be sent to you at the end of the campaign. 

Both SinkShroom™ and TubShroom® are patent-pending. We feel confident that our winning designs can become the standard in bathroom drain protection around the world, eliminating the need for harmful chemical cleaners or costly plumber visits. We've set out to make the planet--and your wallet--greener than it would be otherwise. 

Installation literally takes seconds and when it comes to performance, SinkShroom™ is second to none.  If your sink is equipped with a stopper, it can easily be removed. Just loosen the screw located below the sink and pull out the stopper. 

For such a small product, the benefits are numerous. If you've tried other drain protectors or hair strainers already, you know how much room there is for improvement in this space. SinkShroom™ gets it right every time. 

For those of you that missed our first campaign and haven’t had a chance to enjoy the benefits of a TubShroom®, we offer SinkShroom™ + TubShroom® combos. 

And here's how the original TubShroom® works...

 

 

 

Cleanup is fast and extremely easy!

 

Combos packs are available in this campaign.  

Here're some of the recent Amazon reviews of the TubShroom®:

 

We would like to thank all our new and existing backers as well as IndieGoGo for making our first project possible and look forward to another successful campaign. Thank you!
story_txt: We’re Back with More!After a successful debut on Kickstarter of our original design project--TubShroom®-- we’re back with our second creation called SinkShroom™, which is made specifically to protect your sink drain.   Thanks to more than 2,000 original Kickstarter and almost 2,000 IndieGoGo In-demand backers, our original invention came to life. TubShroom® is now the #1 best-seller in the category on Amazon and on its way to the retail channels across the nation. TubShroom® is now protecting drains in over 75,000 homes! And the number of the loyal "Shroom" fans is growing each day. The product reviews have been phenomenal and many of you had asked for the same simple solution for your bathroom sink drains. Well, we listened, and now we present to you the one and only... SinkShroom™.Meet the new SinkShroom™ We have tested the SinkShroom™ vigorously. And yes, it does a great job catching hair, jewelry and anything in-between, while the water continues to flow freely. And the best part is that for the price of just a couple of bottles of Dran-o or Liquid Plumr, you are getting a solution that will prevent clogs and last for many years.  SinkShroom™ is ready to serve and protect :)SinkShroom™ is based on the same revolutionary concept as TubShroom®. It goes inside the drain, stopping hair, jewelry and other undesired objects from going down the drain preventing nasty and hard to deal with clogs. It’s designed to fit any standard bathroom sink that is 1.25” in diameter. It comes in the same colors to match your TubShroom® plus we're adding a new color – Silver/Gray to match the chrome/stainless steel appliances. You will be able to pick the color of your choice in the survey that will be sent to you at the end of the campaign. Both SinkShroom™ and TubShroom® are patent-pending. We feel confident that our winning designs can become the standard in bathroom drain protection around the world, eliminating the need for harmful chemical cleaners or costly plumber visits. We've set out to make the planet--and your wallet--greener than it would be otherwise. Installation and Maintenance IllustrationInstallation literally takes seconds and when it comes to performance, SinkShroom™ is second to none.  If your sink is equipped with a stopper, it can easily be removed. Just loosen the screw located below the sink and pull out the stopper. SinkShroom™ in ActionFor such a small product, the benefits are numerous. If you've tried other drain protectors or hair strainers already, you know how much room there is for improvement in this space. SinkShroom™ gets it right every time. For those of you that missed our first campaign and haven’t had a chance to enjoy the benefits of a TubShroom®, we offer SinkShroom™ + TubShroom® combos. And here's how the original TubShroom® works...TubShroom® in Action TubShroom®  Cleanup is fast and extremely easy! Combos packs are available in this campaign.  TubShroom® and SinkShroom®Here're some of the recent Amazon reviews of the TubShroom®: We would like to thank all our new and existing backers as well as IndieGoGo for making our first project possible and look forward to another successful campaign. Thank you!

story:
The campaign has ended - many thanks to everyone who contributed!




Visit the official AXIOM Beta website!




As seen on:









If the crowd-funding campaign reaches at least the following amounts we will be able to develop the following items:

€110,000 - AXIOM Beta Remote Control with Real Buttons and Knobs

AXIOM Beta Remote Control concept rendering

We will develop an AXIOM Beta wired remote control device complete with LCD, buttons, knobs and dials (no live video monitoring). A wireless design might be possible, but needs more testing.

Estimated retail price of the Remote Control will be around €300 (gross estimate)



€120,000 - Active Canon EF Mount

We will develop an AXIOM Beta EF lens mount module with electronic lens control. This will allow setting aperture and focus (with the Remote Control or from a smartphone/tablet) with most Canon EF lenses when attached to the AXIOM Beta.

Canon EF Mount retail price will be around €300 (gross estimate)


€130,000 - AXIOM Beta Active Battery Mount

AXIOM Beta with battery (concept image - work in progress)

We will develop a battery mount for NP-F970/F750/F550 batteries to power the AXIOM Beta. Includes power usage and capacity monitoring to estimate remaining charge and time remaining.



€150,000 - AXIOM Beta 4K RAW PC recording option

We will research and develop a method to stream and record real time 4K RAW video from the AXIOM Beta to a PC. The goal is to design an affordable interface card solution that will be available in Q2 2015.






AXIOM Beta is a brand new professional digital image capturing platform and you get access to it before anybody else does. So we want to make sure that you are aware of what you are getting yourself into. We're inviting you to be part of this journey as a contributor (you do not need to be a programmer to use the AXIOM Beta), helping to shape the final product. 

apertus° was started by filmmakers who were fed up with the limitations of the tools they had to work with every day. Compared to 50 years ago, cameras today are technologically far superior, but at same time a lot less accessible. AXIOM Beta intends to fix that. Full and open documentation, the ability to add new features, change behavior of existing ones and to use any custom accessories are intended and plausible goal of AXIOM Beta.


The plan is to democratize camera technology and put the power back into the hands of the users. It is a self liberation by creating high end tools that we ourselves love to work with - fully independent of any of the big established camera corporations. The time has never been better for such a revolution than it is today!


By contributing to this project you enable the evolution of to a new stage of cameras, a whole new world of possibilities. Your ideas and experiences will help us advance AXIOM in the future. The crowd funding backers community will play an active role in deciding where the AXIOM development is heading.

We created a proof-of-concept prototype to get a feel what moving images from the 4K global shutter image sensor are like.  This is the AXIOM Alpha, which we sometimes call “the shoebox prototype”:

Even at this early stage, the fully rigged AXIOM Alpha was surprisingly nice to handle even for handheld shooting.



Download AXIOM Alpha Sample Footage color-graded and ungraded as DNxHD Files

Another sample footage edit with a completely different look achieved in color-grading:




Please note that these are the specs of the image sensor not the AXIOM Beta, we will try our best to utilize as much performance as possible from each sensor.

Truesense(Kodak) KAC12040

Cmosis CMV12000

Diameter

4/3”

Super35/APS-C

Aspect Ratio

4:3

4:3

Resolution

4000x3000

4096x3072

max. Frame Rate

70 FPS

300 FPS

Shutter Type

Global / Rolling (switchable)

Global

Dynamic Range

12 F-stops (Rolling Shutter)
9.3 F-stops (Global Shutter)

10 F-stops, up to 15 F-stops (HDR)

Crop Factor

2.0

1.6


IO Shields

Triple HDMI Shield:
3x HDMI out each up to 1080p60 4:4:4 (4K RAW output via experimental HDMI formats)

Experimental Alternating Frame High Speed output (3x 1080p60 = 180 FPS)

Breakout Shield:
IO Breakout shield for developers

more shields will follow (eg. 3G-SDI, TC, Genlock, Trigger IO, etc.), see Future Additions

Image Processing

  • in-camera looks (4 channel LUTs) for flat/log mode per output (fully customizable)

  • real time: matrix color conversion, Fixed Pattern Noise correction, false color display, dead pixel compensation, look around, overlays

  • Entire image processing in real time through Reprogrammable Hardware (FPGA) leading to zero CPU load

Lens Mounts (passive)

  • Nikon F
  • Canon EF
  • Micro Four Thirds

(PL mount, IMS mount, Sony E-mount and electronic lens control later on, see Future Additions)

Misc

  • HDR and logarithmic response curve options (depending on image sensor)

  • built-in 3D accelerometer, 3D magnetometer and 3D gyroscope sensors(9DOF-IMU e.g. for image stabilization)

  • wide 5 - 40V input range (via built-in DC-DC converter, power monitored & power managed)

  • estimated enclosure dimensions:
    108mm x 69mm x 37mm

Xilinx Zynq 7010/7020 based MicroZed

"Look-Around" allows you to see objects in viewfinder before they enter the frame.

Smartphone control of all camera parameters over WIFI (using compact router).




We set out on a journey to create a documentary film to learn how Hollywood reacts to new and open technology. Truth is: Open Source has already arrived there, and people are curious yet critical of this new quality.


To continue the “Hollywood loves Open Source” documentary film we will follow the story of how the AXIOM Beta progresses and how Hollywood will react to it with additional interviews and insights.



Upgrade Path:

Crowd funding backers will be offered an exclusive upgrade path to the production version of AXIOM. (probably called AXIOM Gamma) Essential components, like image sensors will be reusable as well.

Terms & Conditions

Crowd funding backers will receive AXIOM Beta at cost, payment is due at Ship. Current price values are gross estimates and depending on actual production volume might be a lot lower.

AXIOM Beta will also be made available as retail product once all crowd funding backers received their units, retail price will be significantly higher (not at cost) to support a sustainable open hardware business model.

You will get an official invoice from us when we received your AXIOM Beta payment.

AXIOM Beta has standard EU limited warranty against manufacturing defects.

If your camera gets damaged outside the warranty coverage we will offer fairly priced replacement parts for purchase.

Each € 500 development donation entitles you to one AXIOM Beta unit only.

AXIOM Beta will be delivered as assembled & tested or unassembled (with individual components tested) development kit without CE/FCC certification.

Local taxes (VAT), custom fees or duties may apply when receiving your AXIOM Beta. 

For certain countries export regulations regarding specific electronic components might apply.

All software that we create in the course of AXIOM Beta development will be released under the GNU GPL V2 and all hardware under CERN OHL V1.2.

The Open Source revolution was initially started by technicians and programmers but we are witnessing that we are already in the middle of the next phase where artists and creative people join in. This is key to Open Source’s global acceptance.


Fairness is what we believe Open Source ethics basically boils down to. This goes hand in hand with caring about the environment when we plan production or pick the raw materials.

Upgrade Instead of Replace is a key motto for all our designs and naturally leads to modularity and more flexible devices, as their longevity is already ensured at the design stage.

Fair Working Conditions for our employees are important to us. So we decided to not go where the labour cost is the lowest but instead do as much as we can in-house or at partner companies we trust to follow the same ethics standards as we do.

More on: https://apertus.org/opensource


The largest part of the raised money will go directly into development of the AXIOM Beta (salaries, tools, hardware, prototyping, services, etc.) Another large part will be infrastructure, creating workspace for camera testing/assembly.

We will maintain a limited reserve fund both as a safety net to ensure production of your AXIOM Beta and as a financial buffer so we can start production of the ordered units before all full payments have arrived. This will reduce rollout time significantly. Another reserve will be created to cover warranty and returns.


We are in this boat together. We already built the AXIOM Alpha prototype successfully, and are very eager to bring you the AXIOM Beta. It is always a possibility that we might suffer from delays, caused by electronic component shortages or shipping delays as well as having to do additional revisions for parts to ensure optimal quality.

In every case we are committed to full transparency about the process and the achieved progress. We will share with our backers and community the things that require additional attention or caused delays just as much as we’ll report about success and finished components.


Our crowdfunding video and sample footage is released under a Creative Commons License (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). Download it here: https://apertus.org/axiom-alpha-sample-footage and remix & share your own creations!


Is an external recording device required for the AXIOM Beta?

That very much depends on what you want to do with your device and the resulting amount of data per second. For recording low bandwidth data (i.e. high resolution at low framerate or low resolution at high framerate) an external recording device is not required. You can store the data on microSD or transfer it to a device connected through Ethernet, USB or even WiFi. For high resolution and high framerate you will need a suitable recorder connected via a high speed interface like HDMI, SDI or similar.

Why are you giving away the AXIOM Beta so much under retail price? What is the catch?

With the AXIOM Beta we do not seek to just find customers that purchase cameras. We want to lay the foundation for an active community that is ready to participate in defining and shaping where the AXIOM development is going and that is able to work with pre-production hardware and test new features as they arrive providing valuable feedback and contributions to the apertus° development team and community. That’s why we give the hardware away to those people at cost.

Are AXIOM cameras going to be available as unassembled DIY kits only?

No, the AXIOM beta will come assembled and fully operational straight out-of-the-box. For people who are interested in receiving their camera unassembled and in separate parts (so as to make modifications and/or re-arrange them in a non-standard manner), there will be the possibility to do so, however we are not expecting this to be the norm.

Do I need to be a programmer to use the AXIOM Beta?

Not at all, software which doesn't require any programming skills will be developed on and for the AXIOM Beta, so all you need to do is to wait a litte till it is useable. During the early stages it won't hurt to have some skills or at least the willingness to learn from and contribute to the software development.

Do I need to be a programmer to use any future AXIOM?

No, absolutely not! It is of great importance to us that you - the end users - are able to access the source code and the blueprints for our designs. Whilst everything is open hardware / free software, this does not mean that you are required to study our code and implement changes. If you simply wish to use the AXIOM for film making purposes, it will operate in a manner similar to any other camera you might have used before. There may come a day, however, when you want your camera to function in a manner beyond what it was initially intended to do. In these scenarios, it's great to be able to access the source files (required for modification) and re-program the hardware as you see fit.

What dynamic range can I expect?

The CMV12000 sensor provides 10 stops out of the box. Various tricks can be used to increase the dynamic range up to 15 stops. We are confident to have at least 12 stops of dynamic range without impacting the image's quality.

The Truesense (Kodak) has 12 F-stops (Rolling Shutter) and 9.3 F-stops (Global Shutter)

The CMV12000 sensor supports three different High Dynamic Range (HDR) modes.

  • One mode alters the sensors photo-site response curve from a linear default behavior to a shape that is closer to a logarithmic response. This happens before the ADC so no digital data is sacrificed for the additional dynamic range.
  • The second mode uses different exposure times for even and odd pixel columns. So two exposure brackets can be captured at the same time for sacrificing horizontal resolution.
  • The third mode is possible due to the high speed nature of the sensor allowing alternating exposure times with each recorded frame and doubling/tripling/etc. frame rate result in double/triple/etc. the amount of data to be captured.
The response curve processing happens before the ADC so no digital data is sacrificed for the additional dynamic range.

Am I obliged to buy the camera if I fund development now?

You can decide later if you would like to buy the camera for the exclusive crowd- funding perk offer or not. There will be a specific point in time though when we will contact all perk holders as only with a high production volume we will be able to reduce the manufacturing cost for everyone.

Does the AXIOM Beta include a video recorder?

No, the AXIOM Beta has no built in recorder, but will provide several options and add-ons to allow recording. Currently we advise to use any existing HDMI recorder. We will work closely with manufacturer to provide “out of the box” compatibility from the popular recorders.

This being said, the camera includes multiple micro-SD ports, so you WILL be able to record 4K RAW still images out of the box. The micro SD card just doesn’t allow motion picture recording.

story:
YOGA ON KIBBY: A NEIGHBORHOOD STUDIO

My name is Kate Burns from Kate Burns Yoga online! I started teaching yoga in 2013 at Yoga Studio Deeplyart in Jackson, Michigan after completing my 200 hour Yoga Teacher Training. I since have completed a 500 & 750 hour teacher training at Hilltop Yoga Lansing.

Since I began teaching, it's been my dream to open a studio in Jackson. I truly believe in the power & connection of our community.

 

CLASSES AT YOGA ON KIBBY

Our yoga classes will be for all levels and styles of practitioner, from basics to advanced, to meditation, and sound healing.

We will have in person classes & virtual classes. Our simple online registration platform allows students to sign up for classes ahead of time. Our spacious studio allows the space to spread out and maintain a comfortable distance from other students.

Offered class types:

  • Ashtanga
  • Basics yoga
  • Chair yoga
  • Gentle yoga for seniors
  • Hatha yoga
  • Hot yoga
  • Meditation
  • Prenatal yoga
  • Restorative yoga
  • Slow flow
  • Sound healing
  • Workshops

These classes will be taught by excellent & skillful teachers in the Jackson community. All Yoga on Kibby teachers are certified by the Yoga Alliance at the 200 hour level & 500 hour level.

 

CERTIFIED TEACHING

Starting July of 2021, Yoga on Kibby will be an accredited Yoga Alliance Yoga School offering continuing education workshops for yoga teachers and students alike.  CE credits are required for certified yoga teachers to maintain their certifications and are exciting and educational ways to broaden your yoga knowledge and experience.

 

BACKER REWARDS - THE GOOD STUFF

Knowing that you personally made Yoga on Kibby a reality will be your longest lasting reward but we know you want the goods, too! So take a look and make your pick!

Update: You can now add-on a "Single Class Pass" to any of the packages below. You will see this option at checkout.

 

Yoga on Kibby - Sticker Pack

Yoga on Kibby stickers (3 total) including a beautiful holographic variation!

Yoga on Kibby - Tote Bag

Yoga on Kibby Tote Bag (for your things)

Yoga on Kibby - Tank Tops

Yoga on Kibby Tank Top: Choose from Indigo or Light Orange!

Yoga on Kibby - T-Shirt

Yoga on Kibby Black Tee — keeping it simple with this classic!

Super Cozy Yoga on Kibby Crewneck

The coziest crewneck around. Yoga on Kibby branded.

Restorative Yoga Workshop

This cozy workshop will focus on relaxation using the aid of props to avoid strain or pain while being completely supported. Restorative yoga allows you to ease into comfort and stimulates the parasympathetic nervous system helping to reduce stress in the body & mind. This workshop is limited to 8 students. CDC guidelines and proper safety will be followed.

Workshop Date: Saturday May 1st from 9:30-11 a.m.

Class Packages at Yoga on Kibby

These class credits can be used for any yoga class, both in-person and virtually, with any instructor!

 

HOW YOUR LOVE & SUPPORT WILL BE USED

We are working hard to create a welcoming and cozy space where you can come for yoga & community. This is a space to recharge your well-being. To achieve this we are currently renovating the flooring, installing a fitting room, adding additional windows for air flow and natural light, and furnishing a spot to chill.

 

YOGA ON KIBBY ONLINE

  • Facebook: facebook.com/yogaonkibby
  • Instagram: instagram.com/yogaonkibby
  • Website: yogaonkibby.com

YOGA ON KIBBY MEDIA

  • JTV with Bart Hawley
  • Off the Mat Chat w/ Michigan Tribe
story_txt:
YOGA ON KIBBY: A NEIGHBORHOOD STUDIOMy name is Kate Burns from Kate Burns Yoga online! I started teaching yoga in 2013 at Yoga Studio Deeplyart in Jackson, Michigan after completing my 200 hour Yoga Teacher Training. I since have completed a 500 & 750 hour teacher training at Hilltop Yoga Lansing.Since I began teaching, it's been my dream to open a studio in Jackson. I truly believe in the power & connection of our community. CLASSES AT YOGA ON KIBBYOur yoga classes will be for all levels and styles of practitioner, from basics to advanced, to meditation, and sound healing.We will have in person classes & virtual classes. Our simple online registration platform allows students to sign up for classes ahead of time. Our spacious studio allows the space to spread out and maintain a comfortable distance from other students.Offered class types:
Ashtanga
Basics yoga
Chair yoga
Gentle yoga for seniors
Hatha yoga
Hot yoga
Meditation
Prenatal yoga
Restorative yoga
Slow flow
Sound healing
Workshops
These classes will be taught by excellent & skillful teachers in the Jackson community. All Yoga on Kibby teachers are certified by the Yoga Alliance at the 200 hour level & 500 hour level. CERTIFIED TEACHINGStarting July of 2021, Yoga on Kibby will be an accredited Yoga Alliance Yoga School offering continuing education workshops for yoga teachers and students alike.  CE credits are required for certified yoga teachers to maintain their certifications and are exciting and educational ways to broaden your yoga knowledge and experience. BACKER REWARDS - THE GOOD STUFFKnowing that you personally made Yoga on Kibby a reality will be your longest lasting reward but we know you want the goods, too! story:
We're so excited to bring you this little pin campaign, which features hard enamel pins designed by Mel & Sara and commissioned artwork from four of our artists. Stay tuned for magical travels across some of our favorite fantasy worlds!

What Inspired The Campaign?

We've been working on this Ghibli campaign in the background for quite some time. The movies have always been an inspiration for us in small and large ways. They shaped much of our childhood with their wide worlds, various characters and stirring stories. Organizing these back-to-back projects was a way to create fun things stemming from timeless memories while still helping the community.

Profits from this campaign will go toward the production of the pins, then back to individuals in our art community to help them along during this trying time. Ghibli's works were always a reflection and narrative of current times; we hope our campaign sets the tone and voice of what we want to be right now.

Why Indiegogo?

We chose Indiegogo because we've used it for several projects and felt it offered the best experience and ease of use for our backers. Most importantly, the platform has also reduced costs this month to help small businesses with the COVID crisis. Some reasons to pledge now:

•  Campaigners will get the first pins made of these sets plus any extra goodies we unlock! You'll also receive a discount code for Part II of the Ghibli Mementos project if The Path of Wind (Part I) is successfully funded.
•  You get to pay a lower cost for pins in the campaign, with decreased pricing for multiple pins (and early bird promotions). Costs post-campaign are always adjusted.
•  You can support a small business supporting artists!

** All pins are considered specialty pins! They have a black nickel plating, made with hard enamel and zinc metal. All have a raised logo backstamp with two pegs & rubber clasps. You will have the option for adding metal clasps with the surveys.**

Haku & Mononoke are special additions! How they work is, if they're unlocked, people can substitute them or add them to their base pledge for the cost difference of the pins, OR order them separately through our online store. They're a fair bit larger than the standard pins (which is why there's a cost difference)!

ADD-ON ITEMS!

You can add any of the items below by pledging for a tier with the additional amount! (Please note if the tier already includes the item listed, you'd get a duplicate in that case!)

For this campaign, we've commissioned four fantastic artists to work with us for various items. You've already seen one in the header banner with Mononoke (a piece by KoboldArt which you'll see again in Part II), but we'll also have unlockable metallic foiled postcards by Aun Hana, Isvoc and Chrisqi! We also have additional art feedback and help from the wonderful Thunderpot.

The purpose of this campaign is to fund the production of the pins, ship the rewards and pay the contributors. While we still have credit card fees, Indiegogo has graciously provided the opportunity for small businesses to host their projects this month without the platforming fee, allowing us to give more back to the artists.

The breakdown below is only to fund the original run of 3 sets of pins with shipping. As profits increase, contributions will get funneled into Part I & Part II's costs, particularly with contributor payments so that we can pay them up front (instead of based off of sales at the end).

For this project, we'll be using a traditional pin production timeline! Artwork for the three potential cards will all be done within the month of April - so you'll get to see them worked on (and possibly completed) within that timeframe.

As always, we disclaimer that the timeline can shift if crazy things happen. (As most are aware, things like COVID are unexpected and can impact production in ways no one expects. Our last pin project was hit hard by COVID. We, however, don't anticipate that the pandemic will impact the campaign once the pins arrive! Regardless, we will always keep you informed.)

For domestic shipments:

•  1 - 5 pins are sent via First Class mail. It is tracked and should arrive in 3-5 days of it hitting the mailstream!
•  6+ pins are upgraded to Priority Class mail. It is tracked and insured, and typically will arrive in 1-3 days of it hitting the mailstream! (This is a complimentary upgrade for this campaign!)

For international shipments:

•  By default, all international shipments are tracked to the border; we use DHL International shipments, and most shipments arrive within 2-4 weeks.
•  Shipping is offered internationally at a base for $6!
•  We're happy to add insurance and extra tracking at cost if you want to make sure and watch it from door-to-door. Generally this is $2-5 USD depending on location.

More pins are available on our site: alchemyartgroup.com if you'd like anything else! We do a variety of different styles with various inspirations! We'd love to see you there if you're able to support.

Social Media: Instagram | Twitter | Tumblr | Email

Thanks again to everyone who supported us! If you have any questions, please let us know or check out our FAQ! We're really looking forward to making these pins & supporting the community.

story:
Here we go!

 

It's time for Seb's to take the leap

from online to real life and we're

beyond thrilled to invite you

to join the party!

 

 

            

Seb & Susan

  • Seb's is a mom & son operation based in East Vancouver, with the goal of opening a family-friendly, community-driven, sensory-sensitive, all-inclusive café & retail space in our Commercial Drive neighbourhood.
  • We've been delivering made-in-East Van goods all over Greater Vancouver since December 2020, always with the view of providing a storefront for our local vendors and a menu chock full of the deliciousness that our wickedly talented local food entrepreneurs are already cooking up, right here in our 'hood!
  • Seb's exists specifically to serve our neighbours, whether that be through the warm & welcoming hospitality that will be extended to our guests, or the community outreach that's built into our budget and we're so excited to invite you to jump in with us now, so we can all build this dream together.

 

Where will your dollars go?

We're hoping to raise $75k, which will go towards: 

  • Indian Residential School Survivors Society | KidSafe Project Society | Grandview Woodland Food Connection | Eastside Family Place. A portion of your pledge will be donated to one of these amazing organizations, the higher the pledge, the bigger the donation and you get to choose where those dollars go. Click the links above to do a deeper dive on each organization, so that you can learn about the amazing things they're doing for our community and make an informed choice about where you'd like us to direct donations. Seb's will also continue to support these organizations in the long term.
  • Lease deposits & utility startup costs, once we find the perfect spot! Rest assured that Seb's will be on The Drive and we won't be settling for any other neighbourhood. This isn't to say that there aren't other fabulous 'hoods in the city, it's simply that The Drive is home to Seb & Susan, it's the neighbourhood that we live in, belong to, feel safe in and know how to serve best.
  • Design. Build out. Equipment. Fixtures & fittings. We'll be hiring local, inclusion-informed designers & consultants, East Van trades people and as much as possible, purchasing materials & equipment locally.
  • Toys, games & other fun stuff to keep the kids happy! Imagine a place where your kids feel at home and welcome to be themselves while they play foosball, LEGO or chess (and maybe even some wicked fun arcade games!), or curl up in a quiet corner with a book, all while you sit back with a local beer and something delicious to eat.
  • Inventory. We're going to need to stock our retail shelves high & create kick ass food & beverage programs. As always, everything Seb's serves & sells will be either made in East Van or will come from an East Van based company.
  • Hiring & inclusivity consultants. We want to support our community through employment and intend to pay our staff exceedingly well. We also intend to be an inclusive workplace and will be consulting with local organizations on how to best support our neurodiverse neighbours into well-paid, meaningful jobs at Seb's.
  • Community outreach. Every single dollar that goes into Seb's will be staying in our community and a lot of those dollars will go into our community outreach programs, through direct sponsorships, meal programs, educational workshops, community art initiatives...the possibilities are endless!

 

Club Seb

This is the pledge perk that we're most excited about and it's included at every tier!

Club Seb is a concept born of the desire to try to find a way to mitigate some of the risks that come along with operating a hospitality business on the super tight margins that the industry is so well known for.

As a member, you can sign up for a monthly subscription, which affords you a monthly store credit of $5-$20, free tea or coffee every time you come in, exclusive updates & voting power and a place on our in-store wall of fame, which includes a family mini session with a local photographer and a take-home print! Depending on what tier you go for, your pledge today will get you either a lifetime or one year membership to Club Seb!

Feel free to pop over to our Patreon page to read all about it....

 

Back us & you're backing them, too!

          The East Van small business circle of support is so very strong and has the potential for exponential growth...everything you buy from Seb's, we bought from our East Van vendors first and you know what? Our vendors like to support local, too! More often than not they're using local suppliers for the ingredients, packaging & tools that go into creating your favourite products AND they employ local people! If you really think about it, the delicious Jamaican patties that you bought from Seb's and had for dinner last night are yes, the product of Chris's hard work, love and dedication but they also represent dollars spent in multiple local supply chains and the livelihoods of so many of our neighbours.

   The bigger Seb's gets, the more dollars we spend in our community! The Seb's East Van Vendor list is already 20+ strong and we're bringing in new local talent every week! Pop over to our Fabulous East Van Vendor page to have a peek at all of the beautiful brands that we carry.

Risks & Challenges

We're very aware that we're entering a world with many risks & hurdles to overcome and these are the reasons that we believe that we'll be able to stand proud and unflinching in the face of any challenge that comes our way:

  • You. Seb and Susan have been through a world of shit together over the past few years and through it all, our community has been there to back us up, cheer us on and lift us up whenever we've needed it. It's the knowledge that you are behind us that makes it possible to even have this dream and it's the main motivator behind the drive to make it a success.
  • Seb. We're building this business to serve our community but the really big picture for Susan is that it's building a future for her son. Seb’s  is a family business in the strongest sense of the term. Not only is it a place where Seb himself will be provided with opportunities for learning, employment and perhaps one day ownership but it's also a vehicle for building a family of community around him, so that he always knows that he belongs and is safe right where he is and that the people around him know him and love him.
  • Susan. If you haven't met me (just gonna write in first person for this bit!), you might not know how single-minded I can be when I have a goal to work towards. This has been a lifelong trait of mine that has seen me through two transatlantic moves, a self-funded university degree, starting two businesses and now, finding ways to support my little family alone. I spent over a decade working in every iteration of the hospitality industry, from cooking, serving, bartending & nightclub coat check girl, to supervisory & management roles and most recently food production and retail. I pride myself on my resourcefulness...if it needs doing, I will undeniably find a way.
  • If we don't reach our full Indiegogo goal (we know, it's a lofty one!), we'll barrel ahead regardless. Seb & Susan have put time, heart, soul and their own cash into this business and giving up is not an option! The funds that are raised here should be enough to get our foot in the door, after which time we would be able to go to the bank to seek debt funding and we're also very open to partnering up with investors. Feel free to email us at heyneighbour@sebscafe.ca for more info on that

 

                                           

What do we mean by sensory-sensitive?

When you come into Seb’s, you’ll likely notice that things feel a little different from your typical café environment. That’s because Seb’s is going to be a sensory-sensitive space.  Here are a few of the things we're going to do to try to help make things a little more comfortable for our neurodiverse neighbours and we'll always try to honour any requests for accommodations:

  • Quiet coffee options. Say goodbye to the bashing, grinding, clattering espresso machine!
  • Natural/calm & diffused lighting.
  • ​No brain melting hand dryers in the washrooms!
  • Easy access to written (instead of verbal) options for communicating with staff.
  • We’ll always aim to keep noise, odours & the distance between guests at a comfortable level.

​

​                                  

Other Ways That You Can Participate

We know it, money is tight! Absolutely zero hard feelings if you can't contribute financially to this project! Instead you could:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about Seb's! Tell anyone and everyone that you know about this wicked small local business that supports other small local businesses and that we're looking for more folks to join the party!
  • Use the Indiegogo Sharing Tools at the top right of this page for a quick and easy way to spread the word on socials or by copying the link and including it in a heartfelt email, text or DM to all of your besties!
  • If you'd like to contribute but aren't interested in receiving perks, hit the 'Back It' button at the top right of this page and enter your desired pledge (and thank you!).

Some details regarding perks:

  • We're expecting that most folks who make a pledge will be local Vancouverites, so we'll be offering either local delivery or pickup of any physical perk items but if you're a more distant neighbour, fear not...we'll be in touch to collect shipping info!
  • The estimated delivery date of Sep 2021 is for physical items...it might take a little longer for us to be able to invite you in for the in store/café perks.
  • Club Seb store credit will be available as soon as the campaign is complete, which will be around mid-August!
  • We'll be in touch to ask about size & colour options for wearables. There will be baby onesies, kids tees & hoodies and adult sizes, too!

                                                           

Credits: videography & editing by Jo Gyurkovics

Brand design: Salt Design Co.

Photos: all Susan's

Come visit us at sebscafe.ca & @sebscafecandcornerstore
