story:
Opening the Doors of the Andes to the World

My name is Jorge Delgado. I am a Systems Engineer and Senior Craftsman living just outside of Washington, DC. I am originally from Peru and my wife, Cecily, is American. We have three beautiful children: Carlito, Arturo and George. Every year or two we travel to Peru to visit the family in Lima and our Andean brotherhood in Cuzco. Every time we travel to Cuzco, we are more enchanted with its magical Inca lands. 


Abriendo puerta de los “Andes” para el mundo entero

Mi nombre es Jorge.Soy Ingeniero de Sistemas y Contractor viviendo en Washington DC (EE.UU). Soy peruano-americano con esposa americana, Cecily, y tres hermosos hijos (Carlito, Arturo y George). Cada año o dos años viajamos a Peru para visitar a la familia y hermanos de los Andes. Cada vez que lo hacemos regresamos mas y mas encantados y totalmente hechizados por esta magica tierra de los Incas, Cuzco.

In 2007, on one of my trips to Cuzco, I met a marvelous person who I formed a great friendship with along with his family. His name is Armando Quispe, a young Cuzqueño with an entrepreneurial spirit directly descendant from the Incas. Soon after we met, Armando and I were on horseback and he was showing me the typical tourist spots as well as the virginal landscapes of Sacsayhuaman, the "X-Zone" and the lower Sacred Valley. Outside of Cuzco I also visited Ollactaytambo, Aguas Calientes, Machu Picchu and many other mystical sites.

En el 2007, en unos de mis viajes por el cuzco conoci a una maravillosa persona y formamos una gran amistad al igual que con suf amilia. Su nombre es Armando Quispe, joven Cuzqueno con raza directa de los Incas. Armando me mostro hermosos paisajes del cuzco, lugares turisticos y virgenes que solo los indigeneas de esa tierra querida conocen: Sacsayhuaman, la zona “X”, el Valle sagrado, Ollactaytambo, AguasCalientes, Machu Picchu, etc.

After repeated trips and close contact with Armando all of these years, we have decided to work together to share this experience with people from around the world. We are eager to provide a traditional and authentic experience.

Despues de visitar esta tierra magica y mantener contacto todos estos años con Armando; mi esposa y yo sentimos la necesidad de que esta fascinante experiencia deberiamos compartirla con el mundo entero pero de una manera totalmente diferente, de una forma no tipica sino misticamente tradicional nunca antes vivida por personas de otros paises.

What began as a friendship and partnership with Armando has now blossomed into a series of projects including the construction of typical cuzquense country bungalows on Armando's familial lands. El Mirador del Apu, a country restaurant serving organic foods typical of Cuzco with panoramic views of Sacsayhuaman, has also opened. Camping grounds, horseback rides through the X-Zone, sessions with our Shaman and more are also offered.

Originandose asi una serie de proyectos como construccion de Bungalos campestres,” El Mirador del Apu”(restaurant tipico campestre-comida organica- con una vista paranomica e impresionante frente a Sacsayhuaman), zonas forestales para poser acampar y viajar en el tiempo,  Paseo a caballos por la zona “X”, sesion con nuestro "Chaman del APU", etc.

With the resources available to us and the hard work over the last seven years, we are embarking upon a global campaign benefiting our Andean brothers and sisters and our visitors from around the world. The journey through Cuzco and beyond will be phenomenal, unique and one never forgotten.

Con todos estos recursos en nuestras manos y un arduo trabajo en el transcurso de estos años, hemos originado una campana mundial beneficiando asi a nuestros hermanos de los andes y a nuestros visitantes del mundo entero, pasando asi una experiencia magica y unica por el resto de sus vidas.

Objective

The objective of our campaign is the culmination of the projects already begun, principally, the bungalows and the restaurant. In this way, we will create sources of new jobs for our Andean partners. Our international guests will enjoy first class hospitality, provided in the typical Andean tradition, combining close contact with nature in a pleasant environment.

Objetivo

El primer objetivo es recaudar $10,000.00 en 45 dias, para la culminacion de estos proyectos ya inciados y poder recibir personas de todas partes del mundo que puedan gozar una de las experiencias mas inolvidables en los andes. El objetivo es poder culminar los proyectos ya comenzados que son los Bungalos y el restaurant, creando asi una fuente de trabajo para nuestros hermanos de los Andes, para asi ofrecer un servicio fuera de serie para nuestros visitantes de una forma totalmente tradicional tipica de los Andes, entrando asi en contacto total con la naturaleza, creando un clima placentero a nuestros invitados de honor.

Our objective in raising ten thousand dollars in forty five days is for:

Installation of bathrooms for the bungalows

Furnishing the bungalows and restaurant with supplies, equipment and furniture

Completion of all the tasks necessary to receive our first formal visitors in June

Stabilization of the restaurant and bungalows as sources of income in addition to camping ground rental and horseback tours thereby funding other projects: organic and sustainable farming, artisan food and beverage production, intercultural exchange and further exploration of Peruvian gastronomy. 

Con la culminacion de este primer objetivo originara automaticamente muchos otros proyectos como:

-Conocimiento mistico de la Gastronomia Peruana-Andina

-Produccion de comidas y bebidas artesanales (Cerveza "ALE" Organica de los Andes)

-Agricultura organica y sostenible

-Intercambio cultural

-Intercambio para estudiantes o cualquier persona que desee permanecer largo periodo de tiempo e intercambiar experiencias.

The Impact

The impact of the completion of our project is an extension of the work that Armando has done most of his life: demonstrating the splendid sights, sounds and tastes of his ancestral lands to visitors from around the world. Now we have the opportunity to further collaborate and provide work and educational opportunities for Armando's fellow Andean community members.

The impacts for our guests will be numerous during their marvelous journeys. They will stay in the middle of the Andes mountains, next to the Mirador del Apu, camp, eat nutritious, completely organic foods, enjoy expeditions on foot or horseback to remote sites unchanged in thousands of years, build a Guatia, gift to the earth, "Pachamama", enjoy typical Andean beverages such as Chicha de Jora and Frutillada. The taste, sights and sounds of the trip will never be forgotten by those who visit.

El Impacto

El impacto que originara la culminacion de estos proyectos, sera la de crear fuente de trabajo para muchas familias de nuestros hermanos andinos ofreciendonos asi un servicio nunca antes vivido.

Habran muchos impactos especialmente por parte de nuestros visitantes en el transcurso de esta maravillosa experiencia como: Vivir en medio de las montanas en bungalos campestres junto al “Mirador del Apu”, Campamentos, alimentarse de comida totalmente organica, disfrutar de paseos a pie o a caballo por lugares remotos de hace miles de anos, viajaremos en el tiempo con nuestros visitantes, tendremos la chance de ofrecerles la famosa Guatia, pago a la tierra “La Pachamama”, disfrutar de tipicas bebidas Andinas como la “chicha de jora” y “Frutillada”, desgustaran comidas nunca antes probadas, sabores que sus paladares no podran olvidarlos ni querran dejarlos mas. Disfrutaran de nuestro “ChamanAndino” que lo llevaran a mundos magicos nunca antes vividos pero que siempre existieron en ustedes.

story: N/A

WHAT’S HAPPENING: This is an exciting time for the EVANSTON ART CENTER.  After 85 years of providing outstanding arts education, exhibitions and community outreach, we are moving into our own building at 1717 Central Street in Evanston. This $150,000 of a total budget of $2.5 million will be applied to the renovation of 1717 Central, allowing us to open in spring 2015.

OUR IMPACT:  The EVANSTON ART CENTER annually serves over 30,000 people of all ages and backgrounds from over 80 zip codes, employs 75 teaching artists and arts professionals, and provides exhibition opportunities to over 250 emerging and established artists. Our community engagement initiatives bring arts education programming to underserved populations throughout the Chicagoland area with initiatives like our mobile art unit, ART VANGO.

We are asking you to help us make this transition to the larger, updated facility so we can serve a greater number of people, engage in a larger sphere of community involvement, and keep the arts thriving. New programming in culinary, design, digital fabrication, movement, and music will be added to our visual arts offerings. It is a proven fact that art makes you smart!

WHY THIS MATTERS:  Without the EVANSTON ART CENTER, thousands of people will lose an opportunity to engage in the arts, our community will be without this vibrant cultural institution and economic generator, and the arts sector in this country will be further reduced.

HELP US MAKE THE MOVE: Your contribution toward our indiegogo goal of $150,000 will help make the new EVANSTON ART CENTER the place where creativity meets community. Help us renovate 1717 Central Street. Help keep the arts and this vibrant art center alive for future generations.

PLEASE MAKE A TAX DEDUCTIBLE DONATION TODAY:  The EVANSTON ART CENTER is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization that relies on charitable giving for its survival.

Delivery of all the following perks will include social media recognition. Estimated delivery of perks is November 2014. Every contributor will be entered into a drawing for TWO TICKETS for the OPENING GALA of the new building in 2015.

story:
My name is Erin West.  I currently work full-time in Wellness and Community Health.  In 2013 my daughter, Riley and I, along with a friend created Kindredhouse - a non-profit 501(c)(3) community-level aid organization in Cambodia. At Kindredhouse we care about creating a better future for Cambodians and ensuring the sustainability of Chansor Hospital as well as health education programs for the community. 

Cambodia is a country deeply scarred by mass genocide committed from 1975 – 1979. This tragedy killed an estimated 1.7 million people, among them the most educated or professional citizens, leaving future generations with few role models and opportunities. When I first visited Cambodia in 2006, I discovered a country rich in culture, history and beauty, but desperately lacking basic medical care and health education. Now with the support of financial supporters and a team of over 25 committed volunteers, Kindredhouse provides medical supplies, medications, health education and support to Chansor Commune Hospital.

Our Impact
Chansor is a village or 'commune' within Soutr Nikum District, Siem Reap Province. The region consists of 20 villages and the Chansor Hospital serves approximately 15,000 people. There is one physician who travels to the area on a part-time basis. Kindredhouse has provided support and medications to Chansor Hospital since inception with the goal of increasing effective delivery of basic healthcare needs to community members.  Recently, we returned from an aid trip to Chansor wherein 18 volunteers provided enough medications and medical supplies to effectively address medical needs for 6 months.  

In order to move forward, Chansor Hospital desperately needs some construction in and around the building.  The roof leaks horribly and a pig farm adjacent to the hospital grounds floods into the building during the rainy season (July-November) bringing filth and disease which makes it impossible to provide a clean, effective and sterile environment for adequate medical care.  There are challenges along the way to our goal - some of which are; language barriers, Chansor community is very rural and organizing a group to assess need is difficult, and of course, financial concerns.  We are prepared to face these challenges with proper planning, experience within the country, local support and the help of experts.  We have been asked by the community to help.  They have expressed their needs, desires and love and we feel confident we can overcome these obstacles.  

In November, we are meeting with local contractors and engineers in Cambodia to discuss a plan to divert the flood water and waste back to the farm, build a culvert and a fence and perhaps replace the roof.  We need your help!  Your donations will go directly to Chansor community and the hospital.  We at Kindredhouse have full-time jobs and no one receives a salary or reimbursement for their efforts.  We are a family organization which is committed to the wonderful people of Chansor, whom we also consider our family.  If we don’t reach our financial goals we are prepared to fund the project ourselves.  If you cannot contribute, please feel free to reach out to us!  We love volunteers!

Feel free to visit our website at www.kindredhouse.org or our Facebook page to learn more and follow our efforts!  

With your help we can reach our goals.  Please join us!

Erin West, MPH

erinw@kindredhouse.org

There is one physician who travels to the area on a part-time basis. Kindredhouse has provided support and medications to Chansor Hospital since inception with the goal of increasing effective delivery of basic healthcare needs to community members.  Recently, we returned from an aid trip to Chansor wherein 18 volunteers provided enough medications and medical supplies to effectively address medical needs for 6 months.  
In order to move forward, Chansor Hospital desperately needs some construction in and around the building.  The roof leaks horribly and a pig farm adjacent to the hospital grounds floods into the building during the rainy season (July-November) bringing filth and disease which makes it impossible to provide a clean, effective and sterile environment for adequate medical care.  There are challenges along the way to our goal - some of which are; language barriers, Chansor community is very rural and organizing a group to assess need is difficult, and of course, financial concerns.  We are prepared to face these challenges with proper planning, experience within the country, local support and the help of experts.  We have been asked by the community to help.  They have expressed their needs, desires and love and we feel confident we can overcome these obstacles.  
In November, we are meeting with local contractors and engineers in Cambodia to discuss a plan to divert the flood water and waste back to the farm, build a culvert and a fence and perhaps replace the roof.  We need your help!  Your donations will go directly to Chansor community and the hospital.  We at Kindredhouse have full-time jobs and no one receives a salary or reimbursement for their efforts.  We are a family organization which is committed to the wonderful people of Chansor, whom we also consider our family.  If we don’t reach our financial goals we are prepared to fund the project ourselves.  If you cannot contribute, please feel free to reach out to us!  We love volunteers!
Feel free to visit our website at www.kindredhouse.org or our Facebook page to learn more and follow our efforts!  
With your help we can reach our goals.  Please join us!
Erin West, MPH
erinw@kindredhouse.org

story:
Founder’s Testimony


 I would like to take this opportunity to introduce myself. My name is Garrett Underwood and I am the CEO/Founder of Malachi Clothing. We are a clothing company with purpose. With a sole focus on changing the hearts and giving a second chance to people in need! 

Malachi Clothing’s mission is to create good products that help create SEED Houses across America. We do this through the sale of Malachi Clothing, t-shirts, sweaters and other accessories by building a set donation into the cost of each product.  We created monthly plans to collectively advance the of the production on the SEED House project.

Vision:

To create sustainable economic/mentoring development programs that support the needs of individuals that lost everything, funding the SEED house project and creating opportunity to grow in everyday life.

To spread  awareness of a generation about their ability to bring change to a world that is in need. Not just verbally but physically. 


What We Need & What You Get

We believes in the power of a second chance by planting a seed of opportunity, we can create empowerment to the individual to strive for a career that can change the world.Seed House Project is a free housing and job placement program that provides income for men and women in the U.S that is in need. Giving individual that lost everything through life changing events a chance to get back on there feet.

Seed House Project provides the less fortunate with the guidance and support they need to lead them to long-term employment and success throughout their life.
We provide the all around skills needed to succeed in a career and in life.
We seek a transformation by God to become physically and spiritually equipped to participate in society, create healthy relationships and offer service to others. 


Cost break Down for 6 Months: 

  • Housing Facility Cost: 9,200
  • Food: 1,800
  • Financial Planning Program: 2,500
  • Career Building Program:2,000
  • Shuttle: 5,000
  • Housing equipment:3,000  


  • The Impact

Your donation will really get the ball rolling and get us on our feet for this program. 

Why Homeless?


On any given night, it is estimated that there are 750,000 homeless men, women and children in the U.S.  During one year, 2.5-3.5 million people will be homeless for some period of time. Los Angeles County contains the largest population of people living below the poverty line of any metropolitan area in the U.S., and, at the same time, it is one of the most expensive metropolitan areas in which to live. The county has the largest population of homeless people, by far, of any metropolitan area in the U.S. The 2007 LAHSA Homelessness Count estimates that there are 73,702 people in Los Angeles County who are homeless on any particular night. There are more people on the streets for longer periods of time, in part, due to the affordable housing crisis in Los Angeles, if we can create more housing and more opportunity we can decrees homelessness not just in Los Angeles but around the world. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get the word out and share our vision. Use indiegogo share tool and pass the word to all your friends you know! we can use all the help we can get.

story:
WHO WE ARE

Started by four University of Oregon students, Rosie strives to relieve the financial burden of monthly essentials. Our company will use a drop-in center and deliveries to reach our clients. 

For the first few months, due to financial restrictions, we will only offer deliveries. Our services will be available to any person for any hygienic purpose, including, but not limited to, menstruation, urinary incontinence, and hysterectomies. Clients will be able to go on to our website, rosiecenter.org, and register with us. Once they've created their profile, they can choose what package type they want and when they want it by. 

Leave the rest to us.


THE TEAM

Executive Director: Manju Bangalore

Manju started creating when she was four and hasn't stopped since. In her free time, she likes to discuss intersectional feminism and burn her dinner. Even though she loves herself quite a bit, she is still a Physics and Mathematics double major at the University of Oregon.


External Affairs Officer: Maria Pervova

Maria works on marketing, fundraising, and external communications. She is majoring in International Studies and Economics at the University of Oregon. Maria is especially passionate about cross cultural communications and diplomacy. She loves to dance in the rain, diet like a football player, and make frequent visits to the emergency room.


Internal Affairs Officer: Lucas Pyper

Luke is in charge of finance, human resources, and facilities. People say his face was chiseled by the Gods themselves. Luke likes Piña Coladas and getting caught in the rain, but he's not really into yoga. He is currently attending the University of Oregon.


Governance Officer: Austin Ferrie

Austin was born in Parker, Colorado where he lived for eight years before moving to Lake Oswego. He loves hockey and soccer, hates Mondays, and thinks scarves are an underrated fashion accessory.


WHAT WE NEED

To keep ourselves supported, we need funding. If we reach our goal of $5,000, we will  have the first two months of operations funded. We will be able to cater to hundreds of individuals every month with your help. The funding would go towards the cost of insurance, delivery costs, but most importantly, the feminine hygiene supplies themselves.

Here's a breakdown of what the $5,000 will be spent on exactly:

The money goes directly to sustaining our non-profit. All of our staff works on a volunteer basis because we believe in what we're doing. 

We hope you do, too.


WHY YOU SHOULD DONATE

Why aren't pads and tampons free? We believe they should be. 

Basic sanitation should be afforded to everyone, regardless of income level or socioeconomic status. No one should have to worry about the cost of feminine hygiene supplies. 

Pads and tampons are expensive and can help to drain a person's monthly check.

As a community member, you have the power to profoundly impact your environment. You can help us establish our company's base. You can help promote what we're doing. You can share our excitement with your friends and family. 

You have the power to change your community for the better.

We want to make the world a better place. 

Let's work together.

Help us help our community and donate today.

story:
Short Summary:

In recent years i have been working in a simple graphical real-time circuit simulator in my sparse time.

I actually have the "bare bones" working, that is: the gui, circuit simulator core and the interface to a good avr simulator (simavr). So it's possible to simulate an avr microcontroller hooked to external electronics components at real time. This is what you can see in the video.

Now i want to have some arduino boards and shields integrated in the simulator as well as develop it to be an usable aplication for everyone and release it as open source software.

Brief description of the simulator:

The core of the aplication is an electric circuit solver and a set of basic electronic elements, it's written to be gui-independent, so it could be used in other guis.

The gui uses Qt C++ framework, so it's platform independent and takes advantage of all the high-level facilities that Qt provides. 

The avr simulation is done by a lightweight, fast C simulator (simavr) interfaced directly to the graphic pins trough efficient IRQ hooks. So it's possible to simulate an avr 16 Mhz at real time in a Pentium-D 2,8 Ghz (60% cpu load).

 

The Goals:

- Develop the gui to be easy to use and bug-free.

- Add a basic set of graphical electronic components.

- Add a basic set of output devices, including 7-seg dispalys, lcd...

- Integrate a basic set of Arduino Hardware: boards and shields.

- Add a plotter and an oscillocope view.

- Port to as many platforms as possible, at least Linux and Windows.

- Translate to as many languages as possible, at least English and Spanish.

- Create and maintain a webpage with updates, help, tutorials, examples...

- Any other?

How:

All the suporters will participate in the develop process:

- Suggesting what components and features they wish.

- Voting which of the suggested will be implemented.

So the decisions will be taken by all the people participating in the project.

Your contributions will go to:

- Desing and maintain webpage.

- Professional developer assistance.

- My full-time dedication for 3 mounth, what is the expected time for this first release (afther the campaign is closed) .

This campaign is flexible funding, so if the goal is not reached the work will go... slower, without professional asistance or less features, but will go...

In the other hand if the goal is exceeded i will add a code editor + arduino toolchain.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Translating to your language.
  • Colaborate in tutorials, help, documentation.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Hello, my name is David Patrick, for years I had a longing to travel the world. Not just on my own, but to share it with others who have the same passion as I do to see new places, cultures and people. Starting in 1998, I have been involved in the tourism industry in a multitude of capacities. I spent 6 seasons in Breckenridge, CO working for Vail Resorts. In March of 2005, I joined the Trek America team leading tours and driving for 4 years from Mexico to the Arctic Ocean, Los Angeles to New York City. After a brief hiatus in graduate school and teaching chemistry, I returned to the road working for Dragoman in the Middle East along with Eastern/Southern Africa and South America. 

I love what I do and the initial focus of Infinite Adventures is to highlight the amazing beauty and adventures available in the wilds of Alaska. Over time, the hope is to grow the adventures offered on down through Western Canada and the lower-48. I want to be your expert on all things North America!

The reason for my campaign is to be assisted in developing in an overland vehicle. I would love to build a vehicle from scratch but this would cost close to $150,000. Way too much for a startup to invest and expect to grow and become profitable within it's first few years. So, I've decided on the next best option; which is to take an old bus and refurbish it to my specifications where we will have a backlocker (luggage storage), 20 seats, 2 tables, a refrigerator, overhead lockers, exterior storage compartments, and a roof rack with viewing platform along with other vital amenities. This type of vehicle is commonly being used in tours throughout the world, except here in North America. If I can develop the first of its kind here, I believe that Infinite Adventures will see remarkable growth within it's formitive years.

I believe that this undertaking is the next step in the tourism industry here in the states. With gas/diesel prices continuing to rise, the need for travelers to utilize these types of small group adventure tours will continue to grow. Your contributions to my small business will be a great spring board in being ready to get the wheels rolling May 2013.

Infinite Adventures is looking to raise $15,000 towards the initial purchase of our overland vehicle. With the experience gained leading tours in the Middle East, Africa, South and North America, we know what sights and experiences our clients are looking forward to, as well as the ones that haven't even crossed their minds. Part of the experience is this overland vehicle which becomes more like a home to them. Compared to the competition who utilizes 15 passenger vans, this vehicle gives you the space to stretch your legs, walk around while moving, play cards or write your journal, and when you see that amazing photo, you don't have to clamor over your neighbor to get it. 

Even if our goal isn't met, the funds you donate will go directly to either the vehicle's purchase or the refurbishing project.

Please help me achieve my dream to show the world how amazing North America is with its' nature, geology, and culture. Don't worry if you can't donate, just do me a favor and pass it along to your friends and family. Not only can you help me financially, but you can be a huge asset in spreading the word about my company and what we provide. 

Come check out our website, www.infiniteadv.com or facebook page, Infinite Adventures.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Audrianna Talavera and I am co-director of Community Boost Consulting, a non-profit consulting firm based in San Diego. ProjectFLITE (Fostering leadership & Independence through entrepreneurship) is an initiative we're taking on in partnership with Empowered Youth to transform 6 at-risk youth into entrepreneurs & venture capitalists by the end of an intenstive 10-week program. They will be starting, running, and growing their own businesses during these 10 weeks. 

The program will culminate in them flying out to San Diego to pitch their journey to over 100 entrepreneurs and venture capitalists at StartUp Grind San Diego on July 7 and we need YOUR help to make this happen! 

What We Need & What You Get

Funds from this campaign will go towards paying for 9 flights (the 6 boys, their 2 mentors, and the founder of Empowered Youth) and their room & board while they are here. Most of them have never been on a plane before!    

The Impact

I think everyone can relate when I say life isn't easy sometimes, but "not easy" is a very relative term. After hearing the stories of these 6 boys, it's hard to every think anything was a struggle in your own life. The circumstances these boys were under at such a young age were heart-wrenching to learn about. To see how determined and committed they are to break the cycle and create a bright, succesful future is incredibly inspiring. Your contribution will help make that bright, successful future a reality. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We completely understand if you cannot make a donation today. If you could take the time to share this with friends and family we would be extrememly grateful! 

Or if you want to read about the boys' journeys, they will be posting weekly blogs and vlogs here: https://communityboostconsulting.org/category/project-flite/

Thank you for visiting our page, for contributing, and for caring to make a difference in the world.

story:
The song "If I Had A Dream"  is from the album "Nadir" by Barry Payne, performed by his trio String and Bone.


Just the fact's Ma'am!

My name is Ben Bright, I'm a Storyteller and Author who promotes Literacy through storytelling. As the Chair/Artistic Director of the Festival of Storytelling, here in Gananoque, Ontario, I convinced our festival committee that we should try a crowd sourcing campaign. So here we are! 

Oral storytelling has been a part of human culture since before we started to live in communities. It held our traditions and culture alive before writing was invented and even after, as we continue to be spellbound with the telling of certain myth's, legends and tales.

We can't really explain in writing what an event like this can do and so we've tried to show it in the video. The video is of our friend Nancy and her dream, The St Marys Storytelling Festival, we're trying to create the same here in Gananoque. After you've watched it we hope you'll feel as passionate about the festival as we are. Below you'll find the usual verbiage describing our project and visit us at: http://www.1000islandstorytelling.ca/

Reports and studies are being produced now that show the link between oral storytelling and literacy. Children that are told oral stories seem to develop an understanding of reading and writing faster. They also seem to be more creative in their thinking.  

We're starting our Storytelling Festival to promote oral storytelling, literacy, education, community (with a free performance) and family. It's that simple…so here I am, on the Committees behalf, asking for your help to raise seed money.

We don't have a bunch of fancy perks, however we hope: 

  • you'll get the satisfaction of helping an incredible event come to life
  • you'll get the knowledge that students from multiple schools (hundreds of kids/youth) will be motivated by professional storytellers from Canada and the US
  • you'll feel your heart swell knowing that families will sit together to listen, laugh and be amazed as they don't even realize that they are bonding 
  • you will be creating a new way for a Community to come together and grow 
  • you will make a difference...and…
  • I'm going to offer some of my short stories and book as perks too.
  • Sponsorship and Presenter perks are also available. 

All the funds raised will go towards this Festival. All the money will go into a bank account opened in the Festivals name and can only be withdrawn with consent from others. If more than the goal is raised, it will be carried over to the following year to be used with, hopefully, grant money.

And…it will all happen because of you.

Not just your money will help, hopefully you see the value that an event like this can bring to individuals, families and communities by recommending this campaign to your friends and networks.

Please use the Indiegogo tools and your media network to share our campaign too.

Remember to send us your email so we can send you your perk.

Last word...is "Thank You". Sincerely, I thank you and the Festival of Storytelling Committee thanks you from the bottom of our hearts. This Storytelling Festival means the world to us. It will help give back to a community that needs a little love (especially in these economic times), people that need a break and kids that have dreams to chase...they're just looking for dreams or an inspiration to follow.

Thank you for your help, Ben
story_txt:
The song "If I Had A Dream"  is from the album "Nadir" by Barry Payne, performed by his trio String and Bone.Just the fact's Ma'am!
My name is Ben Bright, I'm a Storyteller and Author who promotes Literacy through storytelling. As the Chair/Artistic Director of the Festival of Storytelling, here in Gananoque, Ontario, I convinced our festival committee that we should try a crowd sourcing campaign. So here we are! Oral storytelling has been a part of human culture since before we started to live in communities. It held our traditions and culture alive before writing was invented and even after, as we continue to be spellbound with the telling of certain myth's, legends and tales.We can't really explain in writing what an event like this can do and so we've tried to show it in the video. The video is of our friend Nancy and her dream, The St Marys Storytelling Festival, we're trying to create the same here in Gananoque. After you've watched it we hope you'll feel as passionate about the festival as we are. Below you'll find the usual verbiage describing our project and visit us at: http://www.1000islandstorytelling.ca/Reports and studies are being produced now that show the link between oral storytelling and literacy. Children that are told oral stories seem to develop an understanding of reading and writing faster. They also seem to be more creative in their thinking.  We're starting our Storytelling Festival to promote oral storytelling, literacy, education, community (with a free performance) and family. It's that simple…so here I am, on the Committees behalf, asking for your help to raise seed money.
We don't have a bunch of fancy perks, however we hope: 

you'll get the satisfaction of helping an incredible event come to life


you'll get the knowledge that students from multiple schools (hundreds of kids/youth) will be motivated by professional storytellers from Canada and the US


you'll feel your heart swell knowing that families will sit together to listen, laugh and be amazed as they don't even realize that they are bonding 


you will be creating a new way for a Community to come together and grow 


you will make a difference...and…

I'm going to offer some of my short stories and book as perks too.
Sponsorship and Presenter perks are also available. 

All the funds raised will go towards this Festival. All the money will go into a bank account opened in the Festivals name and can only be withdrawn with consent from others. If more than the goal is raised, it will be carried over to the following year to be used with, hopefully, grant money.
And…it will all happen because of you.
Not just your money will help, hopefully you see the value that an event like this can bring to individuals, families and communities by recommending this campaign to your friends and networks.
Please use the Indiegogo tools and your media network to share our campaign too.Remember to send us your email so we can send you your perk.
Last word...is "Thank You". Sincerely, I thank you and the Festival of Storytelling Committee thanks you from the bottom of our hearts. This Storytelling Festival means the world to us. It will help give back to a community that needs a little love (especially in these economic times), people that need a break and kids that have dreams to chase...they're just looking for dreams or an inspiration to follow.
Thank you for your help, Ben

story:
We are working hard to compete in the USF2000 Championship (http://www.f2000.com/) in 2011.

To do this effectively we wish to do a full day of testing, all expenses paid, tires and fuel included for 250 miles of running with a pro team, to get me comfortable in the car.

We also wish to do an SCCA race at Blackhawk Farms raceway in Rockton, IL. Oct 10-11, 2010 to gain more seat time and experience for next season's racing.

We still need $4,000 as racing is an expensive sport. Your donations go for things such as tires and travel expenses.

Through this process we are creating another promotional video to attain sponsorship for the 2011 season, much like the pitch video on this page. This video will ensure that we have everything we need to create a professional pitch to potential sponsors.

story:
Dear Friends,
Everyday is a fun day for us. We always get to see new faces walk through our doors, excited to see the glowing screens and hear the pew-pew noises from each arcade and pinball machine. It’s fun to make new friends that remember playing these arcade games when they were a kid or watching parents with their little ones, huddled over a game and cheering with their son or daughter as they jump that barrel, stomp on the turtle, or shoot that last spaceship.

We always hear you guys and gals cheer, “Thank you for doing this, for opening up in my neighborhood.”… And we always respond with, “Hey if it wasn’t for you guys showing up, we wouldn’t have a fun place for you guys to hang out”.


But the way things are going, Rusty Quarters might have shut our doors forever.


Recently we’ve seen a drastic decline in attendance. Drastic enough that it is affecting our day-to-day business. Some of this is due to the recent moody weather (warm/cold/warm/snow/cold). Some is due to a newer and more fancy arcade that recently opened up in the MPLS area. And some may be just for the fact that the novelty of bringing a retro video arcade back to life has just faded by way of the dinosaur…

We are currently in a high rent lease, locked in for almost 2 more years (lease is up in 11/2014). We started this labor of love with a very small shoestring budget. We have spent every penny to keep us open. We've sold cars, tiki mugs, shirts, and every other personal bauble to keep this place going. We've looked into second jobs to make ends meet but are shut down with words like, "You're overqualified" or "I can't hire someone that's just going to quit right after their business picks up". We have exhausted all of our savings and because of slow attendance we've been a bit shy of the rent for a few months, leaving us in the red with our landlords for $8,000 in compiled back rent...

The fact is that THE RENT IS JUST TOO DAMN HIGH! We’ve tried our best get a Small Business loan but have been denied at every turn. (Turns out, you have to have money to borrow money) And it turns out that we are too small of retail space for a food/alcohol license. All we can do is try our best to get better attendance and keep Rusty Quarters open for 2 more years until we can find a larger place with cheaper rent, a proper HVAC system, running water and a grill.

Bottom Line, if business doesn’t pick up soon for Rusty Quarters, we will have to close our doors June 1st.

In conjunction with asking for donations, we just hope that if you get bored around the house, had a hard day at work, need to do something fun with the kids, or just need a cheap date night, you’ll decide to stop by your neighborhood arcade and spend a couple of quarters. Relax with fan favorites such as Donkey Kong, Galaga, Rampage, Ms. Pac-Man, Tekken, etc. Also, keep us in mind for your next birthday party or event. Revenue from those activities make up for those slow days...

But if you really want to help us out, we're willing to make it worth your while with a list of Donation Perks which may be found on the right of the screen. Even though we've set our perks to $5 Donations, you are welcome to donate as much as you want.

Also, please join our Facebook page and spread the word to your friends and family that there is a fun place in town to spend your afternoon/evening.

We do understand that this is our second donation drive (we needed your help back in 04/12) and would like to thank everyone in the past that has help to keep us open through these hard economic times. Once again time are tough for us at Rusty Quarters and hope with your continue support of our business, we'll be here for your retro video game needs for years to come.

We’re not asking for all of your hard earned money. All we’re asking for are your spare quarters, which believe it or not truly add up. With your continued support of this neighborhood small business, we’ll keep you guys playing with new games in a kid safe and clean environment... And with a little luck, we'll be able to clear up present issues with our landlord.

Thanks for reading, and we hope to see you soon!

Annie (Boss Lady) & Sage (The Rube) Spirtos
Rusty Quarters Retro Arcade & Museum
818 West Lake Street, Minneapolis, MN 55408
www.RQARCADE.com

story:
Who We Are:

We are nearly 20 Millikin University seniors who are enrolled in a capstone course called "Art and Democracy." We bring expertise in the fields of art, theatre, dance, and music, as well as human services and communications, among fields. Led by an instructor who has developed strong working relationships with community organizations in Decatur, Illinois, we use our experiences in recitals, mainstage productions, and arts entrepreneurship to enhance our community through collaborative, arts-based projects.

What We Are Doing:

Macon County, Illinois is one of the least healthy counties in the state, with exceptionally high rates of smoking, obesity, and teen pregnancy. in the face of mounting budget cuts, the Macon County Health Department (MCHD), located in Decatur, Illinois, is looking for innovative ways to reach their diverse constituents and promote positive public health messages. Therefore, we are collaborating withMCHDto revitalize their lobby. Serving several diverse constituencies, the spaceis loud, unorganized, and does not create a positive community environment. In consultation with MCHD staff and administration, we have developed an arts-based solution that will allow the MCHD lobby to serve as a positive and inviting space for the patients that utilize the department’s services. We also hope to promote the idea of a healthy lifestyle through our artistic contribution to the center via iconic artwork.

A general theme for the redevelopment is to create a more modern, chic, but still professional atmosphere. After surveying MCHD staff, it has become clear that noise levels, exacerbated by high ceilings, create a challenging work environment, and anecdotal evidence suggests that clients also find the noise and institutional look of the lobby to be offputting. To combat theseissues, we will be adding color to the walls and  designing fabric tapestries throughout the space to create a more inviting, professional setting. Tapestries will help to absorb sound and diminish reverb within the main space, while strategically located, hypoallergenic plants and miniature trees will bring a much-needed natural element into the space.Additionally, because the Health Department serves Macon County’s diverse population including all ages, we will install a children’s playspace to cater to families as well as providing a separate area for a more solitary experience.

 

How We Will Use The Money:

 

Money awarded as well as fundraised by our project team will be used solely for the materials used to implement our design. A breakdown of this is listed below. We will perform all labor to minimize costs and maximize our contribution.


Fabric and sound diminishing materials: $500

Canvases for artwork: $150

Hardware: $50

Children’s Wall: $150

Cushioned Floor for Children’s Space: $230

story:
UPDATE APRIL 4: 

 

Davy's finger is healing up really well. However, she is still opting to have the surgery so that it can be a worry that is put behind her and wel can all move forward with Frame of Mind. 

 

 UPDATE: Because of Davylyn's situation, she injured one of her amputated fingers and will require surgery. Because of this, our campaign is sort of a mish mosh fundraiser to fund her surgery, and our business. Either way, your generosity will go toward our future as a successful business.

Short Summary

We are three young people trying to fund a small business in video and photography. We each have different sets of skills, but share a passion for art and creativity.  Here's a little bit about us, and why this is our dream:

 

To see more about us and our work, visit: Frameofmindphotography.net

 

Don Louis:

I'm the primary Photographer and Videographer for Frame of Mind. I've always loved video, and I've wanted to be a film maker since I was seven years old. I have always had a strong passion for film, and I want to start now while I'm young.  To have the experience and to be able to make a living doing what I love is very important to me. I want to make people happy and give them a result they can be happy with. Also, I couldn't ask for a better team than Davylyn and Josh. I would be so grateful for any help with this dream. 

 

 

Davylyn Shaddinger:

 I'm the web designer, marketer, organizer, and more. I am an amputee and have been since birth.I have amputations on every limb to some extent (missing leg, toes and fingers). I have always worked very hard in my life. I was an excellent student all my years up through college. I studied to be an elementary school teacher. However, upon getting my first job, I found that a 9-5 job of any kind was too hard on my leg. I would love to be able to work from home as Frame of Mind's behind the scenes coordinator. I would appreciate any help in making it a reality for me to help support my husband and future family. 

 

 

Joshua Shaddinger: 

I am the secondary photographer and videographer. I also handle all the legalities like registering, taxes and the non-fun things Don and Davy don't want to deal with.   I owned my own business all of my adult life, but moved to Arizona for my wife, and I am looking for a career change. I want to be able to provide for my family, and ask for your help. 

 

So, with Don's talent, Davy's design and organizationals skills, and Josh's legal skills, we've got a pretty grand business in the making. But we need your help. We need funding to make this a reality! 

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise in total $2,600.This will cover multiple business expenses:  

 -Surgery for Davy ($1000)

- Part of our home and office rent (3 months rent $900)

- Finishing our legal registration like getting a tradename and our logo trademarked. ($150)

- A tertiary camera to force Davy to learn photography ($119)

- A new tripod for our Canon T4I ($100)

- New Business Cards with our website ($50)

- Studio Lighting ($200)

- A new, secondary T4I so we can have multiple angles ($879)

- Advertising space at our local wedding gallery ($300 for 6 months)

- Advertising in our local magazine ($500 for six months)

- Canon 50mm lens ($150)

- Sample Wedding Albums to show customers ($400)

- Our ultimate Goal, an amazing Video Camera ($2500)

 

Altogether this is over $2,600, but we figure we can scrounge up some of it ourselves offering street dances and yodeling telegrams. (Or we could get overfunded to spare our dignity!)

 

In return for funding us, we are offering awesome perks and thanks yous! Pens, posters, street dances and yodeling telegrams! And more! We cannot offer anything spectacular, but hope a little touch of our personality will be enough.

We promise frequent updates of events, new photography and fun! We'll keep you in the loop with everything that goes on with Frame of Mind. 

 

 

The Impact

We want to make a living doing what we love, and making other people happy. Your contribution will help us with our dream. We live in a small area where there aren't many video and photography options. We want to offer high quality, memorable services at anaffordable price. We love what we do,creating life long memories through beautiful photography and cinematography. Your contributions will help us get our name out there for the world, so we can capture more moments and more memories! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our indiegogo! Twitter it, Facebook it, sing a song about it while grocery shopping! Every share gets us a little closer to our goal. 

Like out facebook page! Facebook.com/frameofmindstudios

Share our page with your friends!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
A Little About Us

Paradox Pewter has gradually morphed from an absorbing hobby to a full-blown company during the past 12 years, producing an eclectic variety of pins, wax seals and charms.

Recently, Paradox Pewter has had a rapid growth spurt – engaging such clients as Burning Man (Lamplighter's charms) and Children's Fairyland in Oakland, CA (pewter and gold storybox keys).

To meet the demands of this growth, I have gathered and created new equipment, including hand-crafting a spin caster. The time has come, however, where a piece of equipment is needed that I cannot build myself.

A laser engraver system.

Outsourcing the engraving work, from which the casting molds are made, has quickly become time-consuming and too expensive per piece. Having a system in house will allow me to produce a larger array of products and reduce the cost to customers. This piece of equipment has become the bottleneck in expanding Paradox Pewter to a sustainable point.
 

What We Need & What You Get

After much research, we have settled upon a 5th gen system from Full Spectrum Laser.

The system, with a couple of options and shipping, is $4259, which is what we are trying to raise.

With this, we will be able to craft whatever we can dream up and – moreover – whatever our clients can imagine. :) 

Be a Patron of the Arts! Your help will bring Paradox Pewter to a higher artistic level – and you get the benefit of some awesome perks as well! Win-win. :)
 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

  • Get the word out (facebook, twitter, etc) to bring in more help here.
  • Indiegogo has built-in share tools.
  • Tell your friends and family about Paradox Pewter!

Thank you! :D

The time has come, however, where a piece of equipment is needed that I cannot build myself.A laser engraver system.Outsourcing the engraving work, from which the casting molds are made, has quickly become time-consuming and too expensive per piece. Having a system in house will allow me to produce a larger array of products and reduce the cost to customers. This piece of equipment has become the bottleneck in expanding Paradox Pewter to a sustainable point. 


What We Need & What You Get
After much research, we have settled upon a 5th gen system from Full Spectrum Laser.The system, with a couple of options and shipping, is $4259, which is what we are trying to raise.With this, we will be able to craft whatever we can dream up and – moreover – whatever our clients can imagine. :) Be a Patron of the Arts! Your help will bring Paradox Pewter to a higher artistic level – and you get the benefit of some awesome perks as well! Win-win. :) 


Other Ways You Can Help
I know some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

Get the word out (facebook, twitter, etc) to bring in more help here.
Indiegogo has built-in share tools.
Tell your friends and family about Paradox Pewter!

Thank you! :D

story:
Casa is a home away from home even though you leave you will always come back.   DJay 24

              My children have grown up here. Gisselle 35

                         Loosing this space is not an option. Mott Haven Community 

 

The South BRONX burned once and it rose from the ASHES! WE are sure it will  RISE again!  Together, THE WOMEN and GIRLS from CASA, the Mott Haven Community and YOU are going to be on FIRE!  Join us 

Casa Atabex Ache, located at 471 East 140th Street in the South Bronx, Mott Haven community, is presently experiencing threats of closure and displacement of their premises.  Casa Atabex Aché has provided essential and effective services to over 10,000 of Mott Haven’s most resilient yet disenfranchised residents for over 15 years.  We are sadly in danger of losing our space, and to keep our services accessible to this community, we are asking for your support.

THE POSSIBIITY OF OUR REBIRTH

Everything happens right on time. Its spring and with every closed door, with every possibility of death is an opportunity of the rebirth of community and collective visioning to do life another way and be someone else in the process, the results are always extraordinary! Everything that once seemed impossible will be possible! Lets do this!

  • Rent or Buy a community building to create an eco- holistic Healing Justice Center in the South Bronx ( the first of its kind).  
  • Create a retreat center. Main Floor Retreat room, 2nd floor: Self Love rooms: Massage rooms, meditation room, spirit room,  Chakra sauna room. 3rd floor Resting spaces/liberation rooms
  • Create a library and book store of historical/ inspiring people of color authors
  • Create a young womyn academy of liberation and healing
  • Operate a workers owned co-op  Freedom CAFE  to eat healthy with the seasons
  • Construct a computer room for the community
  • Launch a people’s reproductive justice health clinic with alternative/ cultural and spiritual medicine
  • Continue our annual Womyn Warrior Celerbation and Award Ceremony  with the addition of a conference towards our Rebirth and yours. 

ABOUT CASA ATABEXA ACHE

 The Bronx has been, and continues to be, the most underserved of any borough in this city, ranked the unhealthies of 62 counties of New York City.  Casa Atabex Aché has responded consistently to the needs of young and adult women who have been victims of rape, child abuse, addiction, domestic violence, trauma and poverty. Casa Atabex Aché has created a space for women’s self healing through mental, emotional counseling, peer education, emotional release, empowerment programs and seasonal retreats.  Preventive services include  violence prevention and reproducitve justice (HIV/AIDS testing and education, safe sex education and services, Hepatitis C education and workshops, and nutritional education).  Casa Atabex Aché also provides a space for political education, community leadership, and cultural/spiritual events that have been presented on a national level.  Casa Atabex Aché has developed tenant workshops, interdisciplinary arts programming, political advocacy in collaboration with community organizations internationally.   Casa Atabex Aché is a sacred space for women within our communities who want to heal, grow, thrive, and simultaneously, create positive change in thier famlies, community and the world.

Our Commitment to THE SOUTH BRONX

The Bronx community, particularly the South Bronx, is undergoing a shift in population.  The current residents are being displaced and replaced by gentrification, based on the interest of the owners and property management companies to achieve higher income for the housing units, after renovations.  We are clear that this is bigger than us and it is an economic and racial injustice affecting communities nationally and globally.

We, along with our fellow community organizations, have worked continuously to rehabilitate the Bronx and are alarmed and outraged by this situation.   Our goal has always been to empower our communities, and place them at the forefront of their communities revitalization. " There are over 17,000 public housing residents live in five NYCHA developments across 84 buildings in Mott Haven constantly facing high crime rates, low performing schools, and poor health of residents".These residents are our constiuents, our participants, our staff and our family and we are committed to continue to provide programs that will build a stronger, more sustainable community that will address their immediate needs. 

The repetitive displacement of community organizations via evictions,  contracts or lease renewals denied, or increase in rents have a direct impact on the services offered by community to the community.  In the last year the South Bronx lost over 10 organizations that include La Pena, Rebel Diaz Arts Collective, Freedom, Cescoc, Green Workers Coop, and many others who have lost their premises in this manner.

OUR REQUEST

The community of the South Bronx cannot afford to lose yet another life, another resource or another safe space. We need your support to strategize on next steps and save the space. 

We  are making an appeal to you, as our community and family, to address this outrage and help Casa Atabex Aché to continue providing the services vital to our community. 

In the next month we are asking you to support our global fundraising efforts to raise $50k towards a NEW SPACE, towards our REBIRTH! 

the best thing is that the minute you support, no matter what you give, whereever we are you will be gifted a safe space towards your own healing adn liberation, self empowerment and self love!   

While we have faith that we will exceed our goal, we wont stop until we do and  we will use what eer money is raised to secure a space and continue programming. 

Community SPEAKS! WHAT IS AT STAKE? 

  1. We loose a sacred special space that support everyone from newborn to elders
  2. The neighborhood is going to feel it as it is an intergenerational space where elders passed on messages of  love that don't get passed on...
  3. With everything going on in the world communities need spaces like this to keep surviving
  4. We get to see cultural performances that we other wise would not have access to
  5. Casa is a source of our pride  not many communities can say they have to alleviate everyday stress
  6. Its a Positive space of communication where young women can come to talk when they are not heard at home
  7. Its a space necessary for the community to come together to solve community problem and dream

We are open to any ideas, suggestions or guidance to secure our space, and welcome any dialogue that you can offer us.  We thank you in advance, for your attention and assistance to this most urgent matter.

 Creating possibilities and Endless Opportunities

 Casa Atabex Aché

CASA is your HOME Away from HOME! Support us today!

In the season of self love and rebirth we are asking you to open your self to your hearts desire and tell us what you see as a possibility for yourself and CASA. 

Share your story: Upload a short video or write us a letter about what CASA means to you and the impact it has had in your life. 

Creating possibility: Want to write instead, send us a letter of support with the possibility of what you see is next for us. Email letters to casarebirth@gmail.com 

Spread the Word! Share the work that CASA will continue to during our transition on Facebook, Twitter, Tumbler, Blogspot, wherever your voice is heard! Use the Indiegogo "share" tool to get the word out! Remember this is a global campaign!

story:
WHAT IS HISTOR.ME?

So many human stories are lost simply because history focuses on a select few. We believe that every person has had life experiences that, if heard by the right person at the right time, could change their life or at least brighten their day.  We created Histor.me to document all human life stories and to democratize history.  It will be a place where people can come to be inspired.

You can create a profile for either yourself or a loved one who has passed away. We'll guide you along the way to tease out stories that can inspire others; stories that truly show who you are on a deeper level than what you would share on Facebook or other social networking sites.

DISCOVER STORIES:

Using our story spinner, you'll have the ability to choose either a random page, a similar page or add keywords and categories in order to use our guided search.

CHARITY:

A big part of Histor.me is about giving back. If you find a life story on Histor.me inspiring, then you can pay it forward by donating to their charity. Every profile will be connected to a charity of that person's choosing.  For profiles of people who have passed away, this is also a way to offer comfort to that person's loved ones, knowing that their stories inspired people and helped out a cause.

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP:

Right now Histor.me is an idea, a logo and a dream.  Development, design, Facebook integration, and charity partnerships describe just some of the costs and challenges that your donation will help cover. With your support we will make the Histor.me site a reality.

HOW YOU CAN HELP:

DONATE, SHARE, TELL YOUR FRIENDS!  Please tweet, post to Facebook and  call your friends.  Let them know about our campaign and Histor.me.  Every dollar helps get us closer to making this dream a reality.  Thank you in advance!

PERKS:

T-shirts:

Please include:

  • Size: (Small/Medium/Large/Extra Large)
  • Gender: (Men's/Women's/Children's)
  • Style: (Regular or V-Neck)

They are so cute and comfortable!

Launch Party:

We're planning on having two launch parties as soon as the beta is complete.  One party in Toronto and one in NYC.  If you know me and my friends, you know this is going to be a party you won't want to miss.  The night will include special surprise musical guests and performers, great drinks and food.  Stay tuned for more details!  

The VIP ticket gets you all access, so if you like rubbing elbows with the who's who, this package is for you!

Skype:

This is a great option for someone who wants to create a page but isn't quite sure where to start.  Although Histor.me will be easy to use, this reward option is great for people who find using technology difficult.  I'll walk you through it patiently and with a smile.  Let's chat! 

Histor.me Poster:

If you haven't heard of artist Shen-Howe Lee, you should check out his amazing work.  Shen is best known for being a conceptual artist and background painter for video games and TV.  He has taken the Histor.me logo and brought it to life, in a digital painting. He agreed to sign the first 100 prints by hand. There will be no way to get these signed prints after the campaign! Preview available soon.  I'm so excited to put this poster on my wall!

Custom Digital Cartoon:

My friend, Sean Ward, the amazingly talented cartoonist and YouTube star, has generously offered his talents to our cause.  For this reward you must send in a picture that you want Sean to turn into a cartoon.  Check out his cartoons here and his Youtube channel here.

Photoshoot:

An amazing way to capture and inspire is through a photo and you need at least two for your Histor.me profile. I want to help take a photo that truly represents who you are and why your life story can inspire others.  

Check out my photography site to see examples of my work. 

Inclusion and copy of the Histor.me Book:

I'm so excited about this.  This will be a beautiful gift full of stories that will inspire you. We are going to create a gorgeous hard cover Histor.me book using some of our most inspiring stories. This perk gets you a copy of the book as well as the inclusion of a story of your choosing in the book. A great gift idea. I will work with you personally to craft your stories to be included. 

Keynote Speaking Engagement:

This reward is especially good for corporate engagements.  I will come to your office, gymnasium or wherever you choose and will give a talk or workshop on following your passions. I'll pull in inspirational stories from Histor.me. (I can also create a workshop specifically geared to your needs. Email me (Leoraisrael@gmail.com) if you'd like to hear more about programs I've run in the past.

story:
IF I reach my goal of $11,600 for the letterpress, I will donate my printing & design services for life to CASA of Multnomah and Washington County's fundraising events.  

I started The Card Bar (originally Card Girl Invitations) in 2003 in the bonus room of my first home in Portland, Oregon shortly after my wedding, and was then coined "The Card Girl!"  

After designing my own wedding invitations, I fell in love with the world of design, gave up my software sales job, and dove head first into a new custom stationery business I called Card Girl Invitations.  Card Girl moved to San Francisco for four fabulous and fast-paced years filled with wedding and event invitations, and then back to Oregon in 2007 so that my husband and I could raise our two boys in the small town of Lake Oswego.


One year ago (after working out of the house for several years), I took the leap to open up a brick and mortar location called The Card Bar. I've had so much fun opening the shop. I now have an amazing space to meet with clients to design invitations for their special day, assemble invitations and host community events.  Truly a dream come true for me.

I've focused The Card Bar on specializing in custom invitations and stationery―working closely with each client, and carefully assembling each invitation by hand. It’s a time and labor intensive process that produces unique and beautiful results.

I currently outsource all of my printing - hundreds of invitation jobs have been produced and sent across the USA - printed by several different printing vendors up and down the west coast.

I'm excited that The Card Bar has been so well supported, and I would love to be able to offer even more to my clients. It's time for a press of my own!


Your support will help me to fund a Chandler & Price press and all of its components, so that I can bring my printing in-house.  I have been dreaming of life with my own press for many years, and I have now found a perfect press just across the Willamette River!  With this press, I will be able to:

  • quickly fulfill walk-in orders, while the client experiences the age old printing process in person. 
  • experiment with different printing surfaces, fun die cut shapes and even foil so that I can create forward thinking designs as examples to share with industry friends.
  •  shorten my turnaround times (yay!).
  • create a signature invitation line for wholesale distribution.
  • keep my prices down!!
  • Make it possible for me to create higher quality pieces for my charity donations!

I have worked closely with each of my clients over the past 11 years to perfectly fine tune their unique invitations - a true collaboration.  As a result, I have a significant library of designs that I love.  I am excited to share my favorites in the form of a signature invitation line, which will be called Card Girl.

Launching a signature line will enable me to reach a larger audience, lower some of my prices,  and expand my sales into the wholesale channel!  

Here is breakdown of what your contributions will provide:

· PRESS: The Card Bar is ready to bring printing in-house!  $11,600 has been allocated for the purchase and transportation of a 1920's Chandler & Price press (the press weighs over 1000 pounds...so moving it is a BIG deal!).  

· SHOWS: Trade shows are a wonderful way of bringing The Card Bar to a larger audience as well meeting clients new and old. They are also very expensive. In addition to shows fees being paid up front, all show stock must be purchased in advance. Part of this campaign ($6000) will help guarantee I can bring The Card Bar to The National Stationery Show in New York with printed samples of my entire signature line.  

· HELP! I NEED AN EXTRA SET OF HANDS: With the exception of my husband, Jeff, who faithfully runs errands for me (post office, printer, back to UPS), all of the work is done solely by me. I would like to hire a part time (20 hours/week) set of hands to alleviate some of the more time consuming processes. I'm not asking you to help me pay a salary, just with initial training costs.  Another set of hands will result in higher productivity and will quickly become a self supporting expense.

Perks!

See some of the images on Pinterest:  http://www.pinterest.com/thecardbarpdx/the-card...
See more of my work at www.thecardbar.com


INSTAGRAM: @THECARDBARPRESS #THECARDBARPRESS

THANK YOU!

Nessa Sander 

P.S. Please note shipping and handling is included in each of the perk levels and this includes international shipping!

P.P.S. If you are interested in participating in my campaign, but are not yourself a stationery connoisseur, I am happy to send your chosen perk to a paper lover in your life.

About Casa

When a child who has been abused or neglected is going through the trauma of the foster care system, a CASA advocate is tirelessly working to guide them through safely, quickly, and effectively.

This year, CASA for Children of Multnomah and Washington Counties will advocate on behalf of 1,000 children (509 family groups). 

The help of a CASA is effective in reducing the length of stay in foster care, assuring that children do not re-enter foster care after their case is resolved, and helping to establish the conditions needed for better long-term outcomes after children leave foster care.  CASA's aim is to close the gap between children who need a CASA and the children who have a CASA.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute financially, I would love for you to spread the word - share the love on social media, email and when you're out with your friends for a glass of wine!

Launching a signature line will enable me to reach a larger audience, lower some of my prices,  and expand my sales into the wholesale channel!  

Here is breakdown of what your contributions will provide:
· PRESS: The Card Bar is ready to bring printing in-house!  $11,600 has been allocated for the purchase and transportation of a 1920's Chandler & Price press (the press weighs over 1000 pounds...so moving it is a BIG deal!).  
· SHOWS: Trade shows are a wonderful way of bringing The Card Bar to a larger audience as well meeting clients new and old. They are also very expensive. In addition to shows fees being paid up front, all show stock must be purchased in advance. Part of this campaign ($6000) will help guarantee I can bring The Card Bar to The National Stationery Show in New York with printed samples of my entire signature line.  
· HELP! I NEED AN EXTRA SET OF HANDS: With the exception of my husband, Jeff, who faithfully runs errands for me (post office, printer, back to UPS), all of the work is done solely by me. I would like to hire a part time (20 hours/week) set of hands to alleviate some of the more time consuming processes. I'm not asking you to help me pay a salary, just with initial training costs.  Another set of hands will result in higher productivity and will quickly become a self supporting expense.


Perks!
See some of the images on Pinterest:  http://www.pinterest.com/thecardbarpdx/the-card...

See more of my work at www.thecardbar.com




INSTAGRAM: @THECARDBARPRESS #THECARDBARPRESS

THANK YOU!
Nessa Sander 
P.S. Please note shipping and handling is included in each of the perk levels and this includes international shipping!
P.P.S. If you are interested in participating in my campaign, but are not yourself a stationery connoisseur, I am happy to send your chosen perk to a paper lover in your life.

About Casa


When a child who has been abused or neglected is going through the trauma of the foster care system, a CASA advocate is tirelessly working to guide them through safely, quickly, and effectively.
This year, CASA for Children of Multnomah and Washington Counties will advocate on behalf of 1,000 children (509 family groups). 
The help of a CASA is effective in reducing the length of stay in foster care, assuring that children do not re-enter foster care after their case is resolved, and helping to establish the conditions needed for better long-term outcomes after children leave foster care.  CASA's aim is to close the gap between children who need a CASA and the children who have a CASA.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute financially, I would love for you to spread the word - share the love on social media, email and when you're out with your friends for a glass of wine!

story:
Short Summary

     Wanna live longer? That's what we help you do here at Comanche Oaks. Come rain, shine, sleet, or snow, Comanche Oaks farm has been delivering the tastiest, healthiest vegetables and healing herbs to our customers in the central Texas area for over 27 years.

     Hi, my name is Leon Caldwell and I have spent the better part of my life growing good stuff that everyone likes. No chemicals, no pesticides, no herbicides, nor man-made products, no short-cuts, and very little rest to bring natural healing gifts of nature to your door.

    In 1987 I was one of the first people certified organic in the state of Texas. We developed a fertilizer which contains a full spectrum of vitamins and minerals that contribute to the wonderful flavor and effectiveness of our products. We never use common manures or waste products. We recently introduced botanical algae, which accelerates the growth and health of the plants, without compromising our commitment to growing organic produce. Our vegetables taste good! And our herbs work! If you haven't tried them already, make it a point to come by Barton Creek Farmers Market in Austin and check it out.

     My methods and equipment are pretty antiquated. It's hard to stay up with the demand, which grows all the time. With proper irrigation equipment, adequate water, necessary tools, and the capital to hire labor, this growing power can be exponentially increased. There are over 400 vegetables and herbs that we have mastered here in La Grange, and with your help, these talents won't be wasted.

     You may be wondering why someone who has done this for so long needs money now. The quick answer is kids- I've raised 5 of them by myself during this long venture. I was dad and mom. It's been a long, hard, expensive battle, but it all worked out. They are pretty much grown now and are all doing very well. My four girls and one boy helped out a lot after they got big enough to understand the chores. Little hands can do a lot when they have to. The girls are pursuing other professions, but my son is majoring in agriculture management at TSU in San Marcos. He will be running the farm when I'm done.


     Living longer is done by putting the good stuff in your body and expelling the bad. We help you do both. Comanche Oaks will continue if you can find it in your heart to contribute to this worthy cause. Every donation will be put to work growing the best, cleanest, and least expensive vegetables, honey, and herbs possible. Our customers love us and we love them. We want to insure that we can put something good on their tables- and on yours!

                                                           Thanks for reading,

                                                                Leon Caldwell


What We Need 

I am looking to raise $35,000 for the equipment necessary for the expansion of Comanche Oaks farm, any additional funds raised will go directly into further improving the farm. 
  • Water well and electric cable- approximately $10,000
  • Irrigation supplies and shade covering- approximately  $12,000
  • Better equipment (tiller, row planter, disc harrow)- $2,500- $4,000
  • Working capitol- $5,000- $6,000
  • Deer proof fence- $3,000

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everybody has the funds to donate, but that doesn't mean that you can't help our cause! Please help us to get the word out, tell your friends about us, share our campaign.

 Thank you for your support!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
