story:
Ten years ago, a group of us got together to re-think how we provided homeless services in Alachua County. The way we had been doing things wasn’t working. Getting help was like running an obstacle course. We were asking people with little or no access to transportation to run back and forth across town, from one agency to another, desperately trying to stitch together the resources and referrals they needed to pull themselves back on their feet. The same problems that contributed to people becoming homeless – limited transportation, lack of knowledge about available help, physical and mental health problems, and more – also made it difficult for people to get back into housing.

Community leaders, advocates, volunteers, and homeless and formerly homeless people spent six months working on the issue. GRACE Marketplace emerged from these discussions as the central piece of our community’s 10-Year Plan to End Homelessness. GRACE brings together the best social service and health care agencies in our community to strengthen the safety net for our friends and neighbors.

What We Do at GRACE

We are a one-stop assistance center for people without housing, bringing together key social service agencies in one location to make it easier for people in our community to get the help they need. We provide emergency shelter (indoors) and an outdoor shelter pavilion for men and women. We also provide meals, day services, laundry, storage, a computer lab, a clothing closet, case management, AA/NA meetings, mental health and substance abuse treatment, and, most of all, a place people can call home.

GRACE Marketplace is a project of the Alachua County Coalition for the Homeless and Hungry, a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit with two decades of experience developing and coordinating homeless services in North Central Florida. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our current operating budget is not enough to provide the level of services required to help people transition back to self-sufficiency. We are raising $50,000 to support and expand the programs and services currently offered at GRACE Marketplace. 100% of your donation goes directly to support programs and services at GRACE Marketplace. All money raised through this campaign will be used to:

- Expand supportive service and case management options, 
- Provide move-in assistance (first/last month rent and security deposit), and
- Improve safety and security on our 25-acre campus, and

$1 covers the cost of a meal for one hungry person. 

$25 provides a day of comprehensive services for one person.

$50 provides a week of day shelter (bathrooms, phones, showers, storage of personal belongings, and a place to get off the street and relax) for one person.

$100 will provide a week of overnight shelter for one man or woman without a safe place to call home.

$186 covers the cost of ordering pizza for 100 evening guests when we don't have a group from the community coming in to provide dinner. 

$500 provides the security deposit needed to move one person out of homelessness and into housing. 

$1000 provides the security deposit and first month of rent needed to get a person off the streets and into housing.

The Impact

Homelessness is the most visible symptom of poverty in our community. Whether you think homelessness is a crisis, a social justice issue, a women’s issue, a veterans’ issue, a health care issue, or just something you don’t want to see anymore in downtown Gainesville, GRACE Marketplace is part of the solution.

Since we opened in May of 2014, we have provided 20,000 meals and over 5,000 nights of shelter to homeless men and women in Alachua County. The majority of the 100+ people living in the former Tent City south of downtown have moved out to the GRACE campus. We have helped move 80 people off the streets and back into housing since we started, and with your help, we can continue to provide these and other high-quality services.

GRACE provides easy access to services for people experiencing homelessness by providing a safety net for our friends and neighbors.

Current GRACE partners include:


- Meridian Behavioral Healthcare
- Three Rivers Legal Services
- Alachua County Social Services
- Peaceful Paths
- University of Florida Mobile Medical Unit
- Florida Dept. of Children & Families
- Bread of the Mighty Food Bank
- Greenhouse Church
- Holy Trinity Episcopal Church Downtown Ministry
- Volunteers of America
- The VA Medical Center
- VETSPACE
- Gainesville Community Ministry
- Narcotics Anonymous
- Alcoholics Anonymous


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute financially, please consider helping in one of these other ways:

-  Spread the word! Ask your friends to #fundGRACE, and share this campaign on social media!

-  Organize a donation drive at your workplace, school, or church. We always need men’s and women’s hygiene items, new socks and underwear, blankets, coats, sweaters, bug sprays, tents, and sleeping bags!

-  Volunteer! Fill out a volunteer application at gracemarketplace.org and we’ll contact you with volunteer opportunities.

story:
Background

Kean University introduced a new policy mandating that all Greek-Lettered Organizations on campus require insurance for all active members. Unfortunately, the costs of the plan is more than we have in our treasury. As we aim to raise the funds on our own, we ask the community to assist us in this endeavor. If our fraternity does not raise the money by September 30th, we will be dropped from the school and 75 years of philanthropy, history, and honor will cease to continue.

Please help us, the first non-sectarian greek-lettered organization in New Jersey, continue our legacy of Fraternity, Loyalty, and Progress through the ages.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $2040 by the end of September for our fraternity insurance policy.

  • We will offer unique and exciting perks, prizes and rewards for any donation!

The Impact

Why is Nu Sigma Phi's preservation important?

  • Nu Sigma Phi prides ourselves in being the first Greek-Lettered Organization in New Jersey to not discriminate against anyone based on race, religion, social or economic status, age, sexual orientation, or ethnic background. 
  • We have raised thousands of dollars since our creation for numerous charitable causes. Our philanthropies include: The Special Olympics of New Jersey, local food banks, blood drives. 
  • We pride ourselves in establishing a network for college students to further their careers after obtaining collegiate degrees 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are aware not everyone can financially afford to help this great fraternity. Here are some other ways you can help us

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about the preservation of Nu Sigma Phi
  • Assist our brothers in any fundraising events we host on or off campus

story:
Hello! My name is Willow Lupa, and I’m starting a business making and selling lolita clothing and would like your help!


I’ve been making my own lolita clothing for years because it is hard to find good quality, affordable lolita clothing. I live in the United States, so almost everything I buy has to be shipped from overseas. This adds expense, concerns with sizing differences, long delays due to shipping times, problems with customs, etc. And they never have pockets! I make many of my garments with pockets because it’s so horrible to not have them when you need them!

Please consider donating or spreading the word! Thank you so much for all of your help!


About Me

I’ve been sewing for over 18 years. I have a Bachelor’s Degree in Theatrical Costuming, and I’ve made countless garments over the years. I’ve made everything from simple street wear to an intricate theatre costume that contained about 400 flowers meticulously hand-sewn. I have a lot of experience with management (and other paperwork-heavy tasks). Between that and my experience with selling (via retail and working for a realtor) the business-end shouldn’t be too difficult for me to handle.


I’ve wanted to start this business for a few years, and am finally able and ready, I just need a little extra help! I already have the majority of the supplies I need (such as fabric, a sewing machine, etc.). There are just a few things I need and some things I would really like to help promote my new business. Check out my breakdown below for more information.

Check out my personal website for more information about me and my work. willowlupa.wordpress.com


About the designs:

I plan on doing lots of individual pieces and outfits as well as a full collection. The separate designs will be quite varied, consisting of many different styles of lolita dresses. The collection will also be varied, going from sweet, through classic, and to gothic lolita, and my inspiration is this image.

I have finished two sketches, which I plan on having as the lightest and darkest pieces, and here they are! (Note: the purple skirt in the light dress is darker in the image than I intend to make it.)

Check out the gallery tab for more sketches as I finish them, and for some other things I've made!


Funds will be going towards:

  • Business licensing fees ($135).
  • Website and Indiegogo fees (approx. $180).
  • Professional Photography ($200-$400 per session, planning at least 2 sessions to start.)
    (or a good camera and set up for home pictures, as funds reached allows.)
  • Labels to put in garments ($85 for first 100).
  • A good quality steamer and ironing board ($150).
  • Dotted pattern paper and pattern weights ($70).
  • More lace! (You always need more lace!)
  • Organizational tools.
  • Other Misc. (thread, buttons, beads, etc.)

Stretch Goals (if we receive extra funding):
  • Home embroidery machine.
  • Custom fabric prints.
  • More designs and more photographs!
  • Even more lace!


Concerns:

The main concern I have is that the business itself may not be successful. This is, of course, a major concern for any new business and one I'm not taking lightly. I do know that there are lots of Lolitas who can't afford lolita clothing, or don't want the risks and concerns with ordering from oversees. I think the market exists for this business, and it's really just about getting noticed by the right people and building up credibility, something I'm willing to work hard to get.


Perks!

$5- Personal thank-you note!

$10- 4" X 6" Sticker sheet containing personalized stickers, including the Love in Lace logo.

$25- Free hair bow. Approximately 2.5" X 6"and on a barrette. It comes in your choice of the available colors; Black, White, Pink, Red, Cream, Yellow, Green, Light Blue, Blue, Purple, or random (I pick a color for you). Contact me if interested in another color. Includes a sticker sheet.


$50- Free shipping for life! I will give you free shipping that is good for the lifetime of Love in Lace. Includes a bow and sticker sheet.

$75- Embroidered “Love in Lace” pillow. This pillow will be heart-shaped, approximately 16" across, and embroidered to resemble the Love in Lace logo. Includes free shipping for life, a bow, and a sticker sheet.

$100- Free petticoat! A knee-length chiffon petticoat in white or black with an elastic waistband. Includes a "Love in Lace" pillow, free shipping for life, a hair bow, and a sticker sheet.

Business licensing fees ($135).

Website and Indiegogo fees (approx. $180).

Professional Photography ($200-$400 per session, planning at least 2 sessions to start.)(or a good camera and set up for home pictures, as funds reached allows.)


Labels to put in garments ($85 for first 100).


A good quality steamer and ironing board ($150).


Dotted pattern paper and pattern weights ($70).


More lace! (You always need more lace!)


Organizational tools.

Other Misc. (thread, buttons, beads, etc.)

Stretch Goals (if we receive extra funding):


Home embroidery machine.


Custom fabric prints.


More designs and more photographs!


Even more lace!





Concerns:
The main concern I have is that the business itself may not be successful. This is, of course, a major concern for any new business and one I'm not taking lightly. I do know that there are lots of Lolitas who can't afford lolita clothing, or don't want the risks and concerns with ordering from oversees. I think the market exists for this business, and it's really just about getting noticed by the right people and building up credibility, something I'm willing to work hard to get.


Perks!
$5- Personal thank-you note!
$10- 4" X 6" Sticker sheet containing personalized stickers, including the Love in Lace logo.
$25- Free hair bow. Approximately 2.5" X 6"and on a barrette. It comes in your choice of the available colors; Black, White, Pink, Red, Cream, Yellow, Green, Light Blue, Blue, Purple, or random (I pick a color for you). Contact me if interested in another color. Includes a sticker sheet.



$50- Free shipping for life! I will give you free shipping that is good for the lifetime of Love in Lace. Includes a bow and sticker sheet.
$75- Embroidered “Love in Lace” pillow. This pillow will be heart-shaped, approximately 16" across, and embroidered to resemble the Love in Lace logo. Includes free shipping for life, a bow, and a sticker sheet.$100- Free petticoat! A knee-length chiffon petticoat in white or black with an elastic waistband. Includes a "Love in Lace" pillow, free shipping for life, a hair bow, and a sticker sheet.

story:
Following the controversial closing of the church's City of Tucson funded 90 day emergency shelter, Pastor Dave Ferrari has announced a new plan to reopen the low demand shelter year round.  The emergency shelter is set to re-open on Sunday evening July 26, 2015.  Over the next 5 weeks Pastor Dave will be working with civic leaders, business leaders, religious and faith based leaders, as well as citizens and neighbors to solve the issues and get this shelter funded and off the ground.

Living on The Streets for The Cause  

Pastor Dave Ferrari will live homeless for 4 days and 3 nights at the downtown camp named #SafePark, as well as other areas of the city, to raise the necessary funds to reopen the shelter for a year. Video documented by professional photographer Patrick McArdle and guided by #SafePark founder and homeless advocate Jon McLane, Pastor Dave will survive 4 days with no money and only the property he can carry on his back. He will attempt to receive all of his meals, showers, clothing, and hygiene items from the different homeless service organizations, who currently provide these services to the homeless. As well as fundraising to reopen the shelter, Pastor Dave is hoping to bring awareness to the growing needs of the Tucson homeless population.

What We Need

We are seeking funding in the amount of $150,000.  $100,000 for first year operations, and $50,000 to pay for needed items like cots, blankets, supplies, etc.  There will also be improvements made to the property of CCA to make it more conducive to men and woman.   

The city of Tucson desperately needs a low demand (non restrictive), shelter option for both men and woman.  Pastor Dave and CCA are offering their location for such a shelter.  With your help we can raise the money necessary to run this shelter for the first year.   More info will be available soon.  Please consider joining us in this effort as we unite to provide one solution to this issue.

story:
This blog can become a leading intelligence and news analysis site on Greece and Eurozone that will give new jobs to Greek unemployed people (journalists, analysts, web developers, etc.).

I am from Greece and I love my home and the Greek people. Now, Greece is combating with the most difficult economic situation after the WWII.
There are many tier 1 online media worldwide that inform us about the developments in Greece.
I strongly believe that the main problem today is not the shortage of information but the too much information and the several channels of information.
I thought that a site that will focus on clearing the noise from the news and focus on the analysis of the current situation would offer an added value to the readers. Especially, if this effort is supported by reputable analysts, journalists and specialists.
My company is willing to contribute the cost for setting up this site (now it is in beta edition and works as a blog of our company). Also, we will contribute the cost for marketing and developments.
According to our business plan, this project needs at least £100,000 in the next 5 years especially for wages and marketing.
I share this dream and kindly ask you a support from you. Any support will make this site bigger and it will meet its targets earlier than expected.
Of course, there are risks and the competitions is very strong. We believe that our experience in publishing sector helps to minimize the risks and increase the possibilities for success.
You can contribute this campaign by buying perks or spreading this story.
Thank you for your interest in my effort.
Artemis Stergiou

story:
What is Norel Pom Natural Foods?

Norel Pom Natural Foods has been providing the mountain community of Hayfork Ca for decades, formerly Zion Natural Foods and Gold Country Store. Owners Adrienne Bonfoey and Tyler Crough are both former employees and have been running the ship for going on 5 years now! We provide natural, organic and healthy grocery options for our town at affordable prices, and we love doing it!

What do we need?

Quite frankly we need a larger space, and we found it! Our current location is only 700 square feet and we pack it in there, with our crew of 6 and customers it gets quite crowded! 

Directly adjacent to us a 4000 square foot building has recently become available, and we will be moving in soon hopefully with your help! Our goal of $20,000 will help us fill the space with equipment necessary to make the communities dream of a healthy space come true! Equipment needed is:

  • New Point Of Sale system to help with speedy check out and inventory management
  • Check out counter locally made by Trinity Mountain Forest Products from local sustainable timber sources. 
  • Produce displays also locally made by Trinity Mountain Forest Products from local sustainable timber sources. 

Check out the various perks for different funding levels! 

Why Norel Pom?

For years we have struggled to keep items in stock due to our lack of space, our current location is maxed out and we just can not keep up with the demand. With our new location we will be able to better service the community we love with the food and space they deserve! 

You can help!

If you can't contribute financially you can help us by spreading the word! Share us on Facebook or Twitter or come down to the shop!

story:
Hello internets and internets peoples. 

This campain is about a plank with a face, it`s made from wood (sourced from a real tree, but i did not cut it down myself) 

Please view the title of this campain directly below this sentance in fancy sparkling letters :




(these are digital images,not actual planks)

 PLANK!  

 

 ANGRY PLANK!

 

 KEYCHAIN PLANK!             

  KEYCHAIN ANGRY PLANK!





-Wooden plank with a face (this is not a living entity) 

-Fits in your pocket

-Floats on water

-Lays where you put it or stands up when you lean it against something

-Face may wear off over time (the planks, not yours or mine) 

-(arguably) great as a gift or collectors item 

-May cause splinters (handle at your own risk, to be absolutly safe : always wear welders gloves and a full beekeepers uniform.


Planks now come with free crypto currency called PLANK coin!!! (if the campaign is fully funded)


Every plank (with a face) of 10 dollar or more comes with free 25 PLANK coins.

250000 PLANK coins available. First come, first serve! PLANK!


These plank coins can eventually be used to trade on exchanges as well as buy real products online! I have experience with making a crypto currency, my last coin is called Ultracoin and is very succesfull.


Step aside bitcoin, here comes PLANK coin!


More information about the crypto currency here:

https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=802842....



I will buy some tools and build a face stamping machine that will poop these things out at an unbelievable pace with absolutely no regard to detail or quality. this will cost aproximatly 500 dollar, and with the rest of the funding i will buy land with a house on it in an environment with lots of nature like trees and tjirping birds. Then i will live there in peace far away from society and listen to lovely music and eat pizza. I will also start training like in Dragon ball Z (im only level 60 now).


    stretched goal :




      Please share this campain with many friends,contact a large variety of news outlets and buy planks, so i can become wealthy.

      https://twitter.com/plankwithaface

      Big news interviewers such as Larry King can contact me here (interviews only with the purchase of 37 planks )

      plankwithaface@outlook.com


      Why should you trust us?

      The challenges in this project are not great, i know how to cut wood , and make a face in it. I have also mailed packages before so i think this project can be realised if i get the proper funding.

story:
$5000 to provide for the materials needed for the renovation.

A donor has already agreed to match the funds dollar for dollar up to $2500!!

Casa Compasiva is looking to expand into the town of Mitla, making plans to renovate a new clinic, allowing them to serve clients who might not be able to make it all the way to the city. This expansion and renovation is important to provide high quality care to touch the lives of more women as they experience the love of Jesus through the quality care, gospel devotional messages and the parries and love share by our wonderful staff.

The funds raised by this campaign would pay for the supplies needed for the renovation and allow the new clinic to be opened, continuing on with the mission of Casa Compasiva in Mitla.

Glenn & Val Allen and Marlene Affleck are heading down to Mitla September 19th to assist in the renovation of the new satellite clinic.

The Impact

Casa Compasiva has provided quality care and education to women giving birth since January 2011. The faith-based approach has touched the lives of women and their families. Investing in this project, provides health care for women and children, with the ultimate goal of sharing the love of Jesus with each women.

Ellie and Lila have been career long missionaries, with a deep investment in the community that they call home. They have overcome many challenges opening Casa Compasiva and are well-equipped to overcome the hurdles with opening the satellite center in Mitla.

Other Ways You Can Help

Join us in raising awareness for Casa Compasiva’s new clinic in Mitla. Encourage your friends, family, neighbours and co-workers to check out the website and consider partnering with this amazing group. Share this campaign on Facebook and spread the word.

story:
Through LinderKids help a child become a hero, not a statistic.

Ashley Linder, a former foster child and now CrossFit coach and athlete, started LinderKids with the desire to improve the lives of eligible foster youth through fitness and community support. She was removed from an abusive home and spent her formative years in foster care. Within this situation, she was unable to participate in physical activities or benefit from the therapeutic team building dynamic of sports and fitness; undoubtedly one of the best opportunities during this crucial developmental period. While in the Navy she discovered an amazing functional fitness protocol and sport called CrossFit. She fell in love with the positive community culture and the constant continued self-improvements experienced due to hard work and dedication. Thus the idea was planted in her heart to start a foundation that afforded foster children the opportunities she never had and to experience the awesomeness of CrossFit.


Foster children are often robbed the opportunity to participate in sports due to lack of funding, no parental support, or are moved from family to family so often they can't consistently be involved in extracurricular activities. This is where LinderKids comes into action and bridges this unfortunate underprivileged inequality.


Through fitness and community the mission of LinderKids is to improve the lives of eligible foster youth.


After being accepted as a sponsored athlete, each child is connected to their local CrossFit gym with their membership completely covered, proper athletic shoes put on their feet and workout clothes on their backs. Their sponsorship does come with responsibilities on the athlete's part however: On an individual basis they must maintain academic proficiency towards graduation and volunteer a minimum number of community service hours each month.

Here's What We're up Against

  • At any given time there are 473,000 children in foster care in the United States.
  • 99% of these foster youth have sadly been abused
  • Only 50% will receive a high school diploma!
  • 40% of foster youth experience 5 or more placements in a span of 2 years
  • 50% of former foster youth will be homeless during their first two years after leaving foster care
  • State funding only partially covers the cost of BASIC care for foster kids
  • Each year an estimated 20,000 young people "age out" of the system. They are often 18 and still desperately in need of support and services. Studies show that without a lifelong connection to a caring adult these older youth are often left vulnerable to becoming statistics of poor decisions and risky behaviors.

Your Impact:

To love these children is truly the answer. By sponsoring a gym membership we are giving them the gift of a second family, community, structure, compassion, self-discipline and a fighting chance to beat the odds and not become another statistic. By setting academic standards we are positively encouraging a standard of work ethic so they can reap the benefits of playing hard. By encouraging community and selfless service we are showing them the world doesn't run smoothly without teamwork, they can make a difference, and they are not victims and are valued as leaders who are cherished and needed. They are athletes full of potential and they are loved.  We must not let them fall through the cracks due to their unfortunate circumstances and abuse.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's our goal:

  • $12,000 will sponsor 10 athletes for 12 months each, put shoes on their feet, and athletic clothes on their backs
  • Average monthly membership= $90 per athlete
  • Shoe/Clothing cost= $120 per athlete

Here's what you get:

  • Our friends at LALO Sport are proud sponsors of foster children and want to put a comfy LinderKids shirt on your back

LALO Sport has unlocked a formula for success we'd like to share with you:

  • Our friends at MadFitter (an active duty owned company) are another one of our amazing sponsors and want to share with you their Hero Wraps (wrist wraps)

  • They are also sending out their wicked cool, custom kettle bells: Boom Bells



Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if a financial contribution isn't an option for you. As LinderKids grows we will be in need of help from people just like you. If you have a certain skill set, a brilliant idea, connections you'd like to make, or you'd like to donate your valuable time by volunteering we would LOVE to hear from you.

Please take a minute to share this through social media, email, and word of mouth to your friends and family so we can spread awareness about this great cause.

Thank you for your support and for being so awesome!

story:
ST. PETERSBURG -- 

A pedestrian was killed early Friday morning after police said he was hit while walking on Fourth Street N in St. Petersburg.

The crash happened at 1:30 a.m. in the 10600 block of Fourth Street N.

Police said John V. Sullo, 20, was walking in the southbound curb lane when he was hit by a 2007 Infiniti driven by Jason Hawkins, 41.

Police said that shortly before the crash, a Tampa police officer saw Sullo walking in the middle of Fourth Street and told him to move out of the street.  

However, Sullo refused to listen to the officer, so the officer found a St. Petersburg police officer and told him what was going on, the report said.

The St. Petersburg police officer drove up to the crash just as it was happening, the report said. The officers performed CPR until paramedics arrived at the scene.

Sullo was taken to Bayfront Medical Center, where he was pronounced dead at 2:12 a.m.

{{{ That is the article from Baynews9.com }}}

 

November 30th was Johnny's little sisters birthday, and that happened to be the day he was killed.. Their father is a disabled single father of three they were recently evicted from their home of 10 years.. He has absolutley no money to bury his 20 year old boy.. His sister tried to hold a car wash in hopes to raise some money to help thier father fund a buryal. Anything that anyone could give would be of great help and graciously appreciated..

story:
Short Summary

My name is Corrie and I'm putting this campaign together to help my friend Lauren Norinder and her family.  Lauren and I have been friends since we met in Brownies when we were just six years old.  It's still hard for me to believe Lauren's eldest son is fast approaching the age we were when we had first met!

Lauren, her husband Jonas and her two sons live in Babylon on the south shore of Long Island.  As you may have heard, Long Island's south shore took a devastating hit by Hurricane Sandy.  Luckily they had evacuated prior to the storm and were safe, but when they returned they found their home in a state of disrepair.  Over three feet of water flooded the entire house, front to back. 

Following the storm, after assessing the damage the cost of the repairs is overwhelming.  My goal in creating this campaign is to help them raise some funds to lighten the load and relieve a lot of the stress they are currently under.

What We Need & What You Get

The Norinders are in need of financial assistance to make the repairs to rebuild their home.  They've been denied FEMA funding due to them having flood insurance, but the insurance to date won't make a dent in the tens of thousands of dollars they need to fix their house.

Our inital goal is to raise $10,000 to help them make the immediate repairs they need.  This goal may change depending on what their final estimates come in, and we'll update the campaign accordingly.

 

 

The Impact

By donating to help the Norinders, you get the satisfaction of knowing exactly which family receives your Hurricane Sandy Relief donations and how they are being used.

We'll continue to keep this campaign page updated as to the home repair progress, as well as keep all the donors up to date as well.  Your contribution will make a huge impact in their lives, especially for their boys!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, if you could please repost and share this campaign with friends, family and co-workers it would be appreciated!
story_txt:
Short Summary
My name is Corrie and I'm putting this campaign together to help my friend Lauren Norinder and her family.  Lauren and I have been friends since we met in Brownies when we were just six years old.  It's still hard for me to believe Lauren's eldest son is fast approaching the age we were when we had first met!
Lauren, her husband Jonas and her two sons live in Babylon on the south shore of Long Island.  As you may have heard, Long Island's south shore took a devastating hit by Hurricane Sandy.  Luckily they had evacuated prior to the storm and were safe, but when they returned they found their home in a state of disrepair.  Over three feet of water flooded the entire house, front to back. 
Following the storm, after assessing the damage the cost of the repairs is overwhelming.  My goal in creating this campaign is to help them raise some funds to lighten the load and relieve a lot of the stress they are currently under.



What We Need & What You Get
The Norinders are in need of financial assistance to make the repairs to rebuild their home.  They've been denied FEMA funding due to them having flood insurance, but the insurance to date won't make a dent in the tens of thousands of dollars they need to fix their house.
Our inital goal is to raise $10,000 to help them make the immediate repairs they need.  This goal may change depending on what their final estimates come in, and we'll update the campaign accordingly.
 

 


The Impact
By donating to help the Norinders, you get the satisfaction of knowing exactly which family receives your Hurricane Sandy Relief donations and how they are being used.
We'll continue to keep this campaign page updated as to the home repair progress, as well as keep all the donors up to date as well.  Your contribution will make a huge impact in their lives, especially for their boys!
 


Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute, if you could please repost and share this campaign with friends, family and co-workers it would be appreciated!

story:
Meet Jayden!

Jayden is a brave little man who traveled all the way from Austrailia to Chicago for cancer treatment.  Earlier this year, he was diagnosed with ATRT which is one of the most dangerous and agressive brain tumors.  Jayden's family knew the best treatment available would take a miracle or two to obtain.  Through the kindness of family, friends and total strangers, Jayden was able to come to the Procure Proton Therapy Center for a specialized radiation which would ensure his best chances at keeping the healthy tissue in his brain safe.  

Jayden's journey isn't over.  Now he's in the fight of his life facing chemotherapy.  His best chances for survival are if he has access to and a choice in his care.  Jayden needs help again to make sure we get him the best chemotherapy available.  

I'm asking for your help in order to give Jayden a chance to grow and an opportunity in the future his parents are dreaming of.  Any gift, no matter the size, helps get Jayden the care he needs.

story:
About Waste Not Recycled Art

What started as simply wanting to make use of left over scraps from construction projects, has led to collecting wood and recycling "garbage" that would otherwise be sent to the landfill.  We make use of reclaimed wood & building materials, antique & distressed items, common household items, junk mail & magazines, scrap paper, fabric and vintage jewelry... (or anything else we can get our hands on!) turning them into ART & HOME DECOR!

Waste Not Recycled Art created the ORIGINAL Photo Letter Blocks as seen on HGTV, the Martha Stewart and Disney websites, and Bridal Couture and ChildStyle Magazines.  We've received the Wedding Wire Bride's Choice award the last two years, and have had approximately 4000 online sales.

We recently expanded our business to include sales representatives in our hometown and in several other states.  Since launching this new home party division of our company, we've had a huge increase in local business, as well as other communities, and we're growing quickly!  We are one of the only businesses of our kind, to use reclaimed materials and be 100% made in America, so we hope many people are interested in supporting our mission to "ReUse the past, Recycle the present, and Reclaim the future."

 

Community Involvement

Waste Not Recycled Art has been involved in many community activities. We sponsor and coach a local instructional Little League team, have helped our local girl scouts earn their recycling badges, by teaching them how to use junk mail and bottle caps to make paper beads and jewelry, and we had our own team for a local St. Baldrick's fundraising event. We've also donated items and gift certificates for many local charities and school fundraisers.  We are dedicated to our community and to the military families that are a part of our team.  We do our best to balance our family life and our business goals, by having a community presence while including our children in events and activities.

BIG Plans for the FUTURE...

We do have BIG plans for longer term development of our company, that involve expansion, and a new building to accommodate the growth.  We don't want to call it a "manufacturing facility", but rather a design studio for all of our artists to have space for creativity.  Our plan includes building a self- contained and self- supported, environmentally friendly facility.  We have researched the use of solar energy, to power the equipment that we use, and we already use green products in our home and to produce our products.  We have the land right here in our small town, but in order to build what we want and NEED, it would cost over $30K.... SO we will start a bit smaller with this fundraising campaign, to get the materials and supplies that we need, to ignite our PLAN!

Over the last 5 years, Waste Not Recycled Art has grown incredibly!  In our first year we had 83 sales- and it was JUST ME.  I was so excited to have about 200 blocks to make at Christmas time.  This past Christmas we made over 4000 blocks plus hundreds of other items that we've added since we first set up shop.  My husband and I have now partnered up, we have 2 employees & 7 sales reps.

Although we would LOVE to go paper free, the cost to do that would be astronomical.  We have every intention of combining the recycling aspect of our business with innovation to grow in an eco-friendly way, and will NEVER send our products over-seas to save money on manufacturing.


THAT BEING SAID... This is where YOU come in...

We have catalogs that our sales reps use to promote our products.  We reuse them for every party, and we're very selective about where they go.  Unlike other companies who pass them out like they're disposable, we are very careful to keep them in the right hands.  We never solicit business with unnecessary junk mail, or by handing out paper fliers, yet we always run low on all of our marketing tools and supplies!  We would like to design a few more pages, and print more catalogs before the busy holiday season.  We also need another computer, and at least one additional printer to accommodate the growth in sales.  We will be adding a new member to the Waste Not Recycled Art design team, in just a few short weeks!

We also have, in the works, a more user friendly website, that will include a program for our sales reps to add in their party orders, and photos... spreadsheets, email and snailmail just don't cut it anymore, since I spend at least half of my time juggling paperwork instead of creating.... an ARTIST'S NIGHTMARE for sure!  ;)

SO- if you believe it what we do, and our growth potential, please help us get there by contributing to our plan! The goal that we have set, will cover 300 catalogs, a computer (nothing fancy- just equivalent the one I use every day!), one printer (we have to go bigger here, since we need to maintain the quality that we're known for!), the enhancement of our website & the computer program that we've been developing, and a trip to Mexico... JUST KIDDING!  Although great ideas and our catalog WERE born on the balcony while we were on our honeymoon last year!  ;)  Anything above and beyond this amount, will be put to good use, and will get us even closer to our long term goals... so THANK YOU from the bottom of our hearts!

Help spread the word...

If you can't contribute monetarily, send us a message on our Facebook page! LIKE US! Share our campaign and our page with your friends! Word-of-mouth is the highest compliment we can receive so if you appreciate what we've created for you, tell a friend to tell a friend.
 
We would also pick up any construction left overs, scrap wood, or "treasures" that you have, to use in our creations... so just send us a message, and we will get back to you right away!

story:
MY Hair Studio/ swag salon and barber shop

Im looking to open my own design studio to create the best cuts, color, updos and blowouts of your dreams! With the completion of my space it will have the ambiance of elegance with chandeliers over every station and touches of old hollywood glam, each station will have the privateness of sheer curtains to bring down during your color process, from our exclusive color bar.  The shampoo room will be a separate retreat to enjoy a relaxing shampoo and head massage in a dim lit room by sparkling chandeliers above with the soft sounds of spa music in the background in a relaxing lounge chair to put your feet up and enjoy! All while you sip on a little champagne!

And  for the Guys a tribute to back in the day old school barber shop complete with pool table, overstuffed leather couch and vintage inspired barber chair and sink.  Large flat screen TV and Wall Street ticker (just to keep you up to date)! Get that amazing clean shave the only way it should be done, hot towel treatment and all! Even cigars available to enjoy! All in a separate space just for you!

  With this dream come true I can provide what Woodbury has been lacking, an amazing elegant space that meets rugged charm for men and woman alike.  It being the main route to and from for new yorkers to all the best antique shops in the country! Equidistant from Boston and New York, and Washington Depot and Litchfield right up the street, it will bring people from all over, giving support to all our little mom and pop shops Woodbury has to offer!

  I also am wanting to donate a portion of my proceeds to the Susan G. Koman foundation, and St.Jude Research Hospital, two charity's very close to my heart.  This is just something I am wanting to do for the woman and children out there that have suffered from this disease and lost their hair, and a contribution to those that are very close to me that have made it through! 

   Without your help none of my dreams can come true, none of the donations, nothing! It's impossible to get a loan these days without being in business for years prior or putting up my parents house :( So make this happen, I NEED ALL of YOU to pitch in whatever you can PLEASE!! Or there will be ALOT of unhappy people looking for SWAG.  All donations can and will be put towards the equipment of the salon even if I don't reach my goal. 

All the old world charm and ambiance of Woodbury, and all the talent of a Great stylist and her team! With all of YOUR help and confidence in me  I can make make this dream a reality! Even if you can't contribute monitarily you can do so by getting the word out there for me!!!

Happy Pledging and a HUGE THANK YOU!! :)

P.S. the deadline is just after my birthday! So it would be great to reach my goal as the greatest birthday gift ever! To start my design studio! 

Cheers

About ME

  My name is Ayrica lyn Gelinas, I have been a Woodbury resident my whole life and love what the small town has to offer.

  I have been a licensed hairstylist for 11 yrs! Trained at Ricci's Academy of Newtown.  I have worked on 5th Avenue for Christo 5th Ave Salon in NYC for 2+ years working with celebrities and others alike.

  I have become a certified Curly Hair Specialist by one of New York's finest Ouidad, A certified Blow out Specialist by New York's one and only blow a blow dry bar! And have fallen in love with the blow pro product line. 

  A great colorist with the best Wella Color line for the last 6 yrs.

  I have a true passion for hair that just comes naturally to me. You can walk right in and hand me a picture and I can help you achieve that look all the while adding a bit of my own flair to match your unique style and shape! 

  I love creating updos it's just soo much fun for me to be able to manipulate the hair into just about anything! 

  I have been working for a great salon and team for the last 5 years in westport  that has shown me the only way to make your dreams come true is to go after it yourself.  I have the talent and the drive to make this work because I believe in myself. DREAM BIG! There's Just NO other Way!

xoxo AyricaLyn

 <!-- Begin Official PayPal Seal --><a href="https://www.paypal.com/us/verified/pal=ayricaly..." target="_blank"><img src="https://www.paypal.com/en_US/i/icon/verificatio..." border="0" alt="Official PayPal Seal"></A><!-- End Official PayPal Seal -->

story:
What is My Plane Space?

A patent-pending lightweight, portable carry-on that fits right on top of the existing armrests of planes.  It securely fits on armrests of all plane sizes and is just the right height to keep the person sitting next to you from elbowing you and crowding your space.  It will be your new "can't fly without" product!

What is the story behind this?

We are frequent fliers and were tired of always being elbowed by the person sitting in the middle seat.  It is common courtesy to give the middle seat occupant use of both armrests; but everyone has encountered the experience of their seatmate's arms and/or elbows coming across the armrest and jabbing you.  We saw a need - and invented a product to fill that need!  Keep your seat space (and sanity) with My Plane Space.

What will the money be used for?

We are ready to move this product into mass production using plastic injection molding.  We are committed to keeping production in the United States. After we receive enough pre-orders through indiegogo.com, we will immediately begin production and get you a My Plane Space as quickly as possible. 

Have you tested this product?

Yes, My Plane Space has received rave reviews!  It has been tested on many flights, regionally and cross-country.  It is a lifesaver!  You no longer have to dread who sits next to you, or receive accidental elbow jabs while your seatmate reads or works on their laptop.  We have received much interest from people when they see it and they always want to know where they can buy one.  The people in the middle seat say it's more comfortable than the regular armrest and it's nice not to get in each other's space. 

Do airlines allow this on board?

Yes, we worked with the FAA to ensure it meets all requirements.  It easily fits in any carry-on bag (doesn't take up very much space at all) and flight attendants have provided unsolicited feedback that it's such a great idea!  It doesn't block any exits or obscure any functions, so there's no problems at all!  You can use it on any flight!

Do I still have an armrest?

Yes, you still have an armrest to use.  You don't have to fight over the middle armrest with a My Plane Space - you graciously give use of the middle armrest to the person sitting next to you.  Which, like many other people, we always give the person in the middle seat the armrest anyway because there's still another one and we all know it sucks to be stuck in the middle.  My Plane Space is actually praised by people sitting in the middle seat as the part that fits over the armrest is padded (much more comfortable than the standard hard armrest).  So, you get to stop the elbows and ride in comfort without it being an uncomfortable or tense situation!

What if I don't fly, can I still help?

Yes, even if you don't fly and are not able to donate, it would be greatly appreciated if you could share this campaign with everyone you know.  With 4 million people flying every day, it is likely your co-workers, friends, and/or family use air travel and would love to have a My Plane Space.

We appreciate your support in revolutionizing airline travel with My Plane Space!

story: Myself and three other Youth Workers are taking a group of Young people to Rwanda in October. We are hoping to raise enough money to help build two classrooms on to a local school and to volunteer in an ever growing orphanage! We are also going to be working first hand with the families of the Genocide victims. This will be an amazing and life changing experience for all. Here is a link to our fund raising page, every penny counts and any extra we make goes towards the rest of the build ;) thank you so much xx History - “Rwanda School Aid” was a locally set up charity to send a group of young people and adults from North Berwick to Rwanda in 2009, the group worked hard together to improve a Rwandan community and they helped to build a playground which massively improved the local children’s experience. The group who went to Rwanda came back with a new outlook on life and it was obvious that this opportunity had been a life changing one for many of the British participants, not only did they learn about the Rwandan culture and history, they formed relationships with locals and some of the group members continue to return to Rwanda to continue to support them and their community through improvement.This has been an inspiration to send another youth group to Rwanda in 2012 through North Berwick Youth Cafe. some of these young people may not have otherwise engaged in a project of this scale. • The group will learn team building, planning and some DIY skills • This is a life changing opportunity for all involved • It may open door for return visits • The team will build relationships with one another, staff and the Rwandan community • The list could be endless and these are benefits which we see happening, we do believe that the change in each young person will be the greatest benefit. • And we as an organisation are here to support, give advice, opportunities, invest in our young people, give them ownership of a project and give the chance of a fantastic project to young people who may not otherwise get involved. Benefits to the Rwandan community • Improved living through the improvements we make • Links with British workers and young people • Opportunities for young people to visit Rwanda again if you want to know any more about the project please do not hesitate to contact us. http://www.northberwickyouthcafe.org.uk Thank all so much and remember what a difference this will make to this community! xxx

We are hoping to raise enough money to help build two classrooms on to a local school and to volunteer in an ever growing orphanage! We are also going to be working first hand with the families of the Genocide victims. This will be an amazing and life changing experience for all. Here is a link to our fund raising page, every penny counts and any extra we make goes towards the rest of the build ;) thank you so much xx History - “Rwanda School Aid” was a locally set up charity to send a group of young people and adults from North Berwick to Rwanda in 2009, the group worked hard together to improve a Rwandan community and they helped to build a playground which massively improved the local children’s experience. The group who went to Rwanda came back with a new outlook on life and it was obvious that this opportunity had been a life changing one for many of the British participants, not only did they learn about the Rwandan culture and history, they formed relationships with locals and some of the group members continue to return to Rwanda to continue to support them and their community through improvement.This has been an inspiration to send another youth group to Rwanda in 2012 through North Berwick Youth Cafe. some of these young people may not have otherwise engaged in a project of this scale. • The group will learn team building, planning and some DIY skills • This is a life changing opportunity for all involved • It may open door for return visits • The team will build relationships with one another, staff and the Rwandan community • The list could be endless and these are benefits which we see happening, we do believe that the change in each young person will be the greatest benefit. • And we as an organisation are here to support, give advice, opportunities, invest in our young people, give them ownership of a project and give the chance of a fantastic project to young people who may not otherwise get involved. Benefits to the Rwandan community • Improved living through the improvements we make • Links with British workers and young people • Opportunities for young people to visit Rwanda again if you want to know any more about the project please do not hesitate to contact us. http://www.northberwickyouthcafe.org.uk Thank all so much and remember what a difference this will make to this community! xxx

story:
Hi, I'm Josh Hall, the founder of YSAcentral. My brother Spencer and I and our development team have spent almost 3 years working full time creating YSAcentral for LDS young and mid-single adults (check out the video above!). It's been our mission to unite together LDS singles all over the world and make communication and socializing simple to help keep our hope alive and the fire burning.


But we need your help to finish this much needed website. YSAcentral is 90% complete, without your financial contribution and your help spreading the word, we'll be forced to stop development and won't be able to launch it.


Up to this point, the entire YSAcentral project has been paid for by me personally at great sacrifice. Why? Because no YSA website existed that helps LDS singles overcome their unique challenges and I felt very strongly that one needed to be built. But sadly, due to conditions outside my control, I can't afford to finish the last 10% of development without your help. YSAcentral is an amazing and very robust social platform that requires money and a team of developers. If we don't reach our fundraising goal, YSAcentral is not going to happen.


This is where you come in and how you can help make it happen for millions of LDS singles like yourself or those singles that you know and love! We must reach our fundraising goal and in order to do so, I need you to do 2 simple but extremely important things:

Keep Our Hope Alive and Our Fire Burning

For us singles, our happiness and our desire to be our best selves is heavily influenced by our social situation and our outlook on our social opportunities. Out of all the things that we need as LDS singles, a social network that unites us all together online and offline is by far most needed to help keep our hope alive and keep the fire burning within us during this difficult period of our lives (see video).


Loss of Hope Brings Loss of Spirituality

For most YSAs, their greatest desire is to be married. Since marriage and the gospel are so intertwined together, when the hope of finding an ideal eternal companion is lost or seems unlikely, faith that once burned brightly now grows dim and their desire to live the gospel begins to fade and some, far too often, fall away. When opportunities are limited or non-existent in their own ward, being stuck socializing exclusively within that same small group of people month after month causes many to lose hope.


New Opportunities Bring New Hope

Hope of friendship, eternal marriage and a burning desire to live the gospel can be strengthened or restored when YSAs are able to frequently attend social activities where they can consistently and easily meet new people, see fresh faces, and have invigorating social interactions with singles from other wards in the area. YSAcentral makes this happen by breaking down communication barriers and makes socializing simple.


All YSAs Will Be Included, Involved & Accounted For

YSAs need to be social, to be spiritual, to be united and they need to belong; they need their own unique social network to unite around, be empowered and be touched by inspirational and spiritual messages while they are communicating online. Priesthood leaders will be more electronically enabled to more effectively serve, connect with, strengthen, communicate with and keep track of their young single adults of today.


A Social Network Built for LDS Singles by LDS Singles: Unites Everyone & Everything in One Spot

Being LDS and single, your lifestyle and social needs are very unique and differ greatly from the world's. It's not easy. We know! We're frustrated YSAs too! So we've built a website exclusively for YSAs and what we need:

  • Every YSA, every activity, every announcement and all the social action within your entire region.
  • Communication tools, uplifting & entertaining content, helpful info, regional directories, and more.
  • Accessible anytime, anywhere and always up-to-date. Complete social information in real-time.
  • No more social barriers. No more social despair. No more being excluded. YSAs are united!
  • It's all in one spot; from activities to adventures, rides to roommates, hope to humor, dating ideas to making friends, you'll be enhanced personally, strengthened spiritually and enabled temporally.

You will be helping create something that enables, empowers and gives us hope! YSAcentral and MSAcentral, the platform specifically for mid-singles, will bless & enrich the lives of millions of singles for decades to come.


You can join this great cause by clicking the "contribute" button now. Whether it's $5 or 5,000, your contribution and efforts in spreading the word will make a huge difference. You will be happy knowing that you personally helped create something that makes our lives better and more vibrant. Will you join me and help make it happen for us LDS singles?

Website Platform Exclusively for YSAs

YSAcentral is a website platform exclusively for LDS singles and their leaders; structured and partitioned geographically using designations called Social Regions.


Unites Thousands of YSAs Together in One Big Social Circle within Social Regions

Social Regions are made up of all the YSAs attending wards within their boundaries.


Centralizes Everyone and Everything Geographically

Each Social Region gets their own self-contained website to allow everyone to get plugged-in and using the same communication platform, keeping all the information, communications, activities and events happening all around the Social Region centralized and easily accessible in one central spot.

Interactive Social Network

YSAcentral is a safe, secure and centralized social network for YSAs to interactively exchange information, plan, socialize, learn, laugh, find, share and spark friendships; all designed to get them offline and socializing in person with a feeling of unity and confidence.

Activity Planning System

YSAcentral Activity Wizard is
an integrated activity planning, promoting & management system for activities big or small. It makes average activities amazing!

Communication Tool

YSAcentral facilitates easy and real-time communication between everyone living within the same Social Region.

Platform for Hobby & Recreational Groups

YSAcentral is a centralized platform for creating, managing and discovering hobby & recreational YSA groups of any kind, including service projects. All in ONE spot!


YSAs will be able to find and meet up with other YSAs from all around their region that also enjoy the same interests and recreational hobbies. Whether it's biking, basketball, learning to quilt, jogging or joining a service project, every group can be found in one spot. Adventure starts here!

Housing & Roommate Listings

YSAcentral is a real-time, centralized housing & roommate listing service exclusively for LDS YSAs. For those with rooms to rent, they can post their ad anytime with photos & video. For those looking for a room, they can view what's available world-wide in real-time, 24/7.



It's All For YSAs and It's All In One Spot

YSAcentral aggregates and organizes content that's uplifting, inspiring, helpful and relevant to YSAs and to their challenges as LDS singles, and makes it all easily accessible in just ONE spot.

Leadership Communication Channel

YSAcentral is a communication channel for church leaders to uplift, strengthen and directly communicate with YSAs.

Facebook Friends Updated Automatically

Oh yeah, did we mention that you can share your thoughts, photos and adventures on both Facebook and YSAcentral simultaneously so everyone is always up-to-date? We like making things simple.

Help Us Help You

Without your efforts in spreading the word, we will not be able to reach our goal. To do so, we need you to take a minute to encourage members of your ward, your family and your friends all over the world to contribute by sharing the URL link to this fundraiser page. At the very least, they'll be interested in knowing about YSAcentral.


Those who are single, or know and love someone who is single will gladly want to contribute to help make this great cause happen, so please don't be shy in spreading the word! It's so easy!


EASY Ways to Spread the Word

  • Click the facebook "Like" button (below the video)
  • Email the link (click here or just copy & paste it)
  • Post the link on Facebook & Email all your Facebook friends
  • Post on your Blog or Twitter
Tips for Success
  1. Write a personal comment when sharing on facebook or clicking the "Like" button. This makes the post show up for more of your friends. Without personal comments, posts are ranked very low by facebook and often aren't displayed to friends.
  2. Re-post the url link on facebook frequently. It often takes several reminders for us to act.
  3. Tell everyone: singles, married, members & non-members. YSAcentral is REALLY needed outside the U.S. so please make sure you tell your mission companions, etc. so at least they know about it.

Still need more incentive to help spread the word? How about every time a friend or family member visits this fundraiser page by clicking on your personal referral link you've shared with them, you earn points towards winning awesome prizes & gifts provided by our partners! Enjoy the prizes yourself or give them as gifts.


Earning prizes is easy. Just click on the "Get My Link" button below and you'll get your own personal referral link that you can use to help spread the word to all your friends, family and Ward members on facebook, email, your blog and text messages.


Your personal referral link goes directly to this page, but it's unique to you so we can keep track of your referral points. You can track how many points you've earned each day and see how you stack up with others helping spread the word. You can even make this a friendly competition in your Ward to see who can spread the word to the most people!


Check out a few of our awesome prizes below. To be eligible for the top prizes, we must reach our fundraising goal. With your help we can do it! Thank you so much for spreading the word!

Your much needed contribution will be used to complete the final 10% of development and for expenses related to launching this amazing social platform and communication tool.


Out of the $60k, we will be receiving $55,560 after deducting processing fees (Paypal 2.9% + .30 per trans. and Indiegogo 4%).

Use of funds based on reaching our $60k goal:

  • Payment processing fees deducted by Paypal & Indiegogo: $4,440
  • Payroll for our 6 person development team (3 months): $35,000
  • Servers, development tools & operating expenses: $20,560

We would love to have passionate people like you help make YSAcentral be amazing in anyway you can. There are many ways you can help, but we especially would appreciate passionate and committed volunteers to help in the following areas:

  • Web Development:
    PHP Expert (min. 8hrs per week committment)
  • Graphic Design
  • MySQL Database Optimization
  • Official YSAcentral Reps to help promote and roll-out YSAcentral in their area

If you are passionate about making amazing things happen and changing the world, we'd love to have you be a part of our awesome volunteer team. To learn more about becoming a volunteer, click the link below:

story:
Hi everyone,

                      We are the Reyes Family, Myself (Christopher) My Wife (Crystal) And My Daughter (Carli). We Just bought our first RV, Currently I work full time as a tow truck driver, and my wife stays at home with our daughter and home schools her. Our goal and dream is too Get into full time RV'ing by next spring, But still stay local for awhile, As i am also getting my online business started, Which might take a little bit, We are a happy little family who love to travel and now get to do it in our RV.


The RV we chose is a 1995 Fleetwood Southwind Storm, A great little find with only minor things that needed to be done to it, Our goal with this funding is to add additional power for off grid parking and RV'ing, A 480 watt solar power system installed And add two additional batteries for the power system. As well as getting the generator in tip top shape as it does need to be looked at.

We are by far rich or close to it,  I am a Military veteran and my wife used to be a CNA, We are just a regular middle class family, trying to live the dream, With your help no matter how much, Even a share will help.


I will make a personal video with me and my family after to thank all backers of this project.


All funding will go directly to getting these items for the RV. And help us one step closer to our dream.


Products to be purchased:

Go Power! Solar Extreme Complete Solar and Inverter System with 480 Watts of Solar.

Cost= $3,679.99 on Amazon

Trojan T105-RE Renewable Energy 6V GC2 Deep Cycle Battery 225Ah

Cost= $200.00 x 2 From local distributor.


Thank you for everyone in advanced in any contribution that is given, Every little bit helps.

The Reyes Family.

story:
You find yourself in a back market in Kowloon, Hong Kong. As you look over edible bizarrities like fish lips, snake bile, or jelly turtle soup — despite your apprehension, you are curious as to which delicacy would be most rewarding. 

Any traveler has encountered this circumstance at least once, even in downtown LA trying to decide if a lengua taco is palatable. You could always depend upon the eenie-meenie-minee-moe tactic to select your dish, due to your inability to make sense of the language or meal descriptions, or you could take a more educated approach and log onto TravelGrub.com.

Launched in 2013, TravelGrub provides users with an international food database with ratings and reviews of dishes from all over the world.

TravelGrub can not only be used in helping one pick out a dish but also in spelling, pronunciation and a source of ingredients for allergies or food-related sensitivities. Users have the chance to be their own food critique, rate the dishes and write their own reviews.

How It Works


Once on Travelgrub.com, you can either use the search bar or the interactive map to find the dish or region you’re looking for.

For instance, say you’re traveling to Bolivia. First, you’d click South America on the map, before narrowing in on the country.  From there you could select a particular kind of food (i.e. Dairy), or, if you’re looking to see the complete selection, click ‘All.’

Then, you’d go to the bottom of the page and select ‘Start Search.’  From there, you’d be presented with an array of different dishes, some with descriptions and reviews already in place.  By clicking on them, one can see how different users have  tried the same dishes, what they liked and disliked, traits of the dish, and their overall rating.  Users can assign each dish a food score and the scores are averaged within the region to show what the most popular dishes are anywhere in the world. If you’re like me, a visual of the food helps me in my decisions, and many of the reviews are sure to include one.

Our Impact

TravelGrub can change the way the world sees food when we travel. With 257 countries and over 24,000 food entries, TravelGrub is a place where travelers and food enthusiasts can find truly local and must-have dishes anywhere in the world based on reviews from people just like you. Now, what makes us different from Yelp?

TravelGrub is more about the dishes themselves in a country and how they fit into the culture, not about specific restaurants that serve the local cuisine. TravelGrub was created to enhance and compliment one's overall travel experience.

We provide the necessary information one may need whether it be ingredients, pronunciation of the dish or even how to place your order. 

No longer will one be stuck, pointing at a menu guessing what to order. With TravelGrub's vast database, travelers can confidently order, try exciting new dishes anywhere in the world and know the local authentic must-have delicacies of any region!

Use Of Funds

  • Website Development & Improvement
  • App Development
  • Design Mobile App Screens
  • Develop the Back-end
  • Test
  • Deploy

What We Need & What You Get

TravelGrub has come a long way with as tight of a budget as possible in an effort to prove the concept. Now that we have seen how popular this idea is with little to no marketing or media exposure, we know that with the team we have now, we can develop a state of the art website and app all with a little extra help.

Our idea will change the way we travel and see food! We want to help the world understand and identify the must-have dishes anywhere in the world and with your help and donation can we do so. Think of us as the TripAdvisor of food, anywhere you go! How useful is that?!

With your help we're hoping to raise enough funds to turn the already popular TravelGrub.com into a modern and more user friendly website and develop a mobile app for international foodies on the go. That way, wherever users are they can access TravelGrub!

What Can You Do To Help?

We need funding and social media support! In return, investors will not only end up with a great app but they will also be able to follow our progress as the company grows. Not to mention access to our soon-to-be TravelGrub (TG) Pocket Guides which include anything and everything about delicious foods from any country in the world.

Use the Indiegogo share tools to help TravelGrub get the word out about our latest campaign. Remember, if you have travel plans on the horizon, visit TravelGrub.com to get an idea of all the dishes you’d like to try.

Don't forget to like and follow us for the latest info on all things food-related.

Like Us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Travelgrubcom

Send us a tweet: @TravelGrub

Instagram: http://instagram.com/travelgrub

For any comments, questions, concerns: Contact Forrest at forrestgalante@gmail.com
Twitter: @ForrestGalante

    Our Story 

    My name is Forrest Galante. Exploring and traveling the world has been a big part of my life and is one of my greatest passions. Growing up in Harare, Zimbabwe, I spent time exploring the depths of the African safari. Furthering my interests in the outdoors and primitive survival in my studies I have traveled to over 36 countries. I even stripped down to my skinnies to become a competitor on Discovery Channel's hit show, "Naked and Afraid" last fall.

    I believe travel provides an opportunity to open yourself up to new ideas and to let go of your culinary inhibitions. From my experiences, I wanted to provide other explorers like myself with a resource based on their location anywhere in the world. A place where they could share their dining experiences  and provide their thoughts to better prepare others.

    The entire TravelGrub team has worked tirelessly to get to where we are now. As a labor of love for this project, everyone has worked for free and completely out of pocket to help people all over the world have amazing culinary experiences. By donating to the campaign, you will show us that you believe in our product as well and that you want to help share the love of exotic and exciting food.

    The biggest challenge when starting any business like this is getting the word out there, we believe this concept sells itself, but people need to find out about it in order for it grow! So help us get the word out! :)

    Eat on. #travelgrub
